loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe is 48 years old and married with four children, ages 6 to 20. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past five years. Her husband also is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers to harvest maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvest maize.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying a washing machine to provide an additional service for her customers. Hoa's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business and buy a washing machine to better serve her customers

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung is a 59-year-old married man. He lives with his four children and wife in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn money selling clothes.

Hung would like a loan to purchase a variety and quantity of clothes for his shop. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional customers. 

He also hopes that through his loan, he will be able to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety and quantity of clothes

loans.name: Nhi

texts.en:
Nhi is requesting a new loan to buy metal for producing nuts and bolts. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity, and sales.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and increase her income, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy metal for producing nuts and bolts.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is 48 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a security guard. Anh operates a business selling breads and pork in front of her house, which she has been doing for four years. 

Ahn is requesting a loan, which she will use to repair her food cart and to buy more breads and better quality food to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her food cart and purchase more breads and other food

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is 47 years old and divorced with one child. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She has been running a general store to earn a living.

She started her business 13 years ago. She intends to use the loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of products, such as snack foods and beverages to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of products, such as snack foods and beverages to sell from her store

loans.name: Tai

texts.en: Cuong is requesting another loan, which he will use to buy motorcycle parts to stock his store. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business, processing capacity and sales. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business and his income and improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle parts to stock his store

loans.name: Vi

texts.en:
Vi is a 65-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and three sons in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife earns money running a general store. For many years Vi has supported his family by running a business of processing iron and making metal products.

Vi would like a loan to purchase materials to make metal products. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and to attract additional customers. 

He also hopes that through his loan he will be able to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make metal products

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: MODESTO VICTOR: Es un señor de  33 años de edad, amable y luchador, originario de Waspam, se trasladó a Puerto Cabezas hace 12 años buscando mejores condiciones de vida y laborales. Está casado con 3 hijos: 1 adolescente que estudia su cuarto grado de primaria y 2 menores de edad. Está solicitando su primer préstamo para reparar las paredes de madera de su casa donde habita desde hace 10 años con sus hijos y esposa. Con el préstamo podrá comprar madera cepillada, clavos, cubrir costos de mano de obra y ampliar su vivienda de tambo y madera. Su sueño es  brindarle a su familia una vivienda más segura y en buenas condiciones.
texts.en: Modesto is a 33 year old gentleman, he is friendly and hardworking. He originates from Waspam, and moved to Puerto Cabezas 12 years ago in search of better living and working conditions. He is married with three children, one teenager who is studying fourth grade of primary, and two younger children. He is asking for his first loan to repair the wooden walls of the house where he has lived for 10 years with his children and wife. With the loan he will be able to buy planed timber, nails, cover the labour costs and extend his home built of stilts and wood. His dream is to offer his family a more secure home in a good condition.

loans.use: to buy planed timber, nails, cover the labour costs and extend his home built of stilts and wood.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret sells soda and beer on a relatively large scale. She is apparently challenged by limited capital that limits her sales, and yet if she bought more, she would have increased profits.

She has therefore approached UGAFODE to borrow money so that she can stock in bulk, since she supplies the village and much more when there are functions.

Margret is hardworking and focused and looks forward to having a big depot of these drinks. She appreciates Kiva’s and UGAFODE’s support.

loans.use: to buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Irma

texts.es: Blanca de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una tienda desde hace algunos años el cual está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar su negocio, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de de huevos, sopas, café, aceite, refrescos,  etc. para poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 58-year old Blanca lives with her family in her own house. She has run a store located in her home for several years and has many customers especially her neighbours. With the money she earns from sales, Blanca manages to pay for household expenses. She is seeking a loan to buy eggs, soup, coffee, oil, and soft drinks etc. so she can earn more money and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy eggs, soup, coffee, oil, and soft drinks etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy sacks of maize and lime

loans.name: Mnatsakan

texts.en:
Mnatsakan is a farmer who lives in Ddmashen, a village in the Gegharkunik region. Here he lives with his wife, who is unemployed and always ready to help her husband on their farm.

Mnatsakan used to work as a cook at different restaurants, but now he takes care of livestock to make a living. On his farm he has cows, bulls, sheep, and a lot of chickens. His farm produces milk, meat and eggs for sale. Mnatsakan’s wife mainly sells it right from their house to their regular customers.

Mnatsakan especially wants to increase their meat sales. He hopes that Kiva lenders will help him to buy one more bull for his farm and also animal fodder for all of his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more bull for his farm as well as animal fodder for all of his farm cattle

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 52 years old and married with five children. With her five children still in school, Asuncion works very hard to provide for them.

Asuncion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, rice, and other personal care products.

Asuncion has been in this business for six years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, rice, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Taguhi

texts.en: Taguhi, which in Armenian means "queen," is 22 years old, married and has a newborn daughter. Taguhi’s husband is 26 years old and together they are farming and raising livestock. Taguhi has cows, calves, sheep, lambs and chickens. She sells her farm’s milk, cheese, meat and eggs, and the income covers her family's considerable needs. Taguhi greatly hopes that Kiva and Nor Horizon will provide a loan of 450.000 Armenian drams. Taguhi plans to use the loan to buy a calf, two sheep and also cattle fodder.

loans.use: To buy one calf, two sheep and also cattle fodder.

loans.name: Arpine

texts.en:
This pretty and nice lady’s name is Arpine. She lives with her two little boys and beloved husband in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region.

Arpine very properly takes care of her house, family, and farm as well. She is 27 years old, and she is rather skilled in the care of cattle that she has: cows, bull, pigs, piglets, sheep, and lambs. Arpine’s husband is employed and works at a gas station, but he has enough time to help his beloved wife with farm care.

From her farm, Arpine sells milk, cheese, macun (national dairy product), meat, and eggs. Arpine mentions that she likes and cares for her farm very much and hopes that during the years she will be able to make it bigger, so her family will earn more profit from it.

She will be happy to receive this loan, as she wants to buy one more cow and also animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and also animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 28 years old, married and has a 2-year-old child who does not yet go to school. He is a farmer who has been growing maize for the past eight years. With the loan from Kiva, Theogene would like to pay workers to harvest maize. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and to buy a cow.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers to harvest maize.

loans.name: Denys

texts.en:
Denys is 51 years old, married and has seven children ages 7 to 20 with six in school. He is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past eight years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers to harvest maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers to harvest maize.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 43 years old. He is married with five children aged between 7 and 17 years old who all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past five years, while his wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Khoa

texts.en:
Khoa is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as travel shampoos and toys for kids, to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers.

His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products.

He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and increasing sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of products, such as travel shampoos and toys for kids, to sell in his store.

loans.name: Athanasie

texts.en:
Athanasie is 54 years old. She is married with three children ranging in age between 21 and 28 years old. Two of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past 17 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 41 years old. She is married with six children ranging in age between eight and 23 years old. They all go to school. She is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past eight years. Her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a goat. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Danh

texts.en: Danh is requesting a new loan to purchase chairs and better-quality tools for hair cutting to better serve his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his barber business, its capacity and sales. He hopes that his new loan will help him increase the size of his business and increase his income, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and better-quality tools for hair cutting.

loans.name: Chiu

texts.en:
Chiu is 58 years old and single. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns income through weaving.

She started her business four years ago. She intends to take a loan to buy raw material to produce many kinds of string and thread to sell to her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy material to produce many kinds of string and thread to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dinh

texts.en:
Dinh is 34 years old and married. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is working as a mason. Dinh earns income through sewing fabric mats.

She started her business six years ago. She intends to take a loan to buy fabric to produce many kind of mats to provide to her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric to produce many kind of mats to provide to her customers.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Huyen is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en:
Trinh is 46 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a carpenter. For 15 years, she operates a business selling cakes and incense.

Trinh requested a loan, which she will use to purchase bamboo and materials for making incense and better quality appliances for making cakes. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers.  She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo and materials for making incense and better quality appliances for making cakes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy essential food items.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue, a 51-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a worker in a local company. She has two children. She runs a general store that sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community.

Hue requests a loan to purchase more products to stock her store, such as soaps, candies, snack foods, washing powder, and shampoos. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. 

She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more products to stock her store, such as soaps, candies, snack foods, washing powder, and shampoos.

loans.name: Thuong

texts.en:
Thuong, a 38-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a businessman. She has three children. She runs a general store that sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community.

Thuong requests a loan to purchase more products, such as snack foods, washing powder and a quantity of beverages, to stock her store. That will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers.

She hopes her business will run smoothly and that she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more products, such as snack foods, washing powder and a quantity of beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.fr: Jean de Dieu est un homme de 48 ans marié et père de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 3 et 15 ans. il est coordonnier et a ouvert son atelier dans un quartier dans un quartier de la place depuis 12 ans. C'est grace à, ces revenus qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa famille. il sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter le stock de son matériel de travail ceci l'aidera à aller plus vite avec ses commandes. les benefices générés seront réinvestis dans son actiivité pour l'agrandir.
texts.en: Jean de Dieu is a 48 year old married man and father of four children, whose ages range from 3 to 15 years old. He is a cobbler and he opened his shop 12 years ago in a neighborhood by the plaza. Thanks to his revenues, he is able to meet his family's needs. He is requesting this loan to increase the supply of his working materials. This will help him to work through his tasks more quickly. The profits attained will be reinvested in his business for growth.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials to finish his family's residential house.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Lydia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys is 55 years old. He is married with seven children, aged 13 through 28 years. They all go to school. He is a farmer, and he has been growing maize for the past five years, while his wife is a businesswoman.

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers for growing maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing maize.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is 62 years old and single with children. Bibiana works very hard to provide for them.

Bibiana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as coffee, milk, sugar, canned goods, spices, noodles, bread, cooking oil, and personal care products.

Bibiana has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as coffee, milk, sugar, canned goods, spices, noodles, bread, cooking oil, and personal care products.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 27 years old. She is married with two children between 1 and 4 years old. They do not yet go to school. She is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past 4 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who grow maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who grow maize.

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.en:
Sylvie is 40 years old. She is married with five children aged between 3 and 14 years old, three of whom go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past seven years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of sachet water and sell it to increase her income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase calling credit.

loans.name: Malgrekatonewende Saidou Group

texts.fr:
Mr SAIDOU est responsable du groupe MALGREKATONEWENDE SAIDOU. Marié, il est père de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 05ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. Personne ne va  à l’école. Il a 04personnes en charge.
Mr fait le maraichage et  l’élevage depuis 20ans. Il s’approvisionne au  barrage dans un village environnant.
Il veut s’acheter 08sacs d’engrais et 03boites d’herbicide.
Mr veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour payer la scolarité de ses enfants et payer une moto pour sa femme. Il ambitionne bien construire sa maison d’habitation et renouveler sa moto.
texts.en:
Mr. SAIDOU is the head of the MALGREKATONEWENDE SAIDOU group. He is married with two children aged 2 and 5 who do not yet go to school. He supports four people. 

Saidou has been a market gardener and breeder for 20 years. He buys his supplies at a dam in a nearby village. He plans to purchase 8 sacks of fertilizers and 3 cartons of herbicide.

Saidou will use his profits to support his children’s tuition and to buy a motorcycle for his wife. His goals are to build a house and to buy himself a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of fertilizers and 3 cartons of herbicide.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung, 48, is married and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Nhung started her business of raising and selling potted plants eleven years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more and different potted plants and fertilizer. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and more and different potted plants to raise and sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 46 years old and married with two children.

Amalia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as coffee, milk, sugar, canned goods, spices, noodles, bread, cooking oil and other personal care products.

Amalia has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

Amalia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as coffee, milk, sugar, canned goods, spices, noodles, bread, cooking oil and other personal care products.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Carmen requested a loan of 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Carmen has been in this business for 5 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando is married and he works hard to support his family.

He has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a passenger tricycle. Armando is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Armando has been sustaining his business activities through his past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. Armando hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elicita

texts.en:
Elicita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making dried fish in the Philippines.

Elicita requested a loan of 8,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fish, sacks of salt, and other materials for her business.

Elicita has been in this business for 20 years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, sacks of salt, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a vulcanizing shop. Concepcion is borrowing 27,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Concepcion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Arahama est la cliente qui tient en main la corne du bélier.
Agée de quarante-sept ans (47 ans), Arahama est une emboucheuse malienne des ovins (béliers). Mariée et  mère de cinq (05) enfants dont trois(03) écoliers niveau secondaire. Arahama rêve et espère dans les jours à venir prendre en charge toutes les dépenses de ses enfants et de leur payer un terrain d’habitation dans une grande ville. Elle n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école mais elle se débrouille bien dans son activité. Arahama a fait recourt au RMCR pour acheter plus de béliers. Elle s’approvisionne aux foires hebdomadaires de sa zone. Avec son prêt de cent cinquante mille francs CFA(150 000FCFA), elle a acheté quatre (04) têtes de bélier à cent mille francs CFA (100 000FCFA), vingt mille francs CFA (20 000 francs CFA) pour leurs soins vétérinaires et aliments bétails et les trente mille francs CFA(30 000 francs CFA) pour acheter  trois (03) sacs de riz paddy. Elle engraisse les béliers pendant un certain temps et les revendre, décortique le riz paddy et revendre les grains. Arahama fait ses ventes aux mêmes foires hebdomadaires de sa zone. Elle fait des bénéfices de quarante-cinq mille francs CFA (45 000 francs CFA) environ par cycle de prêt. Arahama fait l’embouche des ovins depuis cinq (05 ans). Arahama ne se plaint pas pour le déroulement de son activité.
texts.en:
Arahama, age 47, is from Mali. She is married with five children, three of them in secondary school. She has been fattening sheep for five years, and she is the one holding on to the ram in the group photo. She never had the opportunity to go to school, but she is doing well in her activity. 

Arahama’s hope and dream is to be able to fully support her children and to buy them some land to live on in a large city. She partnered with RMCR to buy more rams, which she gets at local weekly fairs. With her loan of 150,000FCFA, she will buy four rams for 100,000FCFA and she will pay 20,000FCFA for animal feed and veterinary services; the remaining 30,000FCFA will be used to buy three sacks of paddy rice.

Arahama fattens the sheep for a while and sells them. She shells the paddy rice and sells the grains. She conducts her sales at the same local weekly fairs. 

She makes an average profit of 45,000FCFA per loan cycle. She has no complaints about her activity.

loans.use: to buy rams and paddy rice for resale.

loans.name: Fanny Anileth

texts.es: FANNY ANILETH: Es una mujer alegre que pertenece a la etnia miskita, tiene 38 años de edad, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, casada con 3 hijos: dos adolescentes que estudian su primaria y un pequeño de 3 años de edad.  Desde hace 13 años habita en una vivienda de tambo y madera. Con el propósito de construir poco a poco su vivienda de concreto, solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar: cemento, zinc, clavos. Ella sueña con brindarles a su familia una vivienda con las condiciones adecuadas y mayor seguridad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
FANNY ANILETH is a happy woman of Miskito ethnicity. She is 38 years old, married with three children, and is from Puerto Cabezas. Two of her children are teenagers and are in school, and the third one is three years old. 

For the past 13 years she has lived in a stilt house made of wood.She is asking for her first loan for the purpose of building a concrete house little by little. She will buy cement, metal roofing, and nails. She dreams of providing a more comfortable and safe home for her family.

loans.use: to build her concrete house little by little.

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Mamou est la cliente qui tient la corne du bélier en main.
Agée de quarante-sept ans (47 ans), Mamou est une emboucheuse malienne des ovins. Veuve, mère de trois enfants tous écoliers (fondamentale et secondaire). Mamou n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école mais elle se défend beaucoup dans son activité. Mamou a fait recourt au RMCR pour soutenir et développer ses activités d’embouche. Elle achète ses béliers dans les foires hebdomadaires de sa zone. Avec son prêt de cent soixante mille francs CFA (160 000), elle a acheté quatre (04) têtes de bélier à cent quarante mille francs (140 000 F CFA) et les vingt mille francs (20 000 F CFA) sont utilisés pour l’achat des aliments bétails et les soins vétérinaires. Mamou engraisse ses béliers, les soigne et les revend aux mêmes foires hebdomadaires de sa zone. Elle fait des bénéfices variant entre trente-cinq mille (35 000 FCFA)   à quarante-cinq mille francs (45 000 FCFA) par cycle de prêt. Mamou fait l’embouche des ovins depuis plus de cinq (05 ans). Grace aux prêts du RMCR, elle mène bien son activité. Elle ne se plaint pas pour le déroulement de son activité.
texts.en: Mamou is the client who is holding the ram's horn in her hand.  She is 47-years old and raises sheep and goats in Mali. Mamou is a widow and mother of three children who all attend school (elementary and secondary).  Mamou didn't have the chance to attend school but she still manages in her business. Mamou asked RMCR to help her grow her livestock business.  She buys rams at the weekly markets in her area. With her loan of 160,000 francs, she purchased four rams for 140,000 francs and used the remaining 20,000 francs to buy livestock feed and veterinary care. Mamou fattens her rams, cares for them, and resells them at the same weekly markets in her area.  She earns profits varying from 35,000 to 45,000 francs per loan cycle.  Mamou has been raising livestock for more than five years.  Thanks to loans from RMCR, she is doing well at her business. She has no complaints about how her business is doing.

loans.use: to buy rams for fattening and then resale.

loans.name: Zenalyn

texts.en:
Zenalyn runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities, such as canned goods, soft drinks, mosquito repellant, noodles, beverages, toiletries and seasonings. She is 33 years of age and married with a one-year-old dependent child. She lives in Talibon, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies for the store, such as soft drinks and toiletries. These will help Zenalyn to fill her store again and to be able to attract more buyers to come to her store. Thus, she could cater to their respective needs and this will increase her sales. In this way, she could start to repay her obligation and start to save money for emergency uses.

Zenalyn is determined to manage her sari-sari (variety) store business to become sustainable in the future and to be able to sustain the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the store, such as soft drinks and toiletries

loans.name: Albert's Group

texts.en:
Albert is 36 years old and is often described as a very experienced farmer. He has two children and is married. As a group leader, Albert is representing his group of 11 farmers in Butere District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Albert's desire to get the best-quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to repair his home.

Albert and his group will receive a total of nine solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Abudala's Group

texts.en:
Abudala, featured in the picture above, is representing his group of 14 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. He is best known in his community for being a very friendly person and is very excited to be joining One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Abudala’s decision to join the program was largely due to the fact that he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. In addition, he was keen on purchasing a solar light that he could afford, as he says that by doing so he would be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer, which he is very excited about. With the profits he earns from the coming harvesting season, Abudala plans to send his children to school.

Between the 14 farmers in Abudala’s Group, a total of 6.5 acres of land will be planted using the farming inputs received with this loan. The group will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a 43-year-old divorced woman. She lives with her 2 sons in Samtredia district. Irma is unemployed at the moment. The family gets social assistance from government institutions as they are living in poverty.

Irma decided to start her own business and generate income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 700 GEL. With the received credit, Irma will purchase clothes and will resell them at a higher price in order to generate income. This loan will be a great support for her family. Irma awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin buying and selling clothes.

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en:
Ritah is a third time borrower of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd (MDI) applying for a loan of ugx 3,500,000. She borrowed previously to complete her house, which she did, and she is no longer burdened by rent, thanks to the generosity of Kiva lenders. 

She is a single mother of 2 children whom she takes care of with the help of her elder brother. With the help of her brother, Ritah managed to acquire three locally made machines that make ice cream. Ritah is a very hard-working lady and this can seen by the hours she spends operating the machines: 16 hours every day with the help of her employees. With these machines being situated at her brother’s home and with a ready market in neighborhood, she gets overwhelmed with the demand. In order to have a solution to it, she opted to borrow another loan that she will use to acquire another machine to boost her production.

Ritah’s future hope is seeing her small company grow into a big one that can be able to always meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To buy a machine for making ice cream

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 53 years old and married with five children. Emelia works very hard to provide for them.

Emelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, rice and other personal care products.

Emelia has been in this business for 20 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, rice and other personal care products

loans.name: Narek

texts.en:
Narek is 27 years old and he lives with his parents in the village of Srashen in the Syunik region. Narek has a higher education and now he works at his village school as a teacher of Geography and Armenian History. Narek is still unmarried.

Simultaneously with his educational activities, he is also engaged in land cultivation. On his plot of land he cultivates potatoes, beans, cucumbers, tomatoes, and greens. He also has a nice orchard and he planted apple, apricot, pear, peach, fig, and mulberry trees. With the help of his parents, he manages the harvesting as well as selling at the city’s wholesale market.

Narek asks for this Kiva loan because he has plans for the improvement of his orchard’s watering conditions, but he has a lack of finances. This loan of 400,000 AMD will help him to buy a water tank and to construct a pipeline along his land.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and to construct a pipeline along his land.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is 49 years old. She is the mother of three children.

Her husband's shop is situated in the clothing market and there are a lot of competitors in the market. Due to this competition, it is very difficult to convince customers to pay a high price. This competition is the cause of low sales and more efforts as well. He has to maintain the latest designs, rates and delightful colors of clothing for his shop so that he can maintain the rate of sales.

Now the major problem is that the summer season is about to start and he does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy clothing related to the winter season. If he could not buy seasonal inventory then it might highly affect his sales. He does not want to reduce his sales and his monthly income. 
Therefore, Zareena has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can be empowered to buy winter season clothing.

Zareena hopes that her husband will purchase clothing according to his desire at the right time so he can cope with the market competition and can grow his income as well. He thanks Kiva and its field partner for their support.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing for her husband's clothing shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of salt and more tins of sweets to sell to customers

loans.name: Suraiya

texts.en:
Suraiya is a 48-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and health. 

She has been running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has two years of experience in this field. Her husband assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts for years. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her first loan cycle with BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Manija

texts.ru: Манижа 30 летняя замужняя женщина. Она жительница города Куляб. Манижа в городе живет вместе тестю, мужем и четверых детьми. Дочкам 1 лет. Сыновьям 3 и 2 лет. Муж водитель такси. Он занимается таксистом в городе. Манижа активная и талантливая женщина. Она решила заниматься пошивом женской одежды у себя дома, потому что ее дети еще маленькие она ухаживает о детях. Манижа берет кредит, чтобы купить швейную машинку и другие принадлежности для нового бизнеса. Она вынуждена заниматься шитьем одежды, потому что надо кормить детей. Манижа старается помочь мужу обеспечить семью. Она нуждается на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Manija is a 30 years old, married woman. She is a resident of the city of Kulob. Manija lives together with her father-in-law, husband and four children. Her daughter is one year old and her sons are three and two years old. Her husband is a taxi driver. He drives a taxi in the city. 

Manija is an active and talented woman. She decided to work with sewing women's clothing from her home, because her children are small and she needs to look after them. Manija takes a loan in order to purchase a sewing machine and other sewing accessories to start a new business. She needs to work with sewing clothes because she needs to feed her children. 

Manija strives to help her husband provide for the family. She needs your support.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and other sewing accessories to start a new business

loans.name: Ugiloy

texts.ru: Угилой успешно погасила предыдущий кредит. Благодаря Вам, сейчас Угилой имеет крупнорогатого скота. Сейчас у Угилой родился второй ребенок. Она счастливая мать. После рождения второго ребенка Угилой стало больше стараться. Угилой еще раз обратилась за кредитом, потому что у нее осталось малое количество скотов, чтобы сохранить деятельность и увеличить поголовье скота, ей необходимо определенная сумма денег. Она намерена на заемные средства приобрести крупнорогатого скота и сохранить бизнес.
texts.en:
Ugiloy successfully repaid her previous loan. Thanks to you, Ugiloy currently owns cattle. 

Ugiloy has now given birth to her second child. She is a happy mother. After giving birth to her second child, she works harder. 

Ugiloy applied for a loan again, because she has few heads of cattle left in order to keep her business. She needs a certain amount of money to increase the herd. She intends to use the loan amount to purchase cattle and keep her business.

loans.use: to increase her cattle herd and keep her business

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en:
Waleed is a 27-year-old single man from Jenin city. He studied law in the university and took a two year training program. Waleed is now ready to open his own office.

Waleed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to open his new law practice in the city and buy some furniture and office supplies. This will enable him to practice law and improve himself.

Waleed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to open his new law practice in the city and buy some furniture and office supplies.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 32-years-old married man from Ramallah city. He studied law in the university and took a two year training program. Ibrahim is now ready to open his own office.

Ibrahim took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to open his new law practice in the city and buy some furniture and office supplies. This will enable him to practice law and improve himself.

Ibrahim appears in the photo.

loans.use: to open his new law practice in the city and buy some furniture and office supplies

loans.name: Raiymbubu

texts.ru: Райымбубу, 59 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, она пенсионер, также работает кассиром в больнице. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2000 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Райымбубу на сегодняшний день имеет корову и 6 овец. На участке мерою 1,0 Га собственной земли она выращивает фасоль и овощи. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 16,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Райымбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и топлива для обработки почвы. Райымбубу является одним из 5 участников группы "Бай-Тушум". Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en:
Raiymbubu is 59 years old, a widow, and the mother of three children. She has vocational education and is a pensioner. She also works as a cashier at a hospital. As an additional income for her family, she works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started this business in year 2000.

Thanks to persistent work, Raiymbubu currently has a cow and six sheep. She grows haricots and other vegetables on her own plot of land of 1.0 hectares. The combined monthly income is around 16,000 som (KGS). This money is not enough for a decent life. Therefore, with an aim to develop her business, Raiymbubu turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 65,000 som (KGS) to purchase mineral fertilizers and fuel to process the soil.

Raiymbubu is one of five members of the "Bai Tushum" group. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business and increase her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fuel in order to grow organic haricots

loans.name: Julia Magdalena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Carita De Ángel se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Tarqui  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Julia, tiene 19 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 2 años y seis meses de edad. El marido es electricista.
Doña Julia es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale dos o tres veces por semana a ofrecer sus productos aprovechando que su suegra le cuida a su pequeño, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lo cual es una ventaja ya que al cobrar realiza nuevas ventas. Lleva 2 años con esta actividad la cual le permite ganar sus ingresos con los cuales ayuda a su marido a llevar la carga familiar.
Este crédito es para comprar camisas, pantalones, blusas y otras prendas que ella vende. Lleva 4 ciclos  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque la institución le ayuda mucho. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia pues vive en casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
The credit group Angel’s Face gets together every 15 days in the Tarqui neighborhood of the Manta city, known for its beautiful beaches that are visited all year round and for being a city with unique beauty with many tourist attractions.
Julia lives in this city, she is 19 and has a common law relationship from which they have a 2 and half-year-old son. Her partner is an electrician.  Julia is a woman that likes to work to help her common-law-husband with the home expenses. She works in commerce, selling all types of clothing door to door.  She goes out two or three times a week to offer her products to take advantage that her partner’s mom takes care of the little one.  She sells with credit and collects weekly, which she sees as an advantage because when she stops to collect she can make new sales.  She has worked in this activity for two years and it allows her to have income and help her husband with the family expenses.
This loan is to buy shirts, pants, tops and other clothing items that she sells. She’s had 4 cycles with the Credit Group and she likes it because it’s a very helpful institution.  Her dreams are to have her own house as she lives with her husband’s parents.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, tops and other clothing items.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en: Gevorg lives with his wife and three children at the frontier village Yenokavan of Tavush region. Gevorg has a specialty of pedagogue and he works at the village school as a teacher of chemistry and biology. Gevorg is also a good farmer and in his farm he takes care of cows and chickens. His wife makes very tasty cheese, butter and macun (national dairy-product), which she sells to their already regular customers. Gevorg also sells potatoes from his land and mainly re-sellers buy it right from his house. Like any farmer, Gevorg also dreams of a better living for his family and a correspondingly richer farm with more income. He has requested this loan as he wants to start swine breeding, and he also must organize the spring sowing work on his plot of land.

loans.use: to start swine breeding and he also must organize spring sowing work on his plot of land

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a resident from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a 56-year-old married woman with six children. Two of her children are still attending school. She engages in a hog raising business. She raises and sells hogs to earn a living. She is in need of capital to continue her livelihood.

She has requested a loan to purchase an additional pig and pig feed. These are essential tools that would improve her hog raising livelihood. In this way, she could be able to raise and sells healthy hogs in the coming months. With these sales, she could finance the schooling of her two children and be able to do some business expansion.

Virginia hopes that she will become a successful business woman someday.

loans.use: to purchase an additional pig and pig feed

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 54-year-old Mariama. She is married, and has two children aged 26 and 21. She has three additional dependents, who live with her as foster children.

In 2014, Mariama established this ice cream yogurts business. She started the business out of her savings from her salary, and a friend of hers taught her how to prepare yogurts. Her main customers are men and women. She opens her business six days a week, 11 hours a day.

Mariama would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy additional bags of powdered milk, sugar, a cooler and some liquid flavor to add to her business for resale. She hopes that this loan will help the business to expand. In the future, Mariama plans to buy an additional freezer, improve on her savings, and complete their building project. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of powdered milk, sugar, a cooler etc.

loans.name: Darejan

texts.en:
Darejan is 35 years old, and she lives in the frontier village Kirants of Tavush region. She lives with her mother-in-law and 5 children. Her husband seasonally goes to the Russian Federation to work abroad and during the year he spends 8 months working there and sending money back for his big family. 

In the village Darejan takes care of their house, children and also their farm where they are busy with her mother-in-law with rabbit breeding. They have a lot of rabbits and they sell them mainly to the owners of restaurants. On her plot of land Darejan cultivates potatoes, beans, greens and tomatoes. Her orchard is cute but it also gives the sweetest harvest of apples, apricots, grapes and nuts, which she sells from her house to resellers.

Darejan asks for this loan as she wants to buy several new varieties of rabbits and she also needs money to organize spring sowing activities.

loans.use: to buy several new varieties of rabbits and to organize the spring sowing activities

loans.name: Ryskan

texts.ru: Рыскан, 58 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей, с Рыскан живет ее внук, который помогает по хозяйству. У нее среднее образование, на пенсии. Бизнесом занимается давно, с 1999 года. Начала Рыскан свой бизнес с 40,000 сом (KGS). В данный момент продолжает заниматься полеводством и животноводством, у нее есть корова, и 1,20 Га земли, где выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход Рыскан составляет до 11,000 сом (KGS). По характеру Рыскан очень ответственная и доброжелательная. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) для приобретения дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации молока. В будущем Рыскан собирается увеличить поголовье дойных коров.
texts.en:
Ryskan is 58 years old, married and the mother of three children. Ryskan's grandchild lives with her and helps her with her farm. Ryskan has secondary education and is on a pension. 

Ryskan has had her business for a long time, since 1999. She started it with 40,000 som (KGS). She continues to work with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding. She has a cow and 1.20 hectares of land, where she grows haricots. The monthly income is up to 11,000 som (KGS). 

As a person, Ryskan is very responsible and friendly. She turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase a dairy cows and increase the volume of milk for selling. In the future, Ryskan will try to increase the number of dairy cows.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow in order to increase the volume of organic milk for selling

loans.name: Asha's Group

texts.en:
Asha, pictured above, has 6 children and is always described as a very friendly person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Asha is representing her group of 13 farmers in Butere District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Asha has been a farmer for 20 years and in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Asha is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 5 acres will be planted by Asha's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 13 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Patrick is a 57-year-old proud father of nine children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Patrick has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Patrick described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Patrick’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah is a fourth-time borrower of the institution applying for UGX 2,500,000. She is 33 years old and married to a 43-year-old businessman with whom she has three children. Hadijah is a business lady who owns a small guest house and salon in her residential neighborhood. Both businesses are doing well, especially the guest house. However, it has a few challenges, among which include having the rooms repaired.

Because her tenants have always complained about the condition of the rooms, Hadijah opted to apply for a loan to have the rooms renovated. What she wants to do is paint the walls and tile the floor and bathroom walls.

Given the loan, Hadijja is so hopeful that her rooms will have a new look and thus keep attracting more customers. Doubtlessly, her customers will increase, and so will her income. She will eventually be able to put up more rooms, thereby expanding her business in the future. She is hardworking and appreciates the financial service and support.

loans.use: To buy paint and tiles

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Patrick, a 25-year-old married father of two, is often described as a very hardworking individual. As a group leader, Patrick is representing his group of 10 farmers in Butere District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Patrick's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge his phone. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

Patrick and his group will receive a total of eight solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 3.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence's Group consists of 15 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Florence, the group leader pictured above. She is 29 years old, married, and has four children. Florence has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Florence isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed improvements in her life, especially her ability to consistently feed her family. This year, Florence will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Florence's Group will purchase a total of 15 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Sebastian Alberto

texts.es: SEBASTIAN ALBERTO: Es originario de Puerto Cabezas, es un hombre trabajador, de 29 años de edad, soltero con 1 hijo de 7 años de edad que estudia su tercer grado de primaria. desde hace 8 años habita en una vivienda de tambo y madera. Con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y tener una vivienda más digna y segura, solicita su primer préstamo para cambiar la madera. Con el préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción: madera, clavos, postes de madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es establecer su propio negocio, una pequeña tienda de ropa y calzado.
texts.en:
SEBASTIAN ALBERTO is from Puerto Cabezas.  He is a hard-working man who is 29 years old, single with one 7-year-old child who is in the third grade of primary school. He has lived in a stilt house for the past eight years. 

He is asking for a loan so that he can improve the condition of his house and have a more dignified and safe place to live by replacing the wood in his house. The loan will allow him to buy construction materials such as wood, nails, and wooden posts, and to cover labor costs. His dream is to establish his own business - a small clothing and shoe store.

loans.use: to replace the wood in his house.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine lives with her beloved husband in Vanadzor city of Lori. She works at the Lori region rescue service center as an operator. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Narine’s mother-in-law died a year ago, and, as Narine describes, her husband greatly suffers from that loss. Narine does her best to help her husband to overcome this period in his life.

Narine asks for this Kiva loan to enable her and her husband to put up a tombstone in memory of his mother. This couple will be so thankful if Kiva lenders decide to help them during such a hard period of time in their lives.

loans.use: to put up a tombstone in memory of her mother-in-law.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes and bags for his new store to resell.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is 23 years old and she lives with her husband and two children in the Getahovit village of Tavush region. 

This young family started from the very bottom and, little by little, they enriched their farm. Now on her farm, Armine has cows, pigs, and chickens and she manages to sell milk, cheese, macun (a national dairy product), curd, meat, and eggs from her farm. 

Armine’s husband has no constant work and there are no hired jobs for workers, so he greatly helps his wife in farming. In this way, step by step, through the hardships and some savings, Armine earns her family's living. 

This loan will be so great for Armine since she wants buy several bulls and a lot of animal fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy several bulls and a lot of animal fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.name: Musa's Group

texts.en:
Musa is 28 years old, and is often described as a very hard-working individual. He has 3 children and is married. As a group leader, Musa is representing his group of 11 farmers in Butere District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Musa's desire to earn enough to feed his family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to buy a goat.

Musa and his group will receive a total of 9 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 30-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two sons.

Asma's husband owns a clothing business. His practice is to buy clothing from a wholesaler and sell it to retailers. He has a lot of customers who like to buy clothing from him. Sometimes he purchases clothing from outside the city at a low cost and sells it to retailers. He has a good reputation in the market, and his current customers give references about his clothing to the other retailers, which becomes good advertising.

Asma has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy more clothing of various colors and designs to fulfill demand. She is in a repeated loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior, taking the loan from BRAC and investing in the business.

Asma hopes that her savings will increase so she can arrange the marriage ceremony for her daughter. She dreams of a bright future for her children, the establishment of their business, and a better living standard for her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband purchase more varieties of clothing to resell.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and six children. 
She owns a business in which she offers the raw material for embroidery arts. She has an additional source of income. She alone has to address the expenses of utility bills, school fees for her children and household expenses. She wants to offer precious stones for bridal dress’s embroidery because most of her customers demand these stones, but she can not offer this product due to high cost.
Therefore, Safia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so that she would be able to buy embroidery raw material for reselling from her home and can earn a better income.
She is very thankful to the Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: a loan helps Safia in purchasing embroidery raw material for reselling from her home.

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
"Violet, pictured above, has 7 children and is always described as a very experienced farmer, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Violet is representing her group of 9 farmers in Butere District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Violet has been a farmer for 10 years and, in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Violet is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 4.25 acres will be planted by Violet's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 6 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of onions to sell to customers

loans.name: Thanh An 4 Group

texts.en:
Mrs Ang, 39, is a Thai ethnic lady who lives with 5 other family members, including her husband and her two children who are grown-up. One studies at college, and another studies in Grade 11. They live together happily in an old Thai ethnic traditional house and rely on agricultural production for a living. To have enough income to cover living expenses for the family, Mrs Ang diversifies cultivation and animal husbandry into various activities such as growing rice, cassava, corn, and raising buffalo, pigs, chickens, and musk duck. Dealing with the difficulty of lack of capital, she has taken out a loan in the Anh Chi Em Program. This is the third time she has received a loan from the program and she will use it to buy young fish and food for the fish. She hopes to gain good income from the investment in order to buy new furniture for the house and pay tuition fee for her children. 

Mrs Ang dreams of a more abundant life and a brighter future for her children. In the picture, she wears the red shirt and stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy young fish and food for the fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy yams and potatoes.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 30 years old and lives in the town of Masaka in the Masaka region of Uganda. She has 0 children. For the past five years, Alice has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, posho flour, rice, bread, sauce pans, toilet paper, sodas, and detergent. 

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, maize flour, rice, bread, sauce pans, toilet paper, sodas, and detergent, and will help Alice to generate greater profits and increase the family income. Alice hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, posho flour, rice, bread, sauce pans, toilet paper, sodas, and detergent

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 35 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. For the past five years, Joan has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells drinks like soda,beer, and wine. 

To help expand her business, Joan has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chairs, crates of soda and beer, and will help Joan to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Joan hopes that in the future she will be able to earn profits.

loans.use: purchase more chairs, crates of soda and beer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester aged 48 years. She is married with 2 children between ages 13 and 18. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 5 years. Her husband is also a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay the workers who grow the maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to buy a cow.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who grow the maize.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
With a family to raise, Jane has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. With the little time Jane has, she sells crops from her small farm and also keeps dairy cows and poultry. 

From Kiva lenders, Jane is seeking a loan of 60,000 KES to grow her horticulture business.Jane practices horticulture farming and she grows vegetables and fruits and wants to increase her horticulture production. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Jane access to a loan facility that will aid her to grow her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. 

With your loan, Jane’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: to grow her horticulture business.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan lives with his parents and disabled brother in the village of Ddmashen in Gegharkunik region. The entire family is engaged in farming and agriculture. 

Since his parents are elderly and can only do a little farm work, Vardan has a lot to do there. He takes care of cows, a pig, sheep and chickens and sells farm products such as milk, meat and eggs at the city’s wholesale market. His plot of land yields harvests of potatoes, greens and peppers which he also sells in the city.

Vardan says that his income is insufficient to effectively operate the farm and take care of the family. He has therefore requested this loan to buy a cow and a bull, which will mean more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a bull

loans.name: Kisa Kyamukama Kosovo Salaama Group

texts.en:
Nulu is a repeat client in Ugafode Microfinance Ltd having taken previously a loan of UGX500,000. She is a married woman aged 29 years old with children.

She is a business woman who makes snacks to sell in a bid to raise income and increase on her working capital and expand her business. She has applied for a loan through the group, however she is faced with a challenge of competition and limited capital.

She is very grateful for the support Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her and fellow group members since they are now able to fund their businesses.

They are pledging continued support and partnership to the Ugafode business as well.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and other items to make snacks

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
"John", pictured above, has 6 children and is a very experienced farmer, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. John is representing her group of 13 farmers in Butere District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

John has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs, but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, John is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 6.5 acres will be planted by John's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 11 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy utensils and food items for cooking

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
