Bashir is a third-time borrower applying for a loan of 4,000,000 UGX. He is a married father of two children. Bashir is a small-scale trader who deals in coffee husks in one of the companies in the city. The business makes him good money. He has been able to educate and take care of his family using his business proceeds. Because Bashir has always saved money in the bank, he also managed to acquire a small piece of land that he is now developing with a small residential house. The house is now at wall plate. He got stuck along the way and has now opted to borrow a small loan that he will use to have the house roofed and the windows and doors fixed.

Bashir's future hope is to complete his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials to complete his residential house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sachets and bottled water to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and five children. Her husband owns a small gemstones shop, in which he sells precious gemstones for rings, earrings, and necklaces. He presents his jewelry under a display glass case for the attraction of customers. He is the family's sole source of income; he has to afford the expenses of utility bills, school fees of his children, and household expenses all by himself. The condition of his house is not up to the mark for living.

Therefore, Allah Rakhi has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan funds so her husband can buy precious gemstones, which will enable him to increase his earnings.

Allah Rakhi hopes that she will construct her house soon, so that her family members may pass their lives comfortably. She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: to assist her husband in purchasing precious gemstones.

loans.name: Nyomo Bei Group

texts.en: These members are part of the group called Nyomo bei, made up of two people who both live in the same area. The representative of the group, Patience (who's standing on the left in the photo), is 38 years old and attended school to the elementary level. She has five children for whom she is still responsible. Patience has been selling underwear, straight dresses and polo shirts for 15 years in a shop at her residence in Teshie. She procures her goods in a market in Ghana. She will use this loan to buy more underwear, straight dresses and polo shirts to sell to customers. In order to strengthen her business, Patience, together with the other group member, is seeking her third loan from ID-Ghana. Their previous loans have been repaid correctly.

loans.use: To buy more underwear, straight dresses and polo shirts to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a biogas system for clean cooking for his family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase crushed plastic raw material for her husband to manufacture plastic accessories.

loans.name: Rahma

texts.en:
Rahma lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children, all of whom go to school, and also takes care of additional family members. She sells cassava chips, chapiti, and other snacks at the market. She has been in this business for the last 8 years and works seven days a week.

Rahma has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy baking power,cassava, spices, cooking oil, flour. Her major challenge includes the seasonality of her raw materials.

Rahma's goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, baking power, flour, cassava ,and spices

loans.name: Uilfredo

texts.es:
Uilfredo tiene 39 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en la provincia de Callayuc, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perù.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de carpintería, cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de madera para realizar sus trabajos de carpintería, con esto el espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Uilfredo is 39 years old and lives with his common-law wife and two children in the province of Callayuc, a community where most people farm or raise livestock. It is located in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. 

Uilfredo provides carpentry services, and  he has ten years of experience in this business with good business and personal references from the people in his district. He will use the loan to buy a greater quantity of wood for his carpentry work and hopes that this will allow him to provide better service to his customers, leading to more income and a better quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of wood for his carpentry work.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and two of them go to school. She operates a pub. She operates a pub from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for five years. She takes care of additional family members. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling used shoes. She has requested a loan from MCDT-SACCO of UGX 700,000 to buy crates of beer and soda, and jerrycans of local brew and spirits. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to buy a fridge for her pub. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include food and medication.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local brew and spirits

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam is 29 years old and lives in a very nice village called Ddmashen of Gegharkunik region with his big family. He is just married and he lives with his wife, his parents, and his brother’s family.  Rustam’s father and brother go to the Russian Federation seasonally  for  work abroad. Only Rustam stays to take care of his family; sometimes he also manages to do different hired  construction work. Now in his farm he has cows, calves, heifers, sheep, chickens and a horse. 

Rustam perfectly manages to work with city butchers, who buy his farm meat (beef, mutton, pork and poultry). His wife sells milk, macun (a traditional dairy product), cheese and eggs to their neighbors and customers from the city. As Rustam says, he and his wife enjoy their work about their farm, helping each other every moment in every work.  Rustam is asking for this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams as his farm cattle lack fodder and with all this loan amount he is going to buy animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder as his farm cattle lack fodder

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a 42-year-old married woman with five children; four of them are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Dolores has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Dolores requested a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish and other materials for her business.

Dolores has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Sirvard

texts.en:
Sirvard is 62 years old and she lives with her husband in Kapan city of Syunik region. For many years Sirvard worked as an accountant at different organizations, but starting in 2008 she went into the clothes trading business. 

At the city’s wholesale market she sells women clothes, men trousers and also a nice assortment of curtains. She buys her stall’s merchandise from Yerevan, and sometime also from Turkey. She mentions that she already has a lot of regular customers who regularly do shopping at her stall. 

Sirvard is married and she has two daughters and a son; all of them are married and they live with their families. Sirvard’s husband is now unemployed and he is engaged in fruit and vegetable cultivation.

This loan of 700,000 Armenian drams Sirvard asks for is because she wants to buy a new spring-summer clothes collection for her stall, and also new fashionable curtains to sell.

loans.use: to buy a new spring & summer clothes collection for her stall and also new fashionable curtains

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is a 46-year-old married man, with four children between the ages of 14 and 21, all of whom go to school. He is a farmer, and has been growing rice for the past 11 years. His wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, Theoneste would like to buy more fertilizer. He will use the profits from his business to pay the school fees of his children, and to buy a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer.

loans.name: Abdul Rahman

texts.en:
This is thirty-seven-year-old Abdul Rahman.  He is single and has one child, aged thirteen. In 1998, Abdul Rahman established his football jersey and men's shirt business. He began his business because he was underprivileged and was not able to attend school.  At the age of 17, his father took him to a tailoring shop where he became an apprentice.  After he became perfect, he opened his own tailoring shop. and his main customers are men. 

Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,054,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Abdul Rahman requires a loan in order to buy additional rolls of jersey and shirt material for resale. He hopes that this loan will support him to expand the business. In the future, Abdul Rahman plans to acquire a bigger shop, to have employees, and educate his child. It will help to accomplish some of his future plans.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy new rolls of jersey and shirt material for resale

loans.name: Viateur

texts.en:
Viateur, 37 years old, is married and has 4 children aged between 5 and 13 years; three of the children go to school. Viateur is a farmer who has been growing maize for the past 6 years. His wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, Viateur would like to buy fertilizer. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Alvella

texts.en:
Alvella, 55, is married with six children between the ages of eighteen and thirty years old; three of them go to school. For the past eighteen years she has farmed maize. Her husband is a businessman. 
Alvella is applying for a 1,317,993 RWF through Urwego Opportunity Bank to buy bags of fertilizer for her farm. She is working to put her profits toward a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.
For this reason farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julián de 35 años de edad, se dedica al comercio, cuando atendiendo la tradición familiar de 30 años, decidió hace 10 años, generar ingresos autónomos. En su oferta cuenta con variedades de artesanías y juguetes, artículos con los que promueve sus ventas a crédito, desde los jueves a domingos, en un horario que inicia a las 9 de la mañana y termina a las 9 de la noche. Para obtener precios competitivos realiza sus compras a mayoristas pegándolas de contado, con el fin de hacer sus mejores descuentos a sus clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará juguetearía variada, que son los productos que rotan fácilmente haciendo de su credikiva una inversión que lo impulsa a generar nuevos ingresos.
texts.en:
Julián is 35 years old and works in a shop, when looking after the family tradition of 30 years.  Ten years ago he decided to earn his own income. He sells a variety of crafts and games and promotes sales by offering credit.  From Thursday to Sunday his day starts at 9am and finishes at 9pm.

In order to be competitive on prices, he makes wholesale purchases in cash with the purpose of offering better discounts to his clients.

He is applying to credikiva, the first loan made by la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which he will buy a variety of toy merchandise . They are the products that sell the quickest and make his credikiva loan an investment which will drive sales and generate new income.

loans.use: to buy toy merchandise.

loans.name: Emmanuel's Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 29 years old and is often described as a very experienced farmer. He has three children and is married. As a group leader, Emmanuel is representing his group of 15 farmers in Butere District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Emmanuel's desire to earn enough to feed his family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to buy a goat.

Emmanuel and his group will receive a total of eight solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mbembani Central S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The man between the two women, who is raising his hand holding a mallet in the photo, is called Peter. He is 29 years old and the father of one child, who is in primary school. He joined Mbembani Central S.H.G. and Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from training on savings, enterprise development and financial management. 

Peter operates his own quarry business selling building stones and is borrowing from Kiva to buy quarry tools, such as mallets and chisels, which will help him employ more casual labourers, hence, increase production of building stones for sale. He is grateful to Kiva and the lenders.

loans.use: To buy quarry tools, such as mallets and chisels, which will help him employ more casual labourers, hence, increase production of building stones for sale.

loans.name: Okumu's Group

texts.en:
Okumu is 36 years old and is often described as a very resourceful person. He has four children and is married. As a group leader, Okumu is representing his group of six farmers in Butere District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Okumu's desire to earn enough to feed his family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

Okumu and his group will receive a total of four solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to assist her husband in purchasing a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de familiares en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería, ubicada en el distrito de Zaña, en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Daniel se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su propia mototaxi, también se dedica a la crianza de animales de corral, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El necesita préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su mototaxi ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto tendrá mayores ingresos ya que podrá dar atención a más clientes y de esta manera mejorarán sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel is 20 years old and is single. He lives in his family’s house in a community dedicated to business, agriculture, and livestock and located in the district of Zaña, in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru.

Daniel is dedicated to offering transportation services in his own motortaxi. He is also dedicated to raising farm animals. He has experience in this business and has good personal and professional references in his district. 

He needs a loan to invest in maintaining his motortaxi, since at present it is in a bad state. With this, he will have a better income, since he will be able to serve more clients and, in this way, will improve his income and also his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in maintaining his motortaxi, since at present it is in a bad state.

loans.name: Aramazan

texts.en:
Aramazan is 30 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda.He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Aramazan has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells household items. 

To help expand his business, Aramazan has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items like speakers and other more items to increase on the sales, and will help Aramazan to generate greater profits and boost the business. Aramazan hopes that in the future,he will be able to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more items like speakers and other more items to increase on the sales

loans.name: Maria Isela

texts.es:
Maria tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, vive en casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado, realiza esta actividad desde hace 06 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, lo que le ayudará para tener en mejores condiciones a su ganado y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes esto tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 53 years old and is married. She lives in her own house in a rural district of Cayalti. It is a community where life is peaceful, and the population is dedicated to agriculture, business, and raising animals. The community is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru.

She is dedicated to raising and selling livestock. She has done this activity for 6 years, so she has experience in this business and good references in the district. 

She requests a loan to buy more animals, as well as balanced feed to fatten the animals. This will help her to have better conditions for her livestock and to satisfy the needs of her clients. This will have a positive impact on her level of income and will permit her to improve the quality of life of her and her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals, as well as balanced food to fatten the animals.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Grace, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to four children, known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Grace joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family.Grace is also purchasing a solar light which she is so excited about because she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Grace plans to send her children to school.

Between the 14 farmers in Grace's Group, a total of 7.75 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. In addition, the group will also be purchasing a total of 9 solar lights with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Julissa

texts.es:
Julissa tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene una hija, vive en casa familiar en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como gallinas, pollos, patos, pavos, entre otros, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 03 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más patos, pavos, gallinas, cuyes, entre otros animales para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Julissa, age 24, is in a common-law marriage and has a daughter.  She lives in the family house in a rural area in the Cayalti district.  The community works in agriculture and with livestock.  It is in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She raises and sells small animals like hens, chickens, ducks, and turkeys, among other.  She has been in this business for three years.  Her business is located at her house.

She is requesting the loan to buy more ducks, turkeys, hens, and guinea pigs, among other animals in order to increase the stock in her business.  She will do this in order to expand her business and meet the needs of her customers.  This will generate greater earnings and will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more ducks, turkeys, hens, and guinea pigs, among other animals in order to increase the stock in her business.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 56 years old. He is married with six children who are between 2 and 15 years old. Three of the children go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past eight years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers for growing maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing maize.

loans.name: Abanyarukundo Group

texts.en:
Abanyarukundo is a group led by Claudette, who is 45 years old. The group name means “Beloved One” in English. She is married with seven children aged between 2 and 15 years.

She has a shop and has been doing a business for the past 8 years. The group members sell different items and they have the same idea for changing their lives. With the loan, she would like to buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil for selling. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase inventory for her husband's metal shop.

loans.name: Tanvieza

texts.en:
Tanvieza is a 30-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband has been running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. He also assists his younger brother by purchasing a stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Tanvieza is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and healthcare expenses. Tanvieza wants to grow the business of her husband, so she has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits. 

She is an honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan; she in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in earnings, and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 41 years old, living in Lahore, with her husband and four children. 

Her husband has been running a barber shop. He has been using his salon tools for many years; the worn-out tools need to be replaced with new ones. He wants to buy new tools, but his financial condition does not allow him to buy new tools. 

Due to his low purchasing power, Naseem requested a loan so that her husband can become empowered and he can easily buy new tools such as scissors, combs, shaving machine, front mirror, and revolving chair.

Naseem hopes that this loan will work positively and she will be able to make some saving for household expenses. Naseem offers thanks to Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new tools such as scissors, combs, shaving machine, front mirror, and revolving chair for her husband's barber shop

loans.name: Zakia's Group

texts.en:
Zakia is the age of 42, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son owns a shoe shop in which he sells a variety of shoes. He buys shoes from different shoe manufacturing companies and sells at the shop. He has been selling gents shoes only, but now he wants to offer ladies shoes as well, according to customer’s demands, but the major problem is the lack of a lump sum amount. 

Therefore, Zakia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy ladies shoes as well. 

Zakia is very happy after taking this loan and says thanks to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ladies shoes for her son's business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw for transportation services for her son

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is the age of 37, a mother of four children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from his vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the vegetables. 

Therefore, Shahnaz applied for a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more vegetables for selling.

Shahnaz is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetable for her husband's shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fish, firewood and smoked fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Kitulani Shg Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Margret, who is a member of Kitulani S.H.G. She is 37 years old, married and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 to benefit from training in Savings and Resource Mobilization and Enterprise Development.

Margret practices poultry keeping and is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy an incubator of a capacity of up to 70 eggs to be able to set up her own hatchery and earn more income.

Margret is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy an incubator of a capacity of up to 70 eggs to set up her own hatchery and earn more income.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph was born and brought up in Murang'a County. He is a married man with three children. He lives in an informal settlement where sanitation is a huge problem. 

Joseph learnt of Fresh Life through a friend who introduced him to the franchise. He developed some interest and subsequently he also wants to buyTwo Fresh Life Toilets.

He intends to improve sanitation standards around his residential area. In addition he will generate some income to cater for his family needs.

Joseph is an enthusiast and plans to expand in future.

loans.use: To pay for two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 50-year-old woman who lives with her spouse and four children in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a milkman by trade, selling milk in the market. His customers like to buy fresh, delicious milk from his shop. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs, as there are too many competitors in the market.

Many of his customers like to buy from him due to reasonable rates and milk quality. He wants to increase the stock of milk on a daily basis and purchase milk in large quantity. But he does not have enough cash to do so.

Therefore, Rehana has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy more milk in bulk to sell. Rehana is very happy after receiving this loan. She thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help Rehana's husband to buy milk.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot lives together with his retired mother in the village Syunik of Syunik region. He is not married. Not having any profession, Ashot managed to work in different places and workshops as a locksmith, or warden; then he worked at the gas station, but he never gave up farming and agricultural activities. In his farm he has cows, calves, heifers and chickens. On his plot of land he cultivates potatoes, and in a small greenhouse he made himself, he raises a good assortment of greens. All his farm produce is sold at the city’s wholesale market. 

Ashot also has a car and with it, he gives taxi services around his region. As he mentions, for him the most important thing is to take care of his mother properly and he does his best.

With his Kiva loan, he wants to buy animal fodder for his farm cattle, also potato seedlings and diesel fuel for his agricultural occupations.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder for his farm cattle and to buy potato seedlings and diesel fuel for his agricultural occupations

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
In the frontier village Aygehovit of Tavush lives Vahe with his pretty wife and two sons. Vahe used to work abroad each season but, after getting married, he decided to remain with his family and establish a farm.

Now Vahe has a cow, calf, pigs, rabbits, chickens and several bee families. His wine yard is just magical with different sorts of grapes, and his orchard is full with persimmon, fig and mulberry trees. He harvests and sells these items in addition to meat, milk, honey, and eggs. He also takes some for family use.

In the summer, when it is time to take cattle the the mountains, his parents sometimes help. The pastures there are filled with fresh, green grass. Vahe wants better living conditions for his small lovely family and he thinks it is possible if he manages to make his farm richer with cattle.

This loan will be used to purchase a bull, piglets, and some animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a bull, piglets, and some animal fodder.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is a 29-year-old woman who lives with her husband in the Lchashen village of the Gegharkunik region. Yelena has a higher pedagogical education, but now works at the post office of her village. She also does farming and agriculture.

Yelena’s husband works at the school as a physical education teacher and simultaneously helps his wife about their farm. In the farm, Yelena has cows, calves, heifers and sheep. She makes very tasty cheese and macun (national dairy-product). She also sells her farm milk, meat and eggs to her neighbors and regular customers in her village.

Yelena mentions that in this period of time meat is of great demand among her customers. She will use her Kiva loan in order to buy two more calves and fodder for her farm.

loans.use: to buy two more calves for her farm and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Yokonia

texts.en: Yokonia is a 46-year-old married father of 10 children living in Kasese, Uganda. He sells shoes and has been in business for nine years.  He gets additional income from rentals. Yokonia started business to be rich and educate his children. However, his challenge is the prevailing price fluctuations that hinder his income projections. Yokonia needs a loan to buy more shoes to sell

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Bangalie

texts.en:
This is thirty-seven-year-old Bangalie. He is married and has three children aged twelve, seven, and three. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him as a foster child.

In 2008, Bangalie established his cooking condiment business. He started a drink business in order to improve his family’s living standard. He has now changed into a grocery, and his main customers are men and women. Working six days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,000,000. He requires a loan in order to buy additional bags of salt, containers of cooking oil, and cartons of Maggi (seasoning). He hopes that this loan will help to expand the business.

In the future, Bangalie plans to diversify the business and educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of salt, containers of cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothes for reselling to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand and cement for her family home.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 56 years old, a hard working married man with six children; three go to school. They are living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Joseph is a coffee farmer who has been growing coffee for 20 years. He has a dream of being the biggest supplier of coffee in the area. He is faced with the challenge of low prices, since he sells unfinished products. 

Joseph will use the loan to buy coffee seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings for planting.

loans.name: El Ceibo Group

texts.es:
DELIA es una joven mujer de 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en una comunidad de la provincia de Esmeraldas. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura , sus hijos asisten a la escuela y ella atiende su propio negocio.
Desde hace 1 año ella comercializa credito para los usuarios de telefonia movil y le va muy bien.
En su comunidad no cuentan con servicios de alcantarillado ni agua potable, el agua que utilizan es la del rio. No cuentan con centros de salud y el mas cercano queda a 1hora en camioneta.
este es el 2do credito que gestiona en VisionFund y al igual que el anterior, lo invertira en el negocio que hemos descrito.
Es una mujer muy emprendedora y tiene la idea de tener dentro de 2 o 3 años un centro de Cyber y servicios de copias con cabinas telefonicas. ya que no hay en su comunidad.
se describe como una mujer dinamica y llena de energia para trabajar y ofrecer a sus hijos un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
DELIA is 26 years old and lives with her spouse and four children in a community in the province of Esmeraldas. Her husband is a farmer and her children go to school. Delia has had her own business for the past year in which she sells credit to cell phone users, and it has been going very well for her. 

In her community they don't have sewers or potable water; the water they use is from the river. They do not have health care centers and the nearest one is an hour away by van. 

This is the second loan she is taking out with VisionFund, and as the first one, she will use the money for the business described. 

She is a very enterprising woman and her idea is within two or three years to have a cyber center and copy service with telephone booths because there are none in her community currently. She is described as a dynamic woman, full of energy to work and offer her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy and sell pre-paid reloadable phone cards.

loans.name: Rise & Shine Group

texts.en:
These three members led by Abigail as the representative are part of the group called Rise & Shine. The businesses that the members of this group are engaged in include selling plastic items, slip-ons and wigs. They will need a total amount of GHS 2,500 to expand their businesses. 

The loan will benefit this group of micro-businesswomen, of which Abigail is a member. Abigail says that she joined ID-Ghana two years ago and has been a member till now. This is her fourth loan request with ID-Ghana. She currently has a business selling plastic items. 

Abigail will use her part of this loan, GHS 1000, to increase her working capital. She will buy more plastic items to sell to customers. She will sell them by hawking to her customers. This work allows her to make an income for her family. 

Abigail is 39 years old, married, and has two children. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, Abigail replied that she likes the health insurance services and the training sessions. She says her loans have made it possible to take care of her children's and her own needs, by saving part of her profits and reinvesting the other part in her business.

loans.use: To buy more plastic items to sell to customers.

loans.name: Japheth's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Japheth, often described as an extremely reliable person. He is 53 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 11 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. He is married and has four children.

Japheth is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Japheth says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2013, he has been able to consistently feed his family, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Japheth will use the profits from this season to send his children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.50 acres. Even though Japheth will not receive a solar light, some of the members of the group will be purchasing a solar light. In total the group will receive nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Jairo's Group

texts.en:
Jairo is 46 years old and has 12 children. He has been a farmer for 17 years and is always said to be a very reliable person. Even though Jairo is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 14 farmers in Butere District, Kenya.

Jairo started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. Jairo is also purchasing a solar light which he is so excited about because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to study. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers.

Jairo’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 9.25 acres of land and 12 solar lights in total with this loan.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Todos Unidos Group

texts.es:
LILIAN es una emprendedora mujer de 38 años de edad, vive en Selva alegre con su esposo y sus 5 hijos, quienes van a la escuela con regularidad. desde hace mas de 1 año se dedica a la compra venta de mariscos (pescado, camaron)en su comunidad y en poblaciones aledañas. es su primera vez en  creditos y desea poder ayudar a sus  hijos con las ganancias.
Sus productos a las poblaciones cercanas, los traslada en una canoa a remo, Ella espera en 4 años haber incrementado sus ganancias y ventas, para poder comprar un motor fuera de borda y de esta manera llevar los mariscos facilmente y en menos tiempo hasta las comunidades.
Este credito sera utilizado para abastecerse de mariscos frescos, adquirir icopores, para mantener frio y fresco el producto y facilitar su traslado.
texts.en:
Lilian is an enterprising woman, who is 38 years old. She lives in Selva. She is happy with her husband and their 5 children, who go to school regularly. For more than a year, she has been dedicated to buying and selling seafood (fish, shrimp) in her community and in nearby communities. It is her first time getting a loan, and she wants to be able to help her children with her earnings.

She transfers her products to nearby populations by rowing a canoe. She hopes that in 4 years she will have increased her earnings and sales. She also hopes to buy a motor for the boat and, in this way, to bring her seafood more easily and in less time to the communities.

This loan will be used to stock up on fresh seafood, to acquire polystyrene, to keep the products cold and fresh, and to facilitate transfer.

loans.use: to buy fish to increase sales in nearby communities.

loans.name: Mildred's Group

texts.en:
Mildred is a 38-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing her group of nine farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Mildred has noticed that she has been able to save more money.

Mildred describes her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, as well as fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Mildred’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: George's Group

texts.en:
George's Group is formed by 14 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by George, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 26 years old, married, and has one child. George has been a farmer for seven years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

George isn’t new to One Acre Fund, he actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has changed - especially in the sense that he has been able to save more money ever since. This year, George will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge his phone.

Using this loan, George's Group will purchase a total of 11 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Carolyne's Group

texts.en:
Carolyne, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very experienced farmer, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Carolyne is representing her group of 14 farmers in Butere District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Carolyne has been a farmer for six years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as it means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Carolyne is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 6.25 acres will be planted by Carolyne's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her two daughters, two sons, and husband in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running a mobile shop for the past five years. 

Parveen’s husband wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Parveen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan her husband will be able to purchase relevant items for his business, so that he can earn a more profitable income to manage his business and household expenses.

Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase different types of mobile accessories for her husband's mobile shop

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 50 years old, living with her six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her son has been running a mobile shop for many years and generating income for his family. He troubleshoots the mobile problems; he sells the mobile accessories such as charger, body, data cable, etc.; and he provides the recharge facilities of different networks. 

Nowadays, as the demand increases for accessories and for recharge, sometimes he has to refuse his customers. But he does not have savings to further invest into business because he has spent all his income on household expenses. 

Therefore, Nasreen requested a loan for her son so that he can be empowered to buy additional accessories and extra credit for recharge facility. 

Nasreen offers thanks to Kiva and to its field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy mobile accessories for reselling by her son from his mobile shop.

loans.name: Karol Yaritz A

texts.es: KAROL YARITZA: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, pertenece a la etnia miskita, tiene 23 años de edad, casada con 2 hijos: El mayor de 8 años estudia su tercer grado de primaria y una pequeña de 2 años de edad. Está solicitando su primer préstamo para ampliar su vivienda de tambo y madera. Con el préstamo podrá comprar madera cepillada, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es  brindarle a su familia una vivienda más segura y en buenas condiciones.
texts.en: KAROL YARITZA: is originally from Puerto Cabezas, she has miskita ethnicity, she is 23, married with two children. The oldest kid is eight years old and in third grade of elementary school, the little girl is two years old.  She is requesting her first loan to expand her residence of metal and wood.  With the loan she will be able to buy wood, nails and cover labor expenses.  Her dream is to provide her family with a safer residence in good conditions.

loans.use: to expand her residence of metal and wood.

loans.name: Mehwish

texts.en:
25-year-old Mehwish started a primary school as soon as she completed her basic education. Then, she continued her education while starting the school and today has a bachelor's degree. There are 84 students in the school, and classes range from pre-nursery to Grade 5. She wants to give these young children the best education she can offer. She has employed five female teachers in the school and invests in their training herself to build their capacity. 

She requires a loan of PKR 110,000 to purchase furniture for classrooms and to buy computers. She wants her students to be in a comfortable environment and to have the skills they need to succeed

loans.use: to purchase furniture for classrooms, and to buy computers.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Это женщина Раъно. Ей 32 лет. Она жительница района Вахш. Раъно замужем мать троих детей. У нее один сын и две дочери. Дети учатся в средней школе. Муж Раъно занимается животноводством. Раъно в районе занимается выращиванием крупнорогатого скота. Она продвигает деятельность отца. Уже 3 она занимается этой деятельности. Раъно уверена в себе и хорошо справляется со своей работой.  Она решила расширить животноводческую деятельность, путем увеличения поголовье скота. Для увеличения поголовье скота у нее не хватает денег, и она обратилась за кредитом. Раъно верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. Она заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: This is Rano. She is 32 years old. She lives in the Vakhsh region. Rano is married and has three children: one son and two daughters. Her children attend secondary school. Rano’s husband raises livestock. Rano raises cattle locally. She continues her father’s business. She has been in this business for three [years]. Rano is confident in her abilities and manages her work well. She decided to expand her business by  increasing her cattle headcount.  She lacks the funds needed to increase her headcount, and so she has applied for a loan. Rano trusts in you and your support. She expresses her thanks in advance.

loans.use: to increase her headcount and expand her cattle business.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other member of her family. 

She has been selling raw food and vegetables in the market at retail for the last 15 years, working seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of UGX 600,000 from MCDT SACCO, to buy cabbages, oranges, and boxes of tomatoes. 

Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to buy land and start farming. She rents a house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, oranges, and boxes of tomatoes.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is a 26-year-old single young man from Ramallah city. He studied law in the university and took a two-year training course. Thaer is now ready for opening his own office.

Thaer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to open his new law office in the city and buy some furniture and office supplies. This will enable him to practice law and improve himself. 

Thaer appears in the photo.

loans.use: to open his new law office in the city and buy some furniture and office supplies.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member. Justine lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food. 

Justine sells fried cassava, chapati, and other snacks at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last seven years. Justine works six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation.

Justine has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy cassava, cooking oil, cartons of baking flour, and a bag of charcoal.  Her goal and aspiration is to buy a fridge so she can start selling cold drinks.

loans.use: to buy cassava, cooking oil, cartons of baking flour, and a bag of charcoal

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives with her husband and son in Stepanavan city of Lori region. Her husband is a taxi driver and her son temporarily lives and works in the Russian Federation. Susanna has a higher pedagogical education and she has worked at the school as a teacher of elementary classes since her very young age. She has 36 years of experience in this sphere. 

She also teaches some pupils in her home, to help them get prepared for their lessons and to overcome some hardships that they have in their learning process at the school. Susanna’s pupils love her very much, thanks to her patience and kindness. Susanna asks for this loan as she wants to do some cosmetic repairing of the room where she is teaching her courses and she also wants to furnish it, making it more comfortable for her pupils.

loans.use: to repair and furnish the room where she teaches her courses

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is 33 years old, single with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. Edson mines and sells crude salt and he has been in that business for five years. He has a dream of educating his children to university however, he faces a challenge of weather changes which makes it difficult to mine salt, especially in the rainy season. 

Edson intends to use the loan facility to buy crude salt from other miners to sell.

loans.use: to buy crude salt from other miners to sell.

loans.name: Kikonda Savings And Credit Group

texts.en: Jane is a member of Kikonda Savings and Credit where members hold each other financially accountable. Jane has three children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a poultry farmer and also earns a monthly salary that adds to her income. She is facing challenges of price fluctuation of maize and fish that hinder progress of her business. However, she is working very hard to extend her business to new areas to yield more income. Jane has asked for a loan to buy poultry feed.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed

loans.name: Juma's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Juma, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. He is 40 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 10 farmers in Butere District, Kenya.  He is married and has three children.

Juma is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again, as this means that he is able to earn enough to feed his family, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Juma says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2013, he has been able to consistently feed his family, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. 

Juma will use the profits from this season to buy more land to cultivate.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 7.25 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Flora's Group

texts.en:
Flora is 44 years old and has nine children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. 

Flora has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Flora also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Flora's Group will be able to receive a total of 8 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Loice's Group

texts.en:
Loice is 30 years old and has eight children. She is a group leader and is representing nine farmers in Butere District, Kenya. 

Loice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes it could be better this year if she continues yo work alongside One Acre Fund. Loice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about. It will allow her to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Loice's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights and farming inputs to plant a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Elizabeth, often described as an extremely resourceful person. She is 39 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 15 farmers in Butere District, Kenya.  She is married and has four children.

Elizabeth is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Elizabeth says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2012, she has been able to consistently feed her family, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Elizabeth will use the profits from this season to rent more land to cultivate.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 8 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan the group will also receive a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Frankline's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Frankline, who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. He is married and is a father to one child; he is known by his community as a very trustworthy person.

Initially, Frankline joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since he joined the program he says that his life has improved, especially because he has been able to consistently feed his family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Frankline plans to save more money for the future.

Between the 10 farmers in Frankline's Group, a total of 4.75 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 59 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. 

Beatrice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Beatrice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Beatrice's Group will be able to receive a total of 4 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jacob's Group

texts.en:
Jacob is 48 years old and has six children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by ten farmers in Butere District, Kenya. 

Jacob has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. 

Although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Jacob also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to study by.

Obtaining this loan means that Jacob's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of six acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Rael's Group

texts.en:
Rael, pictured above, has been a farmer for 12 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 14 farmers in Butere District. She is 42 years old, is married, and has five children.

Rael likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Rael plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Rael’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 10 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Winnie's Group

texts.en:
Winnie's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Winnie, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 40 years old, is married, and has four children. Winnie has been a farmer for 12 years and is often referred to as a very reliable person.

Winnie isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has a larger farm group support ever since. This year, Winnie will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Winnie's Group will purchase a total of 5 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is 52 years old and has six children. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very trustworthy person. Even though Mary is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 10 farmers in the Butere District, Kenya. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.


Mary started working alongside One Acre Fund in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has learnt a lot from farming training sessions that she has attended. 

Mary will be receiving a solar light in addition to the farming inputs of cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season. She is so excited about this addition as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. 

With this loan, Mary’s Group will receive a total of nine solar lights and farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to buy a solar light as well as cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.en:
The members are part of Emmanuel Group and are beginning their fourth loan cycle with ID Ghana. It’s made up of eight members. The members’ businesses include yams, general goods, perfumes, soft drinks, slippers, silver products, plywood and cosmetics. 

This loan will help their small businesses, including Helina. This is her second loan from ID Ghana, having joined on a friend’s invitation. She has a business selling yams and says that she started this business with a little bit of capital on her parents’ recommendation. 

She will use the money from this loan as working capital to buy more yams in quantity from the wholesalers market to sell to customers at another retail market. 

This work will allow her to generate income with which to support her family. 

She is married and has four children. When asked what she likes abut ID Ghana, she says that she likes the healthcare that the institution provides. 

They will need a total amount of GHS 10,700 to better their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more yams in quantity from the wholesalers market to sell to customers at another retail market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a poly tank and store water for his water vending business

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 23 years old, and she works with her sister Julia, who is 18 years old. Both of them work at a locksmith. Jacinta is single, and she would like to have her own workshop in the future. 

Jacinta needs a loan to buy a foundry machine that will be very helpful for her and her sister, because the machine will be used to make wheelbarrows. 

Jacinta is not alone. Her sister is ready to help her. Jacinta hopes you can trust her. Jacinta appears in the picture with her sister

loans.use: to buy a foundry machine

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 16 mujeres inspiradas en una mejor y buena calidad de vida, tienen como objetivo poner mucho empeño en sus actividades laborales para ir creciendo demuestran deseos de superación con ganas de seguir trabajando constantemente
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Martina, que se dedica a la confección de prendas varias, es una persona muy trabajadora que a través de las capacitaciones quiere ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida. La Sra. Martina  pide el préstamo para comprar telas e hilos para que ella pueda elaborar ropas, pantalones, remeras sobre pedidos y con las ganancias poder cumplir con sus obligaciones.  Ella quiere salir adelante, es por ello que se esfuerza mucho.
texts.en:
The committee is comprised of 16 women who are inspired by a better and good quality of life. They aim to put a lot of effort into their occupations to grow and to demonstrate desire to continue working steadily.

One of the members is Martina who earns living by making variety of garments. She is a very hard worker. Through training, she wants to keep improving her living conditions. 

Martina is requesting a loan to buy fabric and thread so she can make cloths, pants, and custom shirts. These earnings would allow her to meet her obligations. She wants to be successful and that is what drives her.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread so she can make cloths, pants, and custom shirts.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama San José están en el 6to. ciclo con 17 integrantes, todas ellas se dedican a actividades rurales, son de una zona aun en crecimiento y de difícil acceso.
Una de las integrantes la Sra. Elsa, quien es ama de casa y se dedica a la cría de animales, ella con el préstamo que pide quiere comprar animales para a la cría, como ser gallinas y cerdos, y con ello poder tener más adelante los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
Las demás integrantes también trabajan y luchan día a día fortaleciéndose en la cooperación y solidaridad de este grupo unido.
texts.en:
The committee called San Jose is in it's 6th loan cycle with 17 members. They all make a living in rural occupations. They are from an area which is still developing and is difficult to access.

One of the members, Elsa, is a housewife and makes a living raising animals. With the loan she is requesting she wants to buy animals for breeding, such as chickens and pigs. With this, she would be able to earn a better income to be able to help her family in the future.

The other members also work and struggle every day, strengthening the cooperation and solidarity of this united group.

loans.use: to buy animals for breeding such as chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Aida Milagro

texts.es: Aida de 40 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas y a la crianza de cerdos, tiene 20 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito par la compra de maíz por mayor y cal para seguir con la venta de sus tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Aida is a 40 year old single mother who lives in her own home with her daughter.

She makes a living making and selling tortillas, as well as from raising pigs. She has dedicated 20 years to this business; what she earns from her work goes towards household expenses. She is asking for a loan in order to buy wholesale corn and limes so she can continue her sales and make better incomes.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She sells second-hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. She works six days a week. 

Jalia has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level and buy a van for transporting her merchandise. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Hortencia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Hortensia de 57 años de edad, casada con tres hijos mayores de edad, e independiente económicamente, se ha caracterizado por ser una madre luchadora, proveedora de su hogar con ganas de superación personal, desde muy joven se dedicó al negocio el cual  inicio por iniciativa propia por la necesidad de trabajar y ayudar con los gastos de hogar. 
Gracias a su perseverancia tiene por actividad económica la venta de queso y sus derivados, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, tiene quince años de experiencia en el mismo. La rutina de trabajo de la Sra. Hortensia es de unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos como: queso duro, de mantequilla, borona, crema, cuajadas, leche. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo  y surtir su negocio para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Hortensia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Hortensia is 57 years old. She is married with three children who are adults and economically independent. She has been characterized as  a hard-working mother, the provider for her household, with the will for personal achievement. Since she was very young, she has worked in the business that she began on her own initiative out of the need to work and help with the household expenses.

Thanks to her perseverance, she has a business of selling cheese and its derivatives. The business is located in her home. She has 15 years of experience in this business. Señora Hortensia's work routine is some ten hours daily, offering her products such as hard cheese, butter, cornbread, cream, cottage cheese, and milk. 

The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business so that she will be able to satisfy the demands of her customers.

Hortensia is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to buy dairy products such as cheese, cream, butter, cottage cheese, milk, and cornbread

loans.name: Nimer Felipe

texts.es:
Nimer de 52 años de edad, padre soltero con dos hijos mayores de edad, es el cual uno está estudiando en la universidad, y sigue con el apoyo de su padre, originarios de  Managua,  se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, en la actualidad está por cumplir uno de sus sueños como ver formado a sus  hijo en un profesional, y se dedica día a día a su negocio para sacar adelante a su familia.
Gracias a su perseverancia tiene como actividad económica la venta de queso y sus derivados., el negocio lo tiene ubicado en unos de los mercados de la localidad, y tiene tres años de desempeñarse en dicha actividad, ha sido duro porque ha tenido que crea su clientela, y además tiene mucha competencia. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y aprovechar la temporada de semana santa ya que las ventas se incrementan. El dedica unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos como. Queso mantequilla, crema, cuajada. Nimer agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Nimer, 52, is a single father. He has two adult children: one of them goes to the university and he supports him. He is originally from Managua, and known for being a hardworking and responsible man, with a strong will to get ahead. One of his dreams is coming true: his son is about to become a professional. Nimer works every day to get ahead with his family.

Thanks to his persistence, he works selling cheese and other related products. His store is located in one of the marketplaces in the city. He has had this business for three years and has had to work hard to attract customers. He has many competitors.

With this loan, he wants to invest in working capital and take advantage of the Holy Week celebrations [Christian commemoration of the passion, death and resurrection of Jesus of Nazareth], when sales increase. He works for ten hours selling products such as cheese, butter, cream, and curd.

Nimer appreciates the help that Kiva lenders give to people with few resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a dignified job.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, and curd to sell.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, both of whom go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member. Violet lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

Violet has been making African crafts to sell at the market on a retail basis for the past three years. She works six days a week. Violet's major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She would like to start training other people to make crafts. 

Violet has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy materials such as back cloth, skins and beads for making bracelets.

loans.use: To buy materials such as back cloth, skins and beads for making bracelets

loans.name: Duvan

texts.es:
Duvan es de la ciudad de Medellín, se dedica al comercio hace 2 años, es soltero, y con la ayuda de su madre se ha abierto camino y hoy día ya es muy conocido en el sector donde ubica su negocio.

Se dedica a la venta de elementos para surtir negocios como pollo, bolsas plásticas, desechables, entre otros, y con ello puede tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. 

Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante y tener una vida llena de éxitos y triunfos.

Pide este préstamo para la compra de surtido, de manera a que pueda mejorar sus ingresos por medio de su trabajo y puede ir aumentando su negocio de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
