Duvan is from the city of Medellín. He has worked as a merchant for 2 years. He is single and and with his mother's help he has made his way and today he is very well known in the area where he has his business. 

He sells items to as inventory for businesses, such as chicken, plastic bags, disposable items and more. By doing this, he is able to have the means to help his family. 

He is a very hardworking person and a fighter. He wants to get ahead and have a life full of success and triumph. He is asking for this loan to buy some inventory. This way, he can improve his income through his work and expand his business in the same way.

loans.use: to buy some chicken, plastic bags, disposable items, and more.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz, a sus 38 años de edad, es una mujer carismática, activa y servicial. 

Ser madre de dos hijos, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a sus hijos. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 15 años, comenzó a fabricar calzado para todo tipo de clientes, de muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector y lograr una buena trayectoria. 

Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas sola

Esto la impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará materia prima al por mayor como pegas, clavos, suelas, enmtre otros, así podrá satisfacer la demanda, esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Luz manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir haciendo lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en una gran distribuidora de calzado y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar de su familia.

Anímate a prestar al negocio de Luz!
texts.en: At 38 years of age, Luz is a charismatic, active and helpful woman. Being the mother of two children has been her main reason to tirelessly struggle day by day, looking for alternatives to earn her living and to support her children. Approximately 15 years ago, she started producing footwear for all types of customers; products of good quality at excellent prices which made her be known in her area and to set herself on a good path. She works by herself eight hours every day. This motivates her to request the support of the loan to strengthen her inventory, because she will buy raw material, such as nails, glue, soles, among other things, at wholesale prices. In this way she will be able to satisfy the demand and will help her improve the income she receives from her work. Luz states that her age does not hinder her to do what she loves. Therefore, she is always setting new goals for herself. One of her goals is to become a large footwear distributor and to generate employment opportunities. In this way she will be able to improve her quality of life and the well being of her family. Come on and help Luz with a loan for her business!

loans.use: to buy raw material such as nails, glue, soles, among other things, at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka is 41 years old and a married woman. She lives with her husband and 11-year-old daughter in Lagodekhi district, Kakheti region. Eka works at a local kindergarten as a nurse and gets 170 GEL monthly. Besides that, she is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has a cow, calves, and hens. She also owns agricultural land, where she grows vegetables to sell. 

Eka needs to purchase tractor to cultivate land. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, has enabled her to get a loan of 8,000 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a tractor and vegetable seeds. She will not have to rent a tractor for cultivating the land. The start-up program will be a great support for her family to decrease expenses and increase income, as she will also rent it out among her villagers and will receive additional income.

loans.use: to purchase  a tractor to cultivate agricultural land and rent out for additional income

loans.name: Karambi Bakyara Twekambe Group

texts.en:
Yusta is a member of Karambi Bakyara Twekambe where members guarantee each other's loans. She has three children and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is involved in farming, rearing pigs and growing matooke (green plantains). She is faced with a challenge of increased costs of feeding the pigs, and that hinders the growth of her business. However, she is aiming at educating all her children to higher levels of learning. 

Yusta has asked for a loan to reinvest in her piggery project by buying feed known as maize brand for the pigs.

loans.use: to reinvest in her piggery project by buying feed  known as maize brand for the pigs

loans.name: Alex Fernando

texts.es: Alex Fernando es un joven de 20 años de edad, Alex Fernando nació en el campo y vive con sus padres, esta familia obtiene sus ingresos mediante la dedicación de la agricultura y la ganadería, Alex Fernando se dedica a la crianza de ganado y por este motivo  necesita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de terneros que los tiene en terrenos por los que paga arriendo por la hierba,Alex  Fernando tiene 2 hermanos que asisten a la escuela,Alex Fernando desea mejorar su negocio y de este modo hacerse independiente en sus gastos para que a sus padres   les alcance para pagar los estudios de sus hermanos.
texts.en: Alex Fernando is a 20 year old young man. Alex Fernando was born in the countryside and lives with his parents. This family makes their living with farming and animal husbandry. Alex Fernando works raising cattle. For this reason he needs a loan to invest in buying calves that he keeps in the fields they rent for the grass. Alex Fernando has two siblings who go to school. Alex Fernando wants to improve his business, and in this way become independent with his expenses so that his parents can afford to pay for his siblings' education.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Jose Dimas

texts.es:
José, de 28 años de edad, es una persona emprendedora, está soltero y vive con sus padres quienes se dedican a la agricultura y a la prestación de servicios de trasporte.  

José, trabaja transportando personas en su vehículo de un municipio a otro desde hace 8 años, su padre también trabaja transportando personas, de esta manera obtiene ganancias para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia. 

José, necesita el dinero del préstamo para comprar dos pares de llantas y pagar la reparación de su vehículo porque sufrió un golpe cuando colisiono con una vaca, mientras realizaba sus viajes rutinarios de trasporte. 

Las mentas de José son, tener un vehículo en mejores condiciones y para prestar un mejor servicio a las personas de su comunidad.
texts.en:
José, a 28 year old, is an entrepreneurial person. He is single and lives with his parents who work in agriculture and with the provision of transport services. 

José has been working transporting people in his vehicle from one town to another for the last 8 years. His father also works transporting people, and from that he makes profits to satisfy the basic necessities of his family. 

José needs the loan money to buy two pairs of tires and to pay to repair his vehicle because it suffered a hit when he collided with a cow while he was carrying out his routine transport trips. 

José's goals are to have a vehicle in better condition to give a better service to the people in his community and to repair his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy two pairs of tires and to pay to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Lydia's Group

texts.en:
Lydia, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 10 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Lydia will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have an overall improved quality of life. Lydia plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Lydia’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of five acres of land. They will also receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Norah's Group

texts.en:
Norah is a 50-year-old proud mother of 10 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Norah has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Norah described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Norah’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Estela Dolores

texts.en:
Estela Dolores is 43 years old, married and has two sons. Her family owns a store where they sell second-hand furniture. She says that fortunately they have been doing pretty well, and thanks to their store they were able to build a house. 

She is asking for a loan to make some urgent repairs in her home, before the rainy season. She says that her biggest accomplishment is sustaining the business for more than 20 years and building a house.

loans.use: To make home repairments before the rain season.

loans.name: Everline's Group

texts.en:
Everline, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by six farmers in Butere District, Kenya. She is 40 years old and a married mother of nine children, often described as a very friendly person. 

Although Everline has been a farmer for 16 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Even though she is new to the program, Everline wanted to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Everline hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 3.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of one solar light, as, even though Everline decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 140 boxes of cosmetics products to sell to customers

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, aged 40, is divorced, She has a 19-year-old son who has recently completed senior high school. For the past six years, to earn a living, Grace has operated a business that sells sachet water. She has salesgirls who send the water to bus terminals and houses to sell for a daily wage.

Grace wants to expand the business as it is thriving. However, as a result of financial constraints, she is unable to do this. With this loan, she will be able to sell bottled water as well as sachet water and thus sell more to earn additional income.

loans.use: To buy bags of sachet water and bottled drinking water to sell

loans.name: Monica Jaqueline

texts.es: Mónica tiene 24 años de edad y esta soltera, actualmente está laborando como administradora de un taller de conversiones a gas donde se siente muy contenta por la experiencia que está pasando. Ella va a empezar a retomar el VII ciclo de la carrera de Contabilidad y finanzas que había empezado en la Universidad “Las Américas”  y es por esto la solicitud del crédito, para pagar las cuotas de la Universidad, así de esta manera poder titularse como profesional y optar por trabajar en empresas reconocidas en el mercado. Mónica tiene como plan a futuro poder llevar la contabilidad general de la empresa donde está laborando actualmente. Ella se siente muy  agradecida y contenta por el apoyo que vuelve a recibir por parte de los inversionistas de KIVA.
texts.en: Mónica is 24 years old and is single. Currently, she is working as an administrator in a gas conversion shop where she is very happy for the experience that she is having. She will begin to start the 7th term in her degree of accounting and finance which she had begun in the Las Américas University and it is for this that she applies for a loan, to pay the university fees. In this way, she will be able to get a professional degree and choose to work for well-known businesses in the market. Her plan is to be able to bring general accounting from the business where she is currently working. She is also very grateful and happy for the support that she is getting again from the Kiva investors.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: G.s Luchando Por La Vida Group

texts.es:
La señora Vilma es una mujer  emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio propio que es venta de granos básicos  maíz y frijoles, también ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos, las ventas las realiza todos los días de la semana en su casa de habitación, cuenta con  6 años de experiencia dedicándose a este negocio, cuenta con los clientes principales los que habitan en la zona donde ella vive.
Doña Vilma solicita le préstamo para la compra de maíz y frijoles, con las ganancias que obtenga sueña con poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. ella solicita el préstamo de forma grupal con las siguientes personas:
Teodora se dedica a la venta de ropa americana desde hace 3 años.
Edith dedica a la venta de abarrotería desde hace 3 años.
Karla se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace 2 años.
Dania se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 1 año, todas ellas solicitan el préstamo porque no cuentan con el capital suficiente, y ahora se han unido nuevas miembros al grupo de ellas ya que son personas muy responsables.
 Danlí, Honduras –   Febrero 2015
texts.en:
Sra. Vilma is an enterprising woman who is devoted to her business of selling basic staple crops, such as corn and beans. She also sells cosmetics. Vilma conducts her sales every day of the week out of her home. She has six years of experience in this business. Her main customers live in the same area as she.

Doña Vilma is requesting a loan in order to buy corn and beans. With the profit she earns, she dreams of providing a better future for her children. She is requesting her loan as part of a group with the following members:

Teodora has been selling American clothes for three years.
Edith has been selling groceries for three years.
Karla has been selling shoes for two years.
Dania has been selling fruits and vegetables for one year.

All of them are requesting loans because they do not have sufficient capital. There are now new members who have joined this group since they are responsible people.

Danlí, Honduras – February 2015

loans.use: to buy corn and beans to sell.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El socio Ruben pertenece al banco comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS, él socio Ruben sigue dedicándose al negocio de agencia de viajes, el socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos, él socio continua vendiendo paquetes turísticos para sus clientes  como City Tours, Machupicchu, Valle Sagrado entre otros, siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
EL socio solicito el crédito para la compra de boletos turísticos entre otros
texts.en:
Ruben is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras Communal Bank.  He still has his travel agency business.  He is thankful for his loan and promises to make his payments according to the payment schedule.  He is still selling tourist packages to his clients, such as City Tours, Machupicchu, Valle Sagrado, and others, which is how he gets his family ahead.  

He requested this loan to buy tourist passes and other things.

loans.use: to buy tourist passes and other things.

loans.name: Fuerza Compartida Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FUERZA COMPARTIDA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Chela del Carmen ella es soltera y tiene 57 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también la socia tiene una fotocopiadora, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite,la social es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de estos trabajos quiere sacar adelante a su familia, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de celulares, negocio de venta de tortas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank Fuerza Compartida. This bank is located in Cusco district, which is part of Cusco province and Cusco department. 

Chela del Carmen is single and is 57 years old and has 3 children. She works in her business of a grocery store and she also has a copy machine. She sells basic pantry items such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman who, through these jobs, wants to get her family ahead. She works from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm. She has had this business for 5 years now, and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She asks for the loan to purchase milk, sugar, oil and rice.

The members who are attached to the group photo took their photos after the meeting because they asked permission due to work. 

The other members work at their businesses of cell phone sales, cake sales, a grocery store and a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Los Lobos Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Los Lobos” está conformado por tres personas muy amables a quienes une el lazo familiar. Ellos viven en una comunidad muy apartada del centro del municipio; los habitantes no cuentan con un servicio de transporte público óptimo. Sin embargo, el lugar también tiene una gran riqueza por ser de origen mazahua.
Doña Juana es una persona muy amable, sus cualidades humanas le ha permitido ganarse el cariño de mucha gente, en su comunidad sus vecinos le llaman Juanita de cariño. Ella tiene 64 años y está casada con el señor José quien se ha dedicado a trabajar el campo casi toda su vida. Juntos formaron una familia con 15 hijos, todos ellos hoy en día independientes. 
En la comunidad de Juanita los borregos crecen sin mayor problema “Crecen muy rápido porque tenemos mucho campo para sacarlos a pastar” además se trata de animales muy resistentes a los cambios de temperatura. Por más de 30 años ella y sus esposo se han dedicado a la cría y venta de estos animales, esta fue la actividad que los ayudó a solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos.
Juanita está muy agradecida con VisionFund porque por más de 10 años le han prestado dinero lo que le ha permitido mantener su actividad. Con el nuevo préstamo podrá comprar alimento, zacate y maíz para sus borreguitos y así complementar la pastura de los campos de la región.
Ahora que todos sus hijos tienen su propia actividad Juanita sólo piensa en seguir trabajando para tener sus propios ingresos. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de Juanita y José al lado del corral de sus borregos*
texts.en:
The "Los Lobos" group is made up of three very friendly people united by family ties. They live in a community very far from the center of the municipality. The inhabitants do not have optimal public transportation services. However, the area also has great wealth as it is of Mazahua origin.

Juana is a very friendly person. Her personal qualities have allowed her to win the affection of many people. In her community, her neighbors call her "dear Juanita". She is 64 years old and is married to José, who has worked in the fields all his life. Together, they made a family with 15 children, all of whom are now independent.

In Juanita's community, sheep grow without any problems. "They grow very quickly because we have a lot of fields to take them out to graze." Also, these animals are very resistant to changes in temperature. For more than 30 years, she and her husband have been raising and selling these animals. This was the activity which helped them to cover the household expenses and their children's education.

Juanita is very grateful to VisionFund because for more than ten years, they have lent her money which has allowed her to maintain her business activity. With this new loan, she will be able to buy feed, grass and corn for her lambs to complement the region's grassy fields.

Now that her children all have their own activities, Juanita is only thinking about continuing to work to have her own income.

*The photo was taken at Juanita and José's house next to their sheep corral.*

loans.use: to buy feed, grass and corn for her lambs

location.town: Los Lobos, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more design materials to create designs for bed sheets, curtains and handkerchiefs

loans.name: Chavelin

texts.en:
Chavelin is a single mother, and her daughter is very young. Chavelin lives with her mother. She helps her to pay the rent. Chavelin is earning money by selling shoes and been doing that since one year ago. She learned a lot about the business.

Chavelin needs a loan to buy more shoes for her business. She is an itinerant saleswoman, so she has to travel a lot. She hopes you can help her.

Chavelin would like to have her own house in the future where she, her daughter, and her mother would be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for her business.

loans.name: Jeiko Porave Rekavo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Jeiko Porave Rekavo y está en su 6to ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas a la vez está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Felicita.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas de manera ambulante, es una persona muy sacrificada que quiere dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener y evitar con ello que pasen por necesidades.
Pide este préstamo ya que quiere surtirse con jeans, remera, camisas, pantalones y otro tipo de prendas que ella misma vender a de manera ambulante. Está muy agradecida ya que con esta oportunidad podrá dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
En la foto aparecen 16 mujeres ya que el grupo tiene 17 miembros, pero solo 15 de ellas retiran este prestamo, las otras 2 integrantes firman como ahorristas.
texts.en:
The group named “Jeiko Porave Rekavo” is in its sixth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are taking the poverty elimination survey.

One of the members is Sra. Felicita. She sells clothes as a street vendor. Felicita is a self-sacrificing individual who gives her loved ones everything that she did not have so that they can avoid being in need. She is requesting a loan because she wants to restock her business with jeans, T-shirts, shirts, trousers, and other garments to sell as a street vendor. Felicita is extremely grateful for the opportunity to provide her family a better lifestyle. In the picture you can see 16 women because the group has 17 members, but only 15 members withdraw the money, the other 2 members sign as savers.

loans.use: to buy jeans, T-shirts, shirts, trousers, and other garments to sell.

loans.name: El Rosario Group

texts.en:
Santa Maria Visitacion is a town high in the mountains overlooking beautiful Lake Atitlan in Guatemala. Nine ladies who live here have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “El Rosario”. The members of the Trust Bank speak the Mayan language K’iche as well as some Spanish.

Filiberta is the 46-year-old president of the Trust Bank. She is married with three grown children, each of whom has graduated from school. She joined the Trust Bank eight years ago, and although she has not attended school herself, she has a good head on her shoulders and much life experience.

Filiberta, along with her husband and youngest child, work in the family bakery that they began nineteen years ago. On a daily basis, Filiberta sells her baked goods in three of the neighboring towns, the closest being Santa Clara La Laguna. The other two towns, San Pablo and San Marcos, are on the shores of Lake Atitlan, and it takes Filiberta quite a long time to take the bus down the steep mountain hillside in the very early hours of the morning. She is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase flour, sugar, eggs, and other supplies for the bakery business.

The women in Friendship Bridge Trust Banks like “El Rosario” are very aware of the value of education, both for their children and for themselves. Each month at their meetings, they participate in educational trainings on a variety of relevant subjects like effective business practices (budgeting, pricing, marketing, customer service, accounting), hygiene and health, nutrition and the use of medicinal plants, as well as self-esteem and empowerment, goals and dreams, and women’s rights. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of microloans and education “Microcredit Plus”. It is most effective.

Kiva investors are greatly valued, along with Friendship Bridge, by these women. Armed with their new tools, they are poised to step into a brighter future, benefitting themselves, their families and their community of Santa Maria Visitacion.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, eggs, and other supplies for her bakery business.

loans.name: San  Roque Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN ROQUE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Celinda ella es soltera y tiene 50 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar aceite,arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chicha, negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
These members are part of the “SAN ROQUE” communal bank. It is located in  the district of Cusco in the Cusco province, department of Cusco. 

One of the members is Celinda. She is single, 50 years old, and has four children. She works in her grocery store and sells staple items such as rice, sugar, milk and biscuits. Her hours are from 8 a.m until 10 p.m..  Celinda has had this business for eight years and it has been going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She is asking for the loan so she can buy oil, rice, sugar, milk, and biscuits. 

The other members work selling chicha (sweet drink made from purple corn), selling handicrafts, selling groceries, and selling prepared food.

Celinda is grateful to everyone who is helping her to realize her dream through this organization and promises to make her payments when they are due.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, sugar, milk, and biscuits.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanco vive con sus padres, y a la vez que estudia y trabaja produce y vende chipas  en la zona de Caacupé, con mucho esfuerzo y con ayuda de sus padres lleva adelante el curso de secretaria ejecutiva para poder culminar sus estudios y cubrir sus cuentas acude a este préstamo, ya que quiere poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y trabajando.
texts.en: Blanca lives with her parents and also attends school and works. She makes and sells “chipas” (breakfast bread) in the Caacupe area.  With much effort and her parent’s help she is taking a course to become an executive assistant.  To be able to finish her course and cover her tuition she is requesting this loan as she wants to pay for tuition.  She is grateful for this opportunity and hopes to continue growing and working.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en: Rodrigo is an employee of a small grocery shop near the shared land where he lives, located in the Tihuatlán Municipality, in the state of Veracruz. The shared land has only seventeen residents, who live in eight houses. None of the houses has electricity, which is really needed. Rodrigo has been working very hard to improve his family’s living conditions. He wants to get a 65W solar home system to light his house and replace the use of candles. The main reason to get a solar lighting system is to be able to give the opportunity to his children to study and do their homework after the sunset, because he thinks education is the key for a better future. When he pays for the complete amount of the solar home system, he will save 500 pesos per month, which he currently spends on candles.

loans.use: to purchase a 65W solar home system to substitute for the use of candles; this will give the opportunity to his children to study and do their homework after sunset.

location.town: Ampliación Ejido Zacate Colorado, Tihuatlan, Verac

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: Doña Melania nació en una comunidad llamada sabana grande, ella pudo estudiar en la escuela hasta tercer grado,y luego les ayudaba a sus padres en los cortes de algodon. Actualmente esta casada y han procreado 5 hijos, cuatro de sus hijos están estudiando algunos ya no viven con ella porque ya se casaron los mayores. doña Melania trabaja en agricultura y tiene ganado que con mucho esfuerzo han podido comprar, con esfuerzo pudieron comprar un pequeños panel el cual les ha servido bastante a toda la familia, comenta doña Melania que está en planes de poner una pequeña venta y ella quisiera vender algunos productos que necesitan refrigeración es por eso que ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de un freezer y sus accesorios para hacerlo funcionar, comenta que este freezer será de gran beneficio ya que así podrá vende productos helados cuando lo amerite, estaría muy agradecida si le brindan la oportunidad de este crédito para la compra de este freezer que será de buen uso.
texts.en:
Doña Melania was born in the community called Sabana Grande. She was able to complete school through the third grade and then helped her parents with harvesting cotton. Melania is currently married and has five children. Four of her children have some education and no longer live with her because they are grown and married.

Doña Melania works in agriculture and owns livestock that she purchased with great effort. She was also able to pay for the construction of a small wall, which has been quite useful to her family. Doña Melania says that she plans to open a small store, so she wants to sell a few products that need to be refrigerated. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy a freezer and the accessories that it needs to operate. She says that a freezer will be a great benefit because she will be able to sell ice cream at the right season.

Melania is extremely grateful to have this opportunity to receive a loan because the purchase of a freezer will be of great use.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and the necessary accessories so that she can equip her store.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, estudia para ser abogada y por medio de sus estudios poder abrirse camino.
Quiere ser una profesional exitosa que pueda ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su conocimiento.
Pide este préstamo para el pago de las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder estar cada vez más cerca de su meta.
texts.en: Andrea is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. She's studying to be a lawyer and by means of her studies be able to open a path for herself. She wants to be a successful professional who can help other people by means of her knowledge. She's applying for this loan for the payment of the fee installments of her degree and with this, be able to be closer to her goal each time.

loans.use: to pay university fee installments.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
SEGUNDA, tiene 40 años de edad. se describe como una mujer trabajadora y llena de entusiasmo. Es madre abandonada y vive con sus 4 hijos.
Dia a dia Ella saca su peueño fogòn hasta la esquina de su casa, donde luego de encender la fogata inicia la tarea de azar  y freir platano maduro y pescado.
Sus hijos van a la escuela normalmente. Con el credito anterior ella pudo invertir en el estudio de sus hijos, tratamientos mèdicos y en su pequeño negocio que le dà la posibilidad de solventar gastos.
Ella desea poder tener una confiterìa y asì tener mas ingresos para sus hijos.
Desde yà , agradece mucho a los inversionistas que creen en todas las personas emprendedoras de este pais que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en:
Segunda is 40 years old. She describes herself as a hardworking woman full of enthusiasm. She is an abandoned mother and lives with her 4 children. Day by day, she takes her small stove to the corner of her house, where she then lights up the fire and begins the work of grilling and frying plantains and fish.

Her children go to school normally. With the previous loan, she was able to invest in the studies of her children, medical treatments and in her small business that gave her the possibility to cover expenses.

She wishes to be able to have a general store and therefore have more income for her children. She is already very thankful for the investors who believe in all of the entrepreneurial people of this country that need it so badly.

loans.use: to buy plantains, cheese, oil, fish and prime materials for selling plantain with cheese and fried fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Myin Ka Kone Village

texts.en:
Pictured above are the CBO members from Myin Ka Kone group, named (from left to right) Naing, Thin, Aung and Chit.  The Featured Borrower, Naing, has a seven acre farm in the Delta region of Myanmar, and like many farmers in this area, the income is very low before harvest season.  The loan will help him purchase the farming resources he needs to harvest his crops.  Naing is 40 years old, married, and has only one son who is now attending 1st grade. Naing and his family hope to save enough money to buy farming equipment such as a thrasher machine, and eventually hope to save money to send his son further along in his education.

The fund will help 19 borrowers in the village. The CBO leaders oversee this group and the group will purchase farming essentials and labor needed for harvest time with this loan.  Myin Ka Kone Village’s main focus is crop farming, as well as other seasonal foods. They also raise livestock such as ducks and pigs, for additional income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rent farm equipment and purchase petrol for farm equipment.

loans.name: Ywar Tan Shey Village

texts.en:
Pictured above are the CBO members from Ywar Tan Shey, named (from left to right) Sun, Than, Tin, and Myint. The Featured Borrower, Myint, has an eight acre farm in the Delta region of Myanmar, and like many farmers in this area, the income is very low before harvest season.  The loan will help him purchase the necessary farming resources he needs before harvest, such as fertilizer, as the soil in the region provides a challenge.  Myint is fourty-three years old, married, and supports a family of five (three children), the two youngest of whom are in kindergarten and 4th grade. Tin and his family hope to buy more paddy fields to expand his business. Tin's dreams are for his children to obtain a higher education.

The loan is for 24 borrowers in the village. The CBO leaders oversee this group and they will purchase farming essentials and labor needed for harvest time with this loan.  Ywar Tan Shey Village’s main focus is crop farming (rice), as well as other seasonal foods. They also have plantations, such as coconut trees and palm trees, for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase important farm resources such as petrol, crop seeds, fertilizer, and to hire additional labor during harvest time

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian ya es una profesional recibida, hoy está haciendo una maestría en epidemiología, con lo cual quiere ir mejorando sus conocimientos como profesional, para así ser más útil a la sociedad.
Quiere también poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo y de su sacrificio. Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Lilian is an already graduated professional who is working on a master’s degree in epidemiology, which she wants to use to improve her expert knowledge and in this way become more beneficial to society.

She also wants to assist her family through her hard work and effort. She requests this loan to be able to pay her graduate school fees and thus be able to continue to pursue a higher education.

loans.use: pay university fees

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru: Нурали 45 лет. Он житель города Куляб. Нурали женат и отец четверых детей. У него двое сыновей и две дочери. Дочкам 23 и 13 лет. Сыновьям 20 и 15 лет. Старшая дочка замужем. Старший сын находится загранице. Он работает и помогает родителям обеспечить семьи.  Младшие дети учатся в средней школе. Нурали бизнес – мен. Он честный и серьезный человек. У Нурали есть торговая точка, где он продает автозапчасти. Это деятельность является основной, потому что доход от этого бизнеса обеспечить его семьи. Нурали  просит кредит, чтобы расширить деятельность. За счет кредита он перевозит автозапчасти для продажи.
texts.en:
Nurali is 45 years old.  He is a resident of the city of Kulob.  He is married and the father of four children (two sons and two daughters).  His daughters are 23 and 13 years old.  His sons are 20 and 15.  His oldest daughter is married.  His oldest son is currently abroad, working and helping his parents to support the family.  Nurali's two younger children are still in secondary school.

Nurali is a serious and honest businessman. He owns a retail outlet in which he sells auto spare parts.  This is his main activity and the income he makes from this business helps support the family.  Nurali is taking a loan to expand his activity.  He will use his loan to bring in auto spare parts for resale.

loans.use: to bring in auto spare parts and expand his business.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is a "tuba" (coconut toddy) gatherer from Tudela. He is a widowed father of three and he is known to be responsible and hardworking for his family. 

In 2010, he joined Paglaum MPC to access needed capital. He applied for a loan and repaid it in a timely fashion. Recently, he expanded his business and delivers "tuba" to many outlets. He wanted to buy more plastic containers and accessed a loan of PHP 7,000.

Fernando hopes to venture into vinegar making in addition to his "tuba" business.

loans.use: to buy plastic containers for his "tuba" (coconut toddy) business

loans.name: Andrea Cristina

texts.es: Andrea vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijas, ella posee una venta de antojitos: papas fritas, yuca frita entre otros desde hace varios años, también se dedica a la venta de pescados, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como: aceite, papas, yuca, entre otros ingredientes que utiliza para la elaboración de los alimentos y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Andrea lives in her own home with her husband and her 2 children.  She has a business selling snacks such as fried potatoes and fried cassava.  She's had this business for a number of years, and she also works selling fish.  With her earnings, she manages to cover some of the household expenses.  

Andrea is requesting a loan to buy raw materials for her business such as: cooking oil, potatoes, cassava, and other ingredients she needs to make her food.  This way, she will be able to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business

loans.name: Tike Chaung Village - Group 1

texts.en:
Pictured above are the Community Based Organization (CBO) members from Tike Chaung Group 1, named (from left to right) Saw, Than, and Na. The featured borrower, Saw, has a two-acre farm in the delta region of Myanmar and, like many farmers in this area, his income is very low before harvest season. This loan will help him purchase the necessary farming resources he needs to harvest his crops. Saw is 61 years old, married, and supports a family of three, including one child.

The fund will help 22 borrowers in the village. The CBO leaders oversee this group and they will purchase farming essentials and labor needed for harvest time with this loan. Tike Chaung Village Group 1’s main focus is crop farming, as well as other seasonal foods. They also raise livestock, such as ducks and pigs, as well as having of banana trees, palm trees, and lime trees for additional income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, rent farm equipment, and purchase petrol for farm equipment

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 63 years old and she is from Tudela. She raises pigs in her own backyard to earn an income. In 2005, she joined Paglaum to access capital. Since then, she rolls over her capital and comes to the cooperative for additional amounts as needed.

Recently, Lucila applied for a loan to purchase two piglets and two bags of animal feed. She hopes to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets and two bags of animal feed

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 73 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed and has four children who are now adults. Leonida earns an income from a snack vending business and she's been in the business for 15 years already. Leonida earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She also receives support from her children. 

Leonida has requested a loan to purchase a variety of additional snacks to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for 14 years. In the future, Leonida hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of additional snacks

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 63 years old and lives in Jimenez -Tabo-o, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now at their adult age. Gloria earns a living from agri-business, particularly rice farming. She’s been in this business for 30 years already and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month. This amount is so helpful to meet their needs. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing commercial fertilizers and sprays for her rice production activity. Gloria has been a member of PMPC for eight years. At present, Gloria is enjoying the programs and services of PMPC, particularly on insurances and savings.

loans.use: to purchase commercial fertilizers and sprays.

loans.name: Santos Eugenio

texts.es: Don Santos de 47 años de edad el vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 13 años, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas soda, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos,  golosinas, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Santos is 47 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He has owned a small store located in his place of residence for the last 13 years. With the sales he realizes there he manages to cover some of his household expenses.

Santos is requesting a loan to purchase more eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, etc., and, this should enable him to improve his economic income.

loans.use: buy more eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Dania Marieta

texts.es:
La socia Dania pertenece al banco comunal EL TEMPLO DEL INCA, el socio continua dedicándose a ejercer su profesión  de contadora, la socia Dania está muy agradecida con la ayuda de los inversionistas, por ayudarla a mejorar  su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, la socia una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de est6a manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de una laptop.
texts.en: Group member Dania belongs to EL TEMPLO DEL INCA community bank. The member continues to dedicate herself to her accounting profession. Dania is very grateful for the investors' support. It helps her to improve her business and give her family a better quality of life. This member is a responsible and persevering person. With these characteristics, the member can move her family ahead. This member is requesting a loan to buy a laptop.

loans.use: buy a laptop.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a hard working woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She engages in farming. She grows and sells rice.  In order to have a supplemental income, she also engages in selling bamboo that could be used as furniture, house materials and many others.  She is a married woman with ten grown children. She is in need of capital to continue to operate her business.

She is asking for a loan to purchase more stock of bamboo and fertilizer. These  are the materials that would enhance and enable her to pursue her existing sources of income. With these, she would be able to sell more bamboo and improve the yield of her farm. Thus, she could pay her obligations and start to expand both of her businesses.

She hopes that she could properly handle both of her businesses for the improvement of the family's status of living.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of bamboo and fertilizer

loans.name: Evan

texts.en:
Evan is 60 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with three children now at their adult age. Evan has earned a living from a salary as a librarian in the LGU of her town for 18 years. She is also receiving a monthly pension as a surviving spouse. She earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month. This amount is so helpful to meet their needs. 

She has requested a loan to be used in paying the processing fees and other charges for her other insurance claims. Evan has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Evan hopes to engage in sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to pay the processing fees and other charges for her other insurance claims.

loans.name: Ida Anne

texts.en:
A hardworking mother, best describes Ida Anne, 53 years old, residing at Balangasan, Pagadian City, Philippines. Ida Anne is a single mother who has five school-aged children. In order to survive Ida Anne started a business, a food stand or “carenderia.” She has been in the business more than 10 years now. She wants to expand her food stand business and to gain more profits. She wants to have enough to sustain her family, especially for her children, and be able to provide them a good education. 

In order for her to make her wish possible, she needs PHP 7,000 additional capital and will use the money to expand her business. She intends to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils and other things that are needed in the food stand. She hopes to live a comfortable life with her family and to have adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils and other things that are needed in the food stand.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. There she has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.

She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her to generate more income and enable her to cater her tailoring services.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky, 25, is a single man who hails in the town of Talibon, Bohol. He earns a living by engaging in a crab vending business. To augment his income, he also is a distributor of Vita Plus products like natural health drinks, coffee, tea and beauty products. He is in need of capital for him to sustain his ongoing livelihood.

He has requested a loan to purchase more stock of crabs and additional capital for Vita Plus products. These are very useful tools that would help Ricky sell more crabs and able to purchase various stock of Vita Plus products as well. This way, he could deliver his customers' orders on time and which will cause him to improve his earnings.

Ricky is determined to improve his business to be successful and he hopes to manage his own business someday.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of crabs and additional capital for Vita Plus products

loans.name: April Sarah

texts.en:
From Balangasan District, Zamboanga del Sur, April Sarah earns a living through her clothing sales. She also offers gowns for rent. April Sarah needs to have enough inventories to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, she applied for her membership in PMPC to seek financial assistance. 

She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination, and her family as her inspiration. Consequently, she has applied for a loan to purchase more clothing inventories to sell. April Sarah hopes to live comfortably, and with her children finishing their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing inventories to sell.

location.town: Pagadian - Balangasan District,  Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 52-years-old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ana Marie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ana Marie has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Ana Marie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Banco Mujer Promujer Group

texts.es:
Grethel es una de las integrantes del Banco Mujer Promujer, ella es madre jefa de hogar, genera ingresos como vendedora de productos de catalogo, así logra cubrir los gastos de sus tres hijas que viven junto con ella. Es la vendedora más conocida de la zona por el buen trato que brinda. Necesita este crédito para crear invertir en la compra de productos de catalogo que ya le han solicitado. 
Eligió Fundación Mujer por la baja tasa de interés y el buen servicio que siempre se le ha brindado.
En un futuro sueña con exhibir los productos desde su casa y acondicionar un espacio para atender a su clientela y brindar empleo a las madres adolescentes de la zona, ya que ella ha visto lo difícil que se ha convertido para su hija no tener los medios para brindarle una condición de vida digna. Agradece toda la ayuda brindada ya que por medio de esta actividad ha logrado salir adelante junto con sus hijas.
texts.en:
Grethel is one of the members of the Promujer Women's Bank. She is the mother and head of the house who generates income as a sales person of products from a catalog. This is how she manages to cover the expenses of three daughters who live with her. She is the best known vendor of the zone due to the  good treatment she offers. Grethel needs a loan because she hopes to invest in catalog products already ordered by her customers.

Grethel selected the Mujer Foundation due to its low interest rates and the good service that it has always offered.

In the future, Grethel dreams of exhibiting the products from her house and conditioning a space where she can attend to her customers and offer employment to the adolescent mothers of the zone, since she has witnessed how difficult it is to change a daughter without the means to offer her a dignified condition of life. She is grateful for the aid offered, since by means of this activity, she has managed to advance along with her daughters.

loans.use: construct a work shop and purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Dora Concepcion

texts.es: Dora de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 11 años, también posee una venta de productos de uso personal, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de maíz por mayor y cal para seguir con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Dora, age 31, lives in her own house with her two children.  She has worked in the production and sales of tortillas for 11 years.  She also has a small shop selling personal use products.  She has many customers due to her good prices.  With what she obtains from her sales, she has been able to pay some of her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn at wholesale and lime to continue making tortillas.  That way, she will be able to have better income.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale and lime.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
La socia Griselda  continua con su negocio de restaurante, la socia está muy agradecida con la ayuda de los inversionistas, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permitirá ofrecer  una mejor educación a sus hijos, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de aceite, papas, menestras,arroz entre otros.
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
The member Griselda is continuing her restaurant business.  The member is very grateful for the investors' help in strengthening her business, which will allow her to offer better education to her children.  The member is a responsible and determined person, and it is in this way that the she helps her family succeed.

The member is requesting a loan to buy oil, potatoes, dried vegetables for making stews, and rice, among other things.

The member belongs to the “El Templo del Inca” Communal Bank, from the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, dried vegetables for making stews, and rice, among other things.

loans.name: Gumercindo

texts.es:
Gumercindo tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y tiene 02 hijos dependientes, viven en el caserío La Unión de Sallique que se encuentra ubicado en la ciudad de Jaén, Región Cajamarca en la sierra norte del Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería principalmente.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercio de ganado vacuno, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto el espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que va a tener un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gumercindo is 48 years old, lives with his wife and has two dependent children. They live in the “Sallique Union” housing group, which is located in the city of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Perú. The people in this district mainly work in agriculture, commerce and stockbreeding.

He breeds and trades cattle, has experience in this business and has good personal and work references in his district. He is requesting a loan to purchase a larger quantity of cattle to increase his business stock and be able to offer a larger variety of livestock to his clients, which will have a positive impact on his revenue level and thus, will improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: purchase a larger quantity of cattle to increase his business stock

loans.name: Thoat's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoat, born in 1984, is a Thai ethnic woman. She has been joined in the program of the institution since January 2004. She is always one of the exemplary members, in compliance with the regulations of the institution and helping other members of her group. She currently lives with her husband and her two daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family lives mainly on the income from cultivation. The family has had only one hectare of land for coffee, and each harvest it brings them revenue of VND 60 million. However, the revenue after deducting all costs is just enough to buy food and a little amount for saving. She wants to buy fertilizer for the coffee field, but that saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI. She is hoping that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the coffee field, and that the coffee field next year will bring a double productivity as compared to the last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Dam's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dam, 37 years old, lives with her husband, son and daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province. She has been involved in the  M7-MFI program from its start. 

The family’s main income comes from Dam's meager salary. Because her husband does not have a stable job, family income is inadequate. Her children are all young, so she has to spend her salary very economically to cover the family’s living expenses and save a small amount. Dam is requesting this loan to invest in the children's education. 

Dam expects the loan will help her children have a brighter future.

loans.use: to invest in her children’s education

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huong, born in 1961, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. Her family consists of three members, including her husband and her son. They are living in Mai Son district, Son La province.
	
Her family’s main income is from her husband’s meager retired salary, so the income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and a little amount saved. She wants to invest in raising pigs and chickens for selling meat, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to invest in raising pigs and chickens to increase the income of the family. 
	
She really hopes the loan amount will help her have capital to invest effectively in breeding with high productivity, and that next year it will bring her family 3 - 5 tons of pig meat. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in raising pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai, born in 1991, is a Thai ethnic woman, and has been joined in the program of M7-MFI since January 1, 2011. She currently lives with her husband and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province. 
	
Her main occupation is cultivation and animal husbandry, and her husband is on staff at a communal medical station. Therefore, their income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and a little amount saved. However, the saved amount is not enough to buy breeding stock and food. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy breeding stock and food for it.
	
She hopes the loan amount will help her invest well in breeding, and that the next pig herd will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to buy breeding stock and food for it.

loans.name: Edit Mabel

texts.es: Edit de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 10 años en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Edit esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Edit, age 45, lives in her own house with her family group.  She has had a beauty salon business in her place of residence for 10 years.  She has many customers because she works very well.  With the profits she obtains, she is able to pay her household expenses. 

Edit is requesting a loan to be able to buy some products for her beauty salon, such as creams, shampoo, hair clips, and scissors, among other things she needs.  That way, she will be able to have better profits, which will help her have greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, hair clips, and scissors, among other things.

loans.name: Jorge Orlando

texts.es: Jorge de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa,  el se dedica a la reparación y venta de llantas posee 15 años de experiencia su negocio el cual está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas llantas, rines, parches, tubos etc. todo por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo  e ingresos.
texts.en:
Jorge, 48, lives in his own house with his wife.  He makes a living repairing and selling tires.  He has 15 years of experience in his business which is located in his residence.  He has lots of customers because of his good work.  With the earnings he obtains, he is able to cover some of the household expenses.
He is requesting a loan in order to buy more tires, wheels, patches, inner tubes, etc. wholesale since this is his only source of work and income.

loans.use: to buy more tires, wheels, patches, inner tubes, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El socio Marcos se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,el socio tiene un terreno donde cultiva café ,el socio es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a su familia. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y semillas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marcos has continued working as a farmer.  He has land where he grows coffee.  Marcos is a hardworking person and his work supports his family.  He is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

Marcos is happy with this loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie engages in a basket weaving business. She makes and sells native baskets made of nito (a kind of palm). She is 42 years old and a married woman with four children, ages 18-9 year old respectively. Together with her family, she lives in Antequera, Bohol. She is in need of capital to continue to operate her business.  

She is asking for a loan to buy nito (a kind of palm), bamboo and wicker (a woven fiber formed into a rigid material). These materials will be used in producing more baskets to sell. Thus, slowly, it will augment her earnings and enable her to handle her finances. With these, she could provide her children with nutritious diets. Rosemarie hopes that in the future, she can expand her business for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy nito (a kind of palm), bamboo and wicker (a woven fiber formed into a rigid material).

loans.name: Kely Madalenni

texts.es:
Kely es madre soltera, vive junto a sus dos pequeños hijos en un recinto llamado El Cisne, perteneciente a la ciudad de Santo Domingo, caracterizado por ser una zona muy productiva, en este sector se de el plátano de exportación y variedad de frutas tropicales.  Este pueblito se encuentra en una vía muy importante que dirige a las playas costeras del país
Kely hace dos años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ella tuvo que ver la forma de salir adelante y darles la educación a sus pequeños, ya que por maltrato familiar tuvo que separarse del padre de sus hijas. A pesar de pasar por dificultades ella siempre tiene una sonrisa puesta en su rostro,  ha trabajado muy duro, actualmente arrienda una humilde casa, donde comenta quiere aprovechar el espacio delantero que posee, Kely tiene un sueño, el de poder emprender el negocio de venta de frutas y jugos, ya que por ser un sector con clima cálido y visitado por turistas quiere aprovechar estas ventajas para montarse su propio negocio y así poder sacar adelante  sus pequeños y seguir dándoles la educación.
Kely con el crédito otorgado por la Fundación podrá adecuar un pequeño local, comprar mesas, sillas, licuadoras y frutas, está segura que le irá muy bien. Agradece enormemente a las instituciones que ayudan a las personas a poder alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Kely is a single mother who lives with her two small children in a precinct called El Cisne belonging to the city of Santo Domingo which is characterized as being a very productive zone.  In this sector, they grow bananas for export and a variety of tropical fruit.  This little town is located on a very important road which goes to the coastal beaches of the county.
For two years, Kely has been making a living selling cosmetics.  She had to figure out a way to keep moving forward and give an education to her little ones, since due to family abuse she had to separate from the father of the girls.  Despite going through difficulties, she always has a smile on her face.  She has worked very hard.  These days, she rents a humble house where she says she wants to take advantage of the space in front.  Kely has a dream which is to be able to start a fruit and juice sales business. Given that it is a sector with a warm climate and visited by tourists, she wants to draw on these advantages to put together her own business and in this way improve things for her little ones and continue giving them an education.
With the loan offered by the Foundation, Kely will be able to set up a small place and buy tables, chairs, blenders, and fruit.  She is sure that it will go well.  She thanks the institutions that help people to be able to realize their dreams enormously.

loans.use: to set up a place and to buy tables, chairs, blenders, and fruit.

loans.name: Pancresia

texts.en: Pancresia, a widower, has a coconut farm in Aloran and makes good earnings every quarter doing this type of work. This is the primary source of income for her family since she has become widowed. Pancresia makes it a point to prepare the land well for planting more dwarf coconut seedlings and bananas on her farm. This preparation gives her the maximum yield and generates a good income. Recently, she needed an amount to pay for "holing" the soil and planting the seedlings, which she borrowed from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Pancresia wishes to sustain her business and to provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for "holing" the soil and planting the seedlings

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married and lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She joined PMPC in January of 2012 in order to access the programs and services of the co-op. Recently, she's accessing another loan in the amount of PHP 14,000 for additional working capital of her existing business to buy a variety of rice to sell at retail in the local community. Sarah hopes to continue her business and able to save enough for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a variety of rice to sell at retail in the local community

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en: Shoira is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in a family of agrarians. She is living in a small town where people are most hospitable and talented. She is married and has two children. She is in a business of producing “Kurut” (small salty candy) and “Chakka” (national thick yogurt). Shoira feels some difficulties in raising her children, because her business is small and she gets a small profit from it. She has been in this business for almost three years. She is satisfied with her business and wants to expand her activity buy buying additional dairy products. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy milk and other items to increase her productivity. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: To buy milk and other items to increase her productivity

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is from Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old and is married. Monica owns and operates a retail store selling assorted goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Monica joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Monica is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional store inventory and used as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional store inventory and to have working capital

loans.name: Lelanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lelanie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell spices business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetable.  Lelanie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of spices to sell for her buy-and-sell spices business.

Lelanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of spices to sell

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es:
Julio vive con sus padres en  la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los  Colorados, ciudad caracterizada por ser el puente terrestre que une a las regiones del país. 
Es un joven muy trabajador, se dedica tres días a la semana a la venta de sábanas en sectores aledaños a la ciudad, recorre en su moto que la pudo obtener gracias a las ganancias de su negocio, ya que lo dedica al máximo. Julio además trabaja como pintor los otros días de la semana.
Comenta que le ha ido muy bien, actualmente lleva un año dedicándose de a lleno a su negocio, pero desea abrirse a más zonas de la ciudad porque quiere seguir creciendo. No ha sido fácil, pero todo trabajo tiene su esfuerzo, a pesar de las dificultades se siente feliz porque puede ayudar a sus padres con los ingresos de hogar.
Con el crédito que pudo obtener en la institución va a comprar más sabanas para incrementar sus ventas y distribuir en otras zonas
En un futuro desea incrementar el taller de costura de su madre, para que ella misma confeccione las sabanas y así poder seguir vendiendo a su clientela mejor variedad.
texts.en:
Julio lives with his parents in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a city characterized as being the land bridge which unites the regions of the country.
He is a hard-working young man.  He dedicates three days of the week to the sales of bed sheets in the sectors surrounding the city.  He travels on his motorcycle which he was able to get thanks to the earnings from his business since he puts his all into it.  In addition, Julio works a s a painter the other days of the week.
He says things have gone well.  Nowadays, he has a year in which he has been making a living fully from his business, but he wants to open up more zones of the city because he wants to continue growing.  It has not been easy, but every business requires effort.  Despite the difficulties, he feels happy because he has been able to help his parents with the household income.
With the loan he was able to get from the institution, he will buy more bed sheets in order to increase his sales and to distribute in other zones.
In the future, he wishes to expand the sewing workshop of his mother so that she herself could make bed sheets and in this way continue to sell a better variety to his clientele.

loans.use: to buy more bed sheets in order to increase his sales in other zones.

loans.name: Ana Rut

texts.es: Ana de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, posee 30 años de experiencia el cual inicio con capital propio, su negocio está ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza es como logra salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar,  ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de nuevos estilos de camisas y camisetas para caballero por mayor, para así tener mejores ingresos económicos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 62, lives in her own house with her family group.  She makes a living selling clothing for women and men.  She has 30 years of experience in a business which she started with her own capital.  Her business is located near her residence.  Thanks to the sales she makes, she is able to cover the household expenses.
She is requesting a loan in order to buy new styles of shirts and T-shirts for men wholesale so as to have better economic income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy new styles of shirts and T-shirts for men wholesale.

loans.name: Ana De Los Angeles

texts.es: Ana de 47 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus hijos,  ella se dedica a la venta de paletas de frutas  posee 10 años de experiencia y su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes pues un producto muy vendible, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de variedad de futas, azúcar, entre otros ingredientes por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y así tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 47, is a single mother who lives in her own house with her children.  She makes a living selling fruit ice-pops.  She has 10 years of experience and her business is located in her place of residence.  She has many customers as her product is very marketable.
She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of fruits and sugar amongst other ingredients wholesale in order to continue with her sales and thus have better earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits and sugar amongst other ingredients wholesale.

loans.name: Awen Indah Group

texts.en:
With good care and by being painstaking, the melon plantation owned by Ni Komang produced maximum results. As expected, Ni Komang harvested the melon as scheduled and sold it to the big buyer. With a satisfactory result, two members decided to quit the group; one of them was Ni Komang. Ni Komang decided to quit the membership of the group and the loan. Business profits were enough to be used as working capital, savings and to meet the needs of her family. She was very grateful for the help of the loan that she had gotten. 

Because Ni Komang previously was the head of Awen Indah group, the group elected a new head. They chose Ni Made as the new head of the group. The Awen Indah group decided to continue the loan with seven members. 

Ni Made has three daughters and they are all still in school. Ni Made, along with her husband, runs two businesses; they are pig breeders and farmers. She applied for a loan to buy piglets, paddy seeds and fertilizer. With the additional funds, she hopes to get better results and will be used to fully meet the needs of her three children in school.

loans.use: to buy piglets, paddy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer De Huarancca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DE HUARANCCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Colquepata, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria ella es casada y tiene 53 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
	
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to "Nuevo Amanecer de Huarancca" [Huarancca's New Dawn] Communal Bank; this bank is located in the Colquepata district, belonging to the Paucartambo province and Cusco department.                      

The borrower is Victoria. She is married, 53 years old, and has 5 children. Victoria works in her business selling grains. She sells corn, wheat, and quinoa. Victoria works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. She already has 4 years in this business and is doing very well. Victoria's dream is to have a place where she could sell the grains. The borrower is requesting the loan to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.           
	
The other members are in the animal sale business, grain sale business, grocery store business, and food sale business. 

The borrower thanks those who are part of this dream by this means and commits to comply with the payment of her installments in the deadline set.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

loans.name: Delyn

texts.en:
Delyn is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years. Delyn earns income from selling the fish.
