José, trabaja en la albañilería, tiene mucho tiempo de realizar esta actividad, pero además trabaja en la agricultura desde que era pequeño; aprendió esta labor ayudando a su padre.- Además, recibe el apoyo de su esposa, la cual se dedica a vender ropa desde hace tres años y con las ganancias que obtiene puede apoyar a su esposo.

José, utilizara el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas, comprar 4 sacos de abono, pagar mano de obra y otra pequeña parte del préstamo para comprar ropa para el negocio de su esposa, gracias al otorgamiento del préstamo podrá beneficiarse ambos y así podrán obtener mejores ganancias y darle lo necesario a su familia.

Los  planes de José, es seguir estudiando para poder tener mejores oportunidades de trabajo, también desea mejorar el negocio de su esposa y ayudar a sus hijos, para que puedan estudiar y tener un título universitario y puedan desarrollarse mejor en la sociedad.
texts.en:
José, 31 years old, went to school up to the sixth grade, since he decided to work with his father because the work was a lot and his father wasn't able to do it all alone. José is married and his wife works selling clothing. They have two children, ages 8 and 5, who go to school. 

José works as a bricklayer and has done this work for a long time, but in addition, he has worked in agriculture since he was little. He learned this work helping his father. Also, he gets the support of his wife who has worked selling clothing for the past three years and with the income that she gets, she can help support her husband. 

José will use the loan to purchase agricultural supplies. He will purchase 4 sacks of fertilizer, pay labor costs, and another small part of the loan will be to purchase clothing for his wife's business. Thanks to the granting of the loan, he will be able to benefit them both and in this way get more income and give his family what it needs. 

José's plans are to continue studying to be able to have better work opportunities. He also wants to improve his wife's business and help his children, so that they can go to school and have a university degree and can develop themselves better in society.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of fertilizer, pay labor costs, and a part of the money will be to purchase clothing for his wife's business.

loans.name: Anita Daysi

texts.es:
La socia Anita Daysi trabaja como profesora y tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de tarjetas de cumpleaños y matrimonios,la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tarjetas de cumpleaños y matrimonios.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Anita Daysi works as a teacher and also works at a business selling birthday and wedding cards. She is an enterprising woman who, through this business, wants to get her family ahead. She asks for the loan to purchase birthday and wedding cards.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase birthday and wedding cards.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 46-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family which consists of five people. Her husband is an auto repair mechanic by trade. He has been running an auto repair workshop for the past ten years at the market. 

For many days he has needed some spare parts for his workshop to provide repair services so Kousar made contact with Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan. This will help her to continue her husband's auto-repair business. 

Kousar is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her husband's auto workshop.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is a businesswoman who earns a living from retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks for her house.

loans.name: Sardor

texts.en:
Sardor is an active man. He was born to a family of workers in 1993. He lives in rural area in the northern part of the country with his parents. He is a fourth year student in university. He has made great achievements in his studies. Sardor always participates in competitions and Olympiads within the university. He is well known among students and friends. He is helpful and supportive to relatives and course mates. His parents do not have enough money to pay his tuition fees. 

Sardor requested a loan from KIVA lenders to pay tuition fees. He awaits your kindness. He hopes to graduate from university and have a good job.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee of higher education.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian has always the enthusiasm for managing her farming activities, from which she earns a meager income, helping her husband in support of their family. At the age of 32 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family, most especially for her children's education. She never stopped pursuing her goals for the benefit of the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-pledge member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her farming activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for labor cost in land preparation for growing her crops. 

In the future, Vivian wishes to build her own house for her family.

loans.use: to pay for labor cost in land preparation for growing her crops

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is the age of 46, the mother of three sons and two daughters, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her brother is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her brother offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from his vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the vegetables. 

Therefore, Razia has applied for loan so that her brother would be able to buy more vegetables for selling.

Razia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her brother's shop

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking mother from Lopez Jaena. She is 51 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra. She buys whole coconuts for this. Editha has signed her membership with the cooperative to gain access to insurances and credit. 

She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra.  She hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production)

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 45-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She requested a loan for her husband’s vegetable sales business. Her husband has been selling vegetables for many years; he sells seasonal and fresh vegetables in his hometown. He has been using a four-wheel manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. Now he has opened a shop for selling vegetables, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy initial inventories to run his shop in a well manner. He wants to establish his business but he does not have enough savings to buy vegetables in bulk.

Therefore, Bushra has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her husband's vegetable sales business

loans.name: Wafanyakazi Group

texts.fr: Félix, président du groupe WAFANYAKAZI, s'exprime en ces termes en parlant de son activité agricole: " Après rupture de mon contrat de travail avec la Sucrerie de Kiliba où je travaillais, je me suis mis dans l'agriculture avec le peu d'argent qui me restait. Ce qui me plait dans cette activité c'est le moment de récolter les fruits de son dur labeur. Ces revenus m'aident à couvrir plusieurs besoins de ma famille." Malgré les difficultés courantes de la culture du riz liés à l'eau (problème d'irrigation ou inondation), à l'insuffisance de moyens pour l'achat de produits phytosanitaires et autres, Felix compte s'acheter d'autres champs dont le rendement impactera considérablement dans sa famille. Sur photo, il est au centre et tient un carnet rose.
texts.en: Felix, president of Wafanyakazi Group, said the following when speaking about his agricultural business, "After the end of my work contract with Sucerie de Kiliba where I worked, I started to farm with the small amount of money I had left.  What I like about this business is when you harvest the fruits of your labor. The income helps me pay for several of my family's needs."  Despite the standard challenges of water-related rice farming (irrigation problems or flooding), insufficient funds to buy pesticides and other products, Felix plans to buy more fields because the yield will have a considerable impact on his family.  In the photo, he is in the middle, holding a pink book.

loans.use: to pay for weedkiller, fertilizer, pesticide, field monitoring, and harvest.

loans.name: Ana Carolina

texts.es:
Ana es una joven mujer de 25 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de Humanidades y ciencias de la educación. 
Ella es inteligente, responsable, comprometida, constante, dulce, cariñosa, sensible y sincera. Sus estudios lo realiza en la Universidad pública de la ciudad situada en la zona ‘Central’ que es una mezcla entre lo ancestral, colonial, republicano y moderno, en donde se combinan costumbres ancestrales de los pueblos originarios con la vida moderna y actual, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4-16 grados centígrados.
Ana es de tez morena, cabello negro largo peinado a la moda, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no habla porque estudia y vive en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza junto a sus padres que trabajan como comerciantes, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Ella cursa la carrera de Humanidades y ciencias de la educación, se encuentra en 2 año de 5 años que dura la carrera; disfruta educando a los niños, le gusta enseñar a entender y comprender los problemas básicos de matemáticas, su carácter es de servicio. “estudio en la universidad y trabajo los fines de semana realizando la filmación a todo tipo de eventos…” comenta. La ventaja de su trabajo es que es por las noches o los fines de semana y no se cruza con los estudios, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para mejorar el trabajo. Su sueño es ser profesional para conseguir un buen empleo y desea comprar una computadora portátil para trabajar en su negocio y finalizar sus estudios. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 año que se dedica al estudio profesional. 
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora portátil para trabajar en su negocio y finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ana is a young woman of 25 years of age, is single, without children, and is studying the humanities and sciences in her education.

She is intelligent, responsable, committed, consistent, sweet, loving, sensitive and sincere. She is studying in the public university in the city located in the Central zone which is a mixture of ancestral, colonial, republican and modern, where they combine ancient customs of the indigenous peoples with modern and contemporary life. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 4-16 degrees Celsius. 

Ana is of dark complexion, with black hair that is in style. Her maternal language is Aymará which she does not speak anymore because she studies and lives in the city. She lives her life with her parents who work as traders. They live in their own home made of brick and cement with a tin roof that has the services of potable water, electric energy and sewage. She studies the career of humanities and science education, and is in her second of five years of study. She enjoys educating children, and likes to teach them to understand basic math problems, her character is of service. "I study in the university and I work weekends filming all kinds of events..." she says. The advantage of this works is that it is in the evenings or during the weekends and does not intersect with her studies. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to invest in improving her work. Her dream is to be a professional to continue and get a good job. She wants to buy a laptop computer to work on her business and finalize her studies. This is the first sequence of loans for the institution in the second year that she has been working on professional studies.

It is for these reasons that Ana is requesting a loan to buy a laptop computer to work on her business and finalize her studies.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer to work on her business and complete her studies.

loans.name: Jessica Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia es Jessica Elizabeth se dedica al trabajo como profesora,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener un colegio.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un artefacto para su casa un equipo de sonido.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member's name is Jessica Elizabeth. She works as a teacher to support her family. Her dream is to have her own school. Jessica is requesting a loan to purchase sound equipment for use in her home. She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase sound equipment for use in her home.

loans.name: Ma. Seina

texts.en:
Ma. Seina is 44 years old, married, and has three children. With two children currently in school, Ma. Seina works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Seina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, canned goods, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioner, etc.  

Ma. Seina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Ma. Seina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.en:
Ulugbek is a hardworking young man. He was born in a family of workers in 1994. He lives in a rural area where traditions and culture have remained since ancient times. He is single and lives with his parents. 

He is a third year student at Tajik State University. The university is situated in a city and to get there he needs money. The money that his parents earn is spent on everyday needs. They have not money to pay tuition fees for studies. 

He wants to be a lawyer and find a good work place. Ulugbek is asking a loan from Kiva lenders and IMON to pay tuition fees for his education. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for his education.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, 42, engages in a hog-raising business. She raises and sells hogs to earn a living. She is a married woman with eight dependents. Her eldest child is 19 and the youngest is 5 years old. Aside from hog raising, she also does a food-vending business. She sells snack food to the people in her place.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional pigs and pig feed and to have additional capital for food vending. It will boost Marites' sources of income. She could now raise and sell healthy hogs in the coming months. She could also prepare more snack food to sell.

In the future, Marites, would like to expand her both businesses to support the needs of her growing children and also for the improvement of their status of living.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and pig feed and have  additional capital for food vending.

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.en:
Sanavbar is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1972. She is living in a small town. 

Sanavbar is divorced and lives with her brother. For more than ten years she has worked at a medical centre as a nurse. The money that she earns is not enough to live. 

She helps her brother keeping livestock and seasonally goes to help agrarians in the harvest. 

She wants to have her own livestock and do a business. She is asking a loan to buy cattle and live better on the gained profit. Sanavbar is hoping to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy cattle and live better on the gained profit.

loans.name: Cristo Rey De Cuquipata Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal CRISTO REY DE CUQUIPATA, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de La Convención, distrito de Yanatile y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Nora  tiene 45 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio  de agricultura ,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, a la vez la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le  va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The member is affiliated with the Cristo Rey de Cuquipata Community Bank, which is located in the province of La Convención, in the district of Yanatile of the department of Cuzco. Her name is Nora; she is 45 years old, single, and has a son. Nora splits her time between her daily activities and her farming business, which she has been running for a long time. The business is successful thanks to the hard work she invests in it every day. She also has been raising small animals for a long time. The business is successful thanks to the hard work she invests in it every day. Nora would like to continue working to support her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Our members are grateful for the loans provided and are committed to make payments as agreed.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine, a 44-year-old married woman, lives with her family in a small village of the Zugdidi district. The family lives in poverty as they don't have any significant income. 

Ekaterine wants to start a trading business in order to generate income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 4,500 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of clothes in order to resell them at higher price. The Start Up loan will be a great support for her family as she will have money to cover everyday expenses. 

Ekaterine awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to trade clothes.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is 39 years old. She is a responsible mother of two sons and three daughters. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which comprises seven persons. 

She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services at her own house. 

She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her work, including thread, needles, and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. 

Therefore Suriya requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her a loan, as she requested. Suriya is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her own stitching work.

loans.name: Wencislao

texts.en:
Wencislao runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells commodities like canned goods, noodles, sugar, seasonings, toiletries, chorizo (pork sausage) and soft drinks. Aside from that, he also raises and sells hogs for supplemental income. He is a 48-year-old married man with six children, ages 22 to 11 years old. He lives in Dulag, Leyte. 

He is asking for a loan to buy stock for the store and pig feed. More stock will improve the content of his store and attract more buyers. His hog-raising business will slowly improve and his income will increase. Thus, he could support the needs of his growing children.

Wencislao hopes that he will be able to properly handle his sources of income and that his businesses will become sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy stocks for the store and pig feed and do some motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a machine for making dough.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Lucia has requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business, which she has been in for eight years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a hardworking entrepreneur who operates a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns additional income from a general store. 

Remedios is requesting a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more varieties of vegetables to sell. She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 42 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Juditha has a pig fattening business in the Philippines which she has been doing for 12 years. 

Juditha requested another loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and works hard to support her family. She operates a tailoring business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 17 years.

Josephine requested another loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more materials for her tailoring business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida, 46, is the mother of one child, living with her spouse and child in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a green grocer by profession and has owned a fresh vegetable shop in a nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from his vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of the vegetables. 

Therefore, Sajida, her wife, has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy excess seasonal vegetables. Sajida says thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase crude salt

loans.name: Zoila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Zoila, de 46 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora, estudio hasta segundo grado, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, porque su familia  no contaba con los recursos suficientes; actualmente está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a sembrar granos básicos como maíz y frijol; es madre de 7 hijos, 3 de ellos  ya están acompañados y viven a parte, los otros cuatro están estudiando.

Zoila, se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su casa y también se dedica a la agricultura junto a su pareja, ellos siembran granos para vender, pero también para su alimentación.-  A parte de estas actividades, se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, pues en estos trabajos tiene mucha experiencia y le genera  buenos ingresos económicos, sus hijos les ayudan en las actividades agrícolas.

El financiamiento del préstamo lo necesita para comprar 5 sacos de abono, pagar mano de obra, comprar 100 pollitos y 5 sacos de concentrado para pollos; gracias al financiamiento del préstamo ella lograra cumplir sus deseos de tener mejores cultivos y también una buena granja de pollos. 

Zoila, siempre ha querido tener su vivienda bonita, es por eso que sueña con remodelar su casita; también desea tener mejores cosechas, en los años venideros y que sus hijos puedan estudiar, para que sean personas de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Zoila is 46 years old, she is a very hard working woman. She went to school up until the second grade and did not have the opportunity to continue studying because her family did not have the necessary resources. She is currently accompanied by her partner who makes a living planting basic grains such as corn and beans. She is a mother of seven children, three of which have relationships and live on their own, the other four are students. 

Zoila takes care of the housework and also works in agriculture with her partner, they always plant grains to sell, but also for their own consumption. Besides these activities, she also works in the rearing of broiler chickens as she has a lot of experience in the business and generates a good income for herself. Her children help her with the agricultural activities. 

She needs the financing from this loan to purchase five bags of fertilizer, pay for labor, purchase 100 chicks and five bags of chicken feed. Financing of the loan will allow her to fulfill her wishes of having better harvests and a better poultry farm.

Zoila, has always wanted to have a pretty home, this is why she dreams about remodeling her small house; she also wishes to have better harvests in the coming years and for her children to study so they can benefit society.

loans.use: purchase 5 bags of fertilizer, pay for labor, purchase 100 chicks and 5 bags of chicken feed

loans.name: Petre

texts.en:
Petre is 42 years old and is from the Tskaltubo district. He lives with his wife and student son. 

The family has a cow and a pig. His wife produces dairy products to sell locally. Petre has a minibus and decided to start a trading business with his minibus. 

The Start up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,600 GEL. With the received credit he will purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables to start a trading business. He will get additional and more stable income and will improve the living conditions of his family.

Petre awaits your support.

loans.use: to start trading fruits and vegetables with his own minibus.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia Edith se dedica al negocio de internet,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el ngeocio de internet.La socia solicita el credito para comprar una computadora para su cabina de internet.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The partner, Edith, makes a living running an internet business. She wants to help her family progress through this business. Her dream is to expand her internet business. Edith is requesting the credit to purchase a computer for her internet cafe. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to fulfilling her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase a computer for her internet booth

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La socia Feliciana se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria cuyes y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member Feliciana still has her business raising animals; she raises guinea pigs and hens. By means of this business she wants to get her family ahead. Her dream is to expand the business raising animals. She is asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs and hens. Feliciana is happy about the loan and she promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and hens

loans.name: Carlos Arnoldo

texts.es:
Arnoldo, de 58 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y es padre de 4 hijos, 3 ya son independientes y solo su hija de 15 años de edad, vive en casa con ellos.

Arnoldo, se dedica a muchas actividades desde hace algunos años, una de ellas es la siembra de granos básicos, el cuido de la finca de café y siembra de enequen, estas actividades las realiza en parcelas cerca de su casa y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar.

Arnoldo, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, para la siembra de granos básicos ya que se acerca la temporada y otra parte del dinero la ocupara para invertirla en el mejoramiento de su finca.
 
El sueño de Arnoldo, es seguir trabajando para poder comprar una maquina para procesar enequen y de esa manera ahorrar lo que invierte en alquiler de maquinaria y obtener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Arnoldo is 58 years old, he studied until the 6th grade. He has a partner and is the father of four children, three of them are independent and only his 15 year old daughter lives at home with them. Arnoldo has been making a living through a variety of activities for several years now, one of which is the farming of basic grains, the others include taking care of the coffee farm and the agave crop. He performs these activities in parcels near his home and his wife takes care of the housework. 
Arnoldo needs the loan to purchase fertilizers for the planting of basic grains as the season for them approaches. He will invest another part of the money in the improvement of his farm. 
Arnoldo's dream is to continue working in order to be able to buy an agave processing machine allowing him to save the money he currently spends on the rental of such machines and therefore obtain better profits and a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers for the planting of basic grains

loans.name: Karam

texts.en:
Karam is a 21 year-old single man from a refugee came near Nablus city. He lives with his family in very poor conditions. Karam would like to open a store to sell cosmetics and makeup in the city. This will help him to be independent and improve his family's living conditions.
Karam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy cosmetic products and makeup for his store to resell.
Karam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and makeup for his store to resell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Carlos se dedica al negocio de venta de choclos, el socio por medio de este pequeño negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño del socio es tener un local donde puede vender los choclos.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar choclos al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member Carlos has a business selling sweet corn. By means of this small business he wants to get his family ahead. His dream is to have a place where he can sell the sweet corn. He is asking for the loan to buy sweet corn wholesale. Carlos is happy about the loan and promises to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy sweet corn wholesale

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
La socia Lucy se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de gelatinas y también la socia vende huevo sancochado,ella vende en las diferentes calles, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de estos pequeños negocios quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar gelatinas y huevos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member Lucy still has her business selling gelatins and she also sells hard-boiled eggs. She sells in various streets and is an enterprising woman who wants to get her family ahead by means of these small businesses. She is asking for the loan to buy gelatins and eggs. Lucy is happy about the loan and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy gelatins and eggs.

loans.name: Jocely

texts.en:
Jocely is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocely is 43 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Jocely has a buying and selling of ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. Jocely requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jocely has been in this business for 11 years. Jocely would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva works hard to support her family. Eva is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Eva requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc., for her business.

Eva has been in this business for 10 years now.

Eva would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc., for her business

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 49 years old and married with five children.

Conchita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Conchita has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Conchita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia works hard to support her family. Anastacia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Anastacia requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients and materials like bamboo sticks, meat, spices, etc. for her business.

Anastacia has been in this business for 10 years now.

Anastacia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and materials like bamboo sticks, meat, spices, etc. for her business

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Adelaida is 42 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Adelaida has a food vending business in the Philippines. Adelaida requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business.

Adelaida has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jacqueline is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

Jacqueline has a sewing business in the Philippines. Jacqueline requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her sewing business.

Jacqueline has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jacqueline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell for her vegetable-vending business.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years. Gloria earns additional income from a general store.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Federita

texts.en:
Federita is 51 years old and married with two children. 

Federita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Federita requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Federita has been in the pig fattening business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Federita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is a 34 year-old single mother of 2 who lives in Kagadi Uganda where she owns a stationary shop to support her and the children. However hardworking Justine is challenged by bad debts in her business that greatly affects her cash flow. She hopes to start up a wholesale shop in future. She is asking for a loan to add stock of stationary like reams of paper, pens, and toner among other items to sell.

loans.use: to add stocks of stationary like reams of paper, pens, and toner among other items to sell.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a second-time borrower of the institution, applying for a loan of UGX 3,000,000. He is 42 years old and married with three children. He has been able to provide for the children with the help of his wife. He has been working with a petrol station for over eight years.

After his children grew up, he realized that a sole income was enough. Together with his wife, who has a diploma in fashion and design, they agreed to start up a small business making wedding gowns for sale and hire, using his small savings. Godfrey found out that this business has greatly helped them to take care of and educate their children without any hardship.

Together still, Godfrey and his wife have found that it would be a worthwhile undertaking to purchase more sewing machines to be used to start training students who would like to pursue a course in line with tailoring and fashion designing. Financially, they are constrained. Because Godfrey has been borrowing from UGAFODE Microfinanace Limited (MDI), he has opted to apply for a loan to purchase the machines that they want.

Godfrey's future hope is seeing his family business grow into a very big one to be proud of.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.ru: Сарвиноз молодая девушка из городка Куляб. Ей 27 лет. Она замужем и имеет детей. Сарвиноз вместе с мужем продвигает торговую деятельность. Они вместе продают одежду и ткани для шитья национальной одежды. Сарвиноз обратилась за кредитом, чтобы привезти новый ассортимент товара и привлечь новых клиентов. Сарвиноз верит, что ей поддержат в получении кредита, и она вместе с мужем расширить их деятельность. Спасибо!
texts.en: Sarvinoz is a young woman from the city of Kulob. She is 27, married, and has children. Sarvinoz and her husband have a retail business selling clothing and fabric for sewing traditional clothes. Sarvinoz applied for a loan in order to bring in a new assortment of goods and attract new customers. Sarvinoz believes she will be supported in obtaining a loan and that she and her husband will expand their business. Thank you!

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing and fabrics

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn  is a merchant from Dulag, Leyte. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store, selling goods ranging from biscuits, seasonings, noodles, shampoo, beverages to soft drinks. She is a married woman with six grown children. She has been running a store for more than 10 years. She is in need of capital to be able to continue operate her existing business. 

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted stocks for the store and pig feed for her other business. This loan will help improve the contents of her store and attract more customers to shop. It will slowly improve her earnings and able to handle her finances. She could now start expanding her business.

She hopes that she will be successful in handling her both businesses for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy assorted stocks for the store and pig feed for her other business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water-purification machine for the family house

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.en: Komiljon is a hardworking man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1964. He is living in the small town of Istaravshan with a beautiful history. He is married and has four children. Komiljon for the last 25 year has worked at a secondary school. He teaches foreign languages. He earns less then he needs to pay for the higher education costs of his son. He is thankful to the service of IMON and the KIVA project. He asked for a loan to pay tuition fee of his son. He awaits KIVA lenders and IMON kindness. He hopes his son will be educated and have a good job.

loans.use: To pay the higher education costs for his son

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has a buying and selling of dried fish business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell to her customers.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 15 years now.

Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Neufita

texts.en:
Neufita is 48 years old and married with two children.

Neufita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Neufita has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Neufita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosario is 57 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Rosario has a general store business in the Philippines. Rosario requested a PHP 35,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosario has been in this business for three years. Rosario would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 49 years old with one child.

Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like coffee, biscuits, candies, beverages, personal care products and other groceries.

Gloria has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from a carenderia (food vending).

Gloria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like coffee, biscuits, candies, beverages, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 62 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Thelma works very hard to provide for the family.

Thelma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Thelma has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, beauty products, canned goods, beverages and other groceries. 

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosie is 36 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rosie has a general store business in the Philippines. Rosie requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Rosie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en:
Rufa works hard to support her family. Rufa is married and has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

Rufa requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers.

Rufa has been in this business for 10 years.

Rufa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kigata Kwesigangana Group

texts.en:
Benard is a Ugandan married and hardworking man of 39 years with four children. He lives in Kagadi, where he operates a restaurant, sells produce and farms for financial support. 

He used the previous loan to buy maize, beans and ground nuts for selling. He hopes to grow his business and improve his family’s welfare, despite little capital being his major challenge. 

Benard is asking for credit to buy foodstuffs for the restaurant, like rice and bananas for cooking. He is a member of Kigata Kwesigangana Group, in which each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for the restaurant, like rice and bananas for cooking.

loans.name: Evelia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Más de 7 años tiene Evelia de haber iniciado su negocio de pulpería, en su hogar, y con el tiempo ha logrado que se convierta en una fuente rentable y próspera de ingresos económicos. Por ello se siente agradecida con los prestamos que MiCrédito le ha facilitado, pues gracias a ellos ha podido abastecer su pulpería con productos de creciente demanda. 
Por ello, Evelia solicita un nuevo financiamiento que lo invertirá en su pulpería con la compra de granos básicos como; arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, y demás productos como gaseosas, golosinas, jabones, shampoo, papel higiénico, salsas de tomate, etc. Con el cual podrá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos y en consiguiente sus ingresos aumentaran.
texts.en:
Evelia started her grocery store business in her home more than seven years ago, and over time she has managed to turn it into a profitable and prosperous source of income. She is therefore grateful for the loans that MiCrédito has given her, as thanks to them she has been able to stock her grocery store with products of growing demand. 

For this reason, Evelia is asking for a new loan that she will invest in her grocery store with the purchase of basic grains like rice, beans, sugar, oil, and other products like soft drinks, candy, soap, shampoo, toilet paper, tomato sauce, etc. With this she will be able to offer a greater variety of products and her earnings will thus increase.

loans.use: to buy basic grains like rice, beans, sugar, oil, and other products like soft drinks, candy, soap, shampoo, toilet paper, tomato sauce, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Julia Emilia

texts.es: Julia de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijol desde hace 20 años, también posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía  para así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Julia, age 42, lives in her own house with her husband and her son.  She has been growing corn and beans for 20 years.  She also has a store that is located at her house.  She sells her products in the areas around where she lives.  With what she gets from her sales, she manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, compost, and fertilizers, etc. and to improve the land that is shown in the photo.  She will do this in order to be able to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and fertilizers, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Deyvis

texts.es:
El socio Deyvis se sigue dedicando al negocio de artesania, el socio vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, el socio es una persona emprendedora que por medios de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesania. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos,mantas, chompas y telares.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member Deyvis still has his crafts business. He sells fabrics, sweaters, blankets and looms. He is an enterprising person who wants to get his family ahead by means of this business. His dream is to expand the business selling crafts. He is asking for the loan to buy fabrics, blankets, sweaters and looms. Deyvis is happy about the loan and promises to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, blankets, sweaters and looms

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Group

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Timotea  tiene 43 años de edad tiene 06 hijos y es conviviente,  la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas, entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos  y se comprometen  a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank Señor de Huanca. It is located in the province of Paucartambo, region of Cusco.
Timotea is 43 years old, she has 6 children and lives with her partner. She alternates her daily occupations with the clothing sales business. She has had success with the business, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She is a responsible and hard-working person. She wishes to keep working and in this way keep supporting her family. 
The member asks for a loan to purchase sweaters, among other items. The members feel grateful and they are committed to meeting the payments.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters, among other items.

loans.name: Geiner

texts.es: Geiner tiene la edad de 29 años, está casado y vive con la esposa y un hijo actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de dos novillos para darle la a adecuada alimentación y poder venderlos en el peso adecuado. El desea poder   tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Geiner is 29 years old, is married, and lives with his wife and their son. He would like a loan to purchase two heifers. He will feed them adequately and sell them at the proper weight. He would like to have more income.

In the future, he hopes to provide his family a better quality of life and more financial stability, and to continue growing as a person. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has not received other loans from state-run banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Enalyn

texts.en:
Enalyn is 24 years old. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years. She earns additional income from a carinderia (a mini-restaurant). 

Enalyn requested her second loan from NWTF for 6,000 PHP, which she wlll use to buy items such as beverages, biscuits, personal care products, and other supplies. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, biscuits, personal care products, and other supplies

loans.name: Noah

texts.en: Noah is a single man, age 28, living in Kagadi, Uganda where he sells produce and has a retail shop to earn income to support his family's increasing demands. He is hard working and his dream is to make more money and start up another income-generating activity like poultry. He is challenged by price fluctuations leading to low returns in business. Noah is asking for a loan to buy maize flour, sugar and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, sugar and other general merchandise for selling

loans.name: Kyanaisoke Tweheyo  Group

texts.en: Margret is a 27-year-old, married, hardworking woman with 1 child living in Kagadi, Uganda. She owns a drug shop where she earns a living. She hopes to grow her business despite insufficient capital leading to under stocking and in turn low returns on her sales. Margret is requesting a loan to increase her stock by buying human drugs for selling. She is a member of Kyanaisoke Tweheyo Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.The extra three people in the photo are members of the group not taking the loan but who guaranteed others.

loans.use: buy human drugs (medicines) for selling

loans.name: Jairo Vicente

texts.es:
La agricultura es un negocio difícil y solo las personas con carácter fuerte y buenas habilidades de producción, pueden salir a delante con él.  Jairo es ejemplo de esto, porque ya son más de 3 años, desde que inició con los sembradíos y hoy, sus producciones son gratamente remuneradas. Él agradece el financiamiento que MiCrédito le otorgó, porque con eso pudo sembrar su cosecha anterior.
Sin embargo, solicita un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes y diésel de riego, además de la adquisición de un tractor para arar.  Esto le será de gran utilidad, porque podrá iniciar su siembra sin mayores complicaciones, y en consiguiente, obtendrá una excelente cosecha.
texts.en:
Agriculture is a difficult business, and only people with a strong character and good production abilities can move forward with it. Jairo is an example of this because, since he started his business more than 3 years ago, his efforts have paid off greatly.

He is grateful for the financing that MiCredito has provided because he was able to sow his previous crops. Nonetheless, he is requesting another loan to purchase fertilizer, diesel fuel, and a tractor with which to plow the fields. This will be very useful because he will be able to start to sow without great complications and, as a result, obtain an excellent harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, diesel fuel, and purchase a tractor to plow the fields.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y es padre de 2 hijos, uno de 7 años y otro de 3 años.

Carlos, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas desde hace 10 años, lo aprendió de su padre y es un negocio que le genera buenos ingresos y que le sirve también para el consumo en su familia; también se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva maíz y frijol y su pareja le ayuda en los oficios del hogar y en el cuido de sus hijos.

Carlos, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizante y pagar mano de obra para sembrar, porque se acerca la temporada para hacerlo.
 
Carlos, sueña con mejorar y ampliar más sus cultivos de hortalizas y que estas le generen mejores ganancias para darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 30, went to school through the sixth grade.  He is in a relationship, and he has two children.  One of them is seven, and the other one is three.

Carlos has been growing vegetables for ten years.  He learned this from his father.  It is a business that generates good income for him, and it also is used for family consumption.  He also grows corn and beans.  His life partner helps him with the household chores and the care of his children.

Carlos needs the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor to plant because the season for doing so is approaching.

Carlos dreams of improving and expanding his vegetable crops.  He dreams that these crops will generate better earnings for him in order to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor to plant.

loans.name: Sherzod

texts.en:
Sherzod is an active guy. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1984. He lives with his parents in a small town which is near the mountains. He is a student at university and studies finance and credit. He has a dream to graduate his education with excellence and have a job at IMON. He is active at classes and well known among friends and students. Unfortunately, he and his parents do not have enough money to pay tuition fees for his studies. 

Now Sherzod is asking a loan to pay higher education costs. He hopes to be supported by KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To pay higher education costs

loans.name: La Enconada Group

texts.es:
Esperanza es una mujer de 43 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos varones de 7, 11, 15 y 20 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano. 
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Cotoca’ un área rural ubicada al este de la ciudad, conocida por sus comidas tradicionales y por la fabricación de mermeladas, también por sus tradicionales horneados de maíz y yuca, como; el sonso, roscas, arepas, cuñapés y bizcochos, los pobladores son herederos de una cultura artesanal de cerámicas, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados Centígrados.
Esperanza es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla (sentada, la primera de la derecha). Su vida la disfruta con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad por ampliar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos, venta de polleras, venta de helado, elaboración de empanadas, venta de mantas, venta de material escolar, venta de prendas de policía, servicio de limpieza y venta de cereales, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, como; pantalones, poleras, camisetas, camisas, blusas, chompas, chamarras, etc., ella necesita abastecer su negocio con mayor variedad y cantidad de ropa para competir en el mercado, también desea abrir otra tienda en el mismo rubro en otro mercado. “inicié mi negocio con alguna cuantas prendas, ahora ya pienso en abrir una tienda…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa se vende constantemente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para poder invertir y hacer crecer su negocio. Su sueño es tener 2 tiendas propias, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor. 
Es por esos motivos que Esperanza solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para abrir una tienda nueva.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 43 years old, lives with her partner. She has 4 boys aged 7, 11, 15 and 20 years old. Her business is selling used clothing. She is a good mother, enterprising, patient, consistent, responsible and hard-working.

She does her business in Cotoca, a rural area located to the east of the city, known for it's traditional eateries and for making marmelade. It is also known for it's baked corn and yucca goods like sonso, roscas arepas, cuñapés and bizcochos. The inhabitant are the inheritors of a culture of handicraft pottery. It has a hot, tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius.

Esperanza is dark-skinned, dark eyes, has long black hair that she wears tied back, is short in stature and a robust build. Her native language is Guarani which she speaks in her family and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. (in the photo she is seated, the first on the right).

She shares her life with her partner who works in comstruction and her children who study in school. They live in their own room which is made of brick and cement and has running water electricity and sewage. The need to expand her business led her to form a group of people with businesses like selling prefume, the sales of soft drinks, selling polleras (traditional skirts), the sale of ice-cream, selling blankets, making empanadas, selling school supplies, selling police uniforms, a claening service and selling cereals to request a loan and improve their services.

Her business is selling second hand clothing like pants, t-shirts, polo shirts, shirts, blouses, sweaters, jackets, etc. She needs to stock her business with a greater variety and quantity of clothing to compete in the market. She also wants to open another store in the same field in another market. "I started my business with a few pieces of clothing and now I am thinking of opening a store", she commented.

The advantage of her business is that clothing sells constantly and her disadvantage is the lack of capital to invest and expand her business. Her dream is to have two stores of her own. She wants to invest in her business through the purchase of used clothing wholesale. For these resaons Esperanza is requesting a loan to buy used clothing wholesale to open a new store.

loans.use: to buy used clothing wholesale to open a new store.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own tricycle unit for years now and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs. She works hard, for she is determined to have better income.

To improve sales, Dolores would like to apply for a new loan. With 19,000 PHP, she could purchase spare parts and accessories for their vehicle needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Dolores hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, accessories, and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 63 years old and has eight children. She is married and has one child in school.

Leonarda is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Leonarda has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leonarda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jose Danilo

texts.es:
José, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está soltero, no tiene hijos y en su casa solo vive con sus padres y dos hermanas.

José, se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 3 años, también se dedica a sembrar hortalizas como tomate y ejotes, su lugar de trabajo está a 3 kilómetros desde su casa, una parte de la parcela la alquila y la otra es propia.

José, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y para pagar mano de obra que le ayude a sembrar.

José, sueña con mejorar su vivienda y darle más comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 28 years old, attended school until third grade, and is single. He does not have children and lives with his parents and two sisters. José has worked as a bricklayer for the past 3 years, and also grows vegetables like tomatoes and green beans. His workplace is located 3 kilometers from his house. He rents one part of the land and owns the other part.

José needs the loan in order to purchase fertilizers and pay laborers who will help him to sow his fields. He dreams of improving his home and providing more comfort for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay laborers who will help him to sow his fields.

loans.name: Diomedesa

texts.en:
Diomedesa is 60 years old; she is married with three children.

Diomedesa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Diomedesa has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from fish vending.

Diomedesa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Magda Denis

texts.es:
La señora Magda tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera con 3 hijos, reside en el Municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de cacahuate (mani), con las ganancias obtenidas decidió establecer el negocio de venta de mercadería de manera ambulante (calzado para damas, caballeros, niños y ropa interior). Doña Magda cuenta con experiencia crediticia, ella  ha obtenido varios préstamos en la institución. actualmente solicita uno por la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de calzado y ropa en general para vender. Doña Magda comenta que con las ganancias que ha obtenido de su negocio ha logrado comprar utensilios para su hogar y proporcionarles el estudio a sus 3 hijos. Ella planea a futuro establecer su negocio de manera estacionaria en su vivienda y lograr la sostenibilidad económica.
texts.en: Magda is 50 years old, she is a single mother with 3 children. She lives in the Municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Previously, she worked in the sale of peanuts. With the profits she decided to open a business as a street vendor selling merchandise (footwear for ladies, men, children, and underwear). Magda has experience with loans, she has obtained several through the institution. Currently she asks for one in the amount of 15,000 lempiras, which she will invest in the purchase of footwear and general clothing to sell. Magda says that with the profit she has obtained from her business she has managed to purchase tools for her home and brought an education to her 3 children. She plans in the future to establish her business in a permanent location in her home and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase footwear and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 52 years old, married and has three children. 

Carmelita is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. Carmelita has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save money to expand business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Rami

texts.en: Rami is a 26-year-old single man from Gaza City. He works as an employee in a private company, and his father works as an employee in the public sector. They both have a very low income. In the last violence in Gaza, the family home was destroyed completely, and now they are living in a rental apartment. Rami took a loan from Kiva's partner, Palestine for Credit & Development, to help him rebuild part of the family house. Rami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild part of the family house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 5 años, también se dedica a la crianza de ganando bovino, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas sopas, frescos, golosinas, huevos, pan dulce, charamuscas, chocobabanos, etc. todo por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: The youth who has her face blanked is 27 years old and lives in a high risk zone. She has had a small store located in her residence for 5 years. She also works raising cattle and with what she gains from her work she manages to pay some of the household expenses. She lives in her own house with her husband and is requesting the loan to buy more soup, drinks, sweets, eggs, pastries, charamuscas, chocobabanos, etc. all at wholesale to be able to continue with her sales and improve her economic income.

loans.use: to buy more soups, drinks, sweets, eggs, bread, charamuscas, chocobananas, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: As a married mother of two children, Susana works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs and selling rice. Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans with Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF). Susana is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is a hard-working, 25-year-old married man, with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. For three years Ronald has been mining and trading in crude salt. He dreams of having enough capital to grow his business. Weather changes pose a challenge to his business growth and expansion. Ronald intends to use the loan to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
Armando, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado, es padre de 2 hijos, un niño de 6 años y la niña de 2 años de edad.

Armando, trabaja manejando una maquina de reparación de calles, desde hace 4 años, él tiene que desplazarse hasta otro departamento para realizar su labor; antes se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero ahora no puede porque ya no le queda mucho tiempo, su esposa trabaja como empleada en una alcaldía y su horario de trabajo es de lunes a viernes de 8:00 de la mañana a 3:30 de la tarde.

Armando, necesita el crédito para comprar muebles para su hogar, para que sus hijos tengan mejor comodidad.

El sueño de Armando, es mejorar su vivienda y darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Armando is 30 years old and studied up to the sixth grade. He is married and the father of two children, a six-year old boy and a two-year-old girl.

Armando works operating a street repair machine. For the last four years, he has had to move to another department to do his work. Previously, he was dedicated to agriculture, but now he can not do that because not much free time is left to him. His wife works as an employee in the town's administrative office. Her work schedule is from Monday through Friday, between 8:00 in the morning and 3:30 in the afternoon.

Armando needs a loan to buy furniture for his home, so that his children can live more comfortably.

Armando's dream is to improve his home and offer his family better living conditions

loans.use: purchase furniture for his home, so that his children will live more comfortably.

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania owns and operates a tailoring business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for nine years, and she repaid her previous loan used for her enterprise. 

Melania is requesting a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting PHP 12,000 to buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, threads and other materials needed in her business. 

In the future, Melania wants to make improvements to both her house and her family's general living conditions. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Percelinda

texts.en:
Percelinda is a 58-year-old married mother of five children, one of whom is still in school. A very hardworking entrepreneur, she has been operating a handicraft business in the Philippines for nine years now. 

Percelinda has requested a PHP 50000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business. She would like to build and expand her enterprise to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Condrada

texts.en:
Condrada is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Condrada is 50 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Condrada has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, butter, sugar, etc. for her food production business.

Condrada has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, butter, sugar, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 62 years old and married with 10 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Magdalena has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing net and other fishing equipment.

Magdalena has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia is 54 years old and married with 11 children. Three of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Artemia is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Artemia has been raising pigs for 24 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single man from a village near Jenin city. He works as a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income. 

He wants to take some courses to increase his GPA and register at the university. He wants to improve himself and find a better job in the future.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the course fees for his studies. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the course fees for his studies

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is a 26-year-old single man from a village near Nablus city. Islam works as an employee in the public sector, earning a low income. He is also a student studying Business Administration at a local university. Islam would like to earn the BA degree and find a better job in the future.

Islam requested a USD loan from FATEN to help him pay his university tuition for this semester. This will help him to pay part of the urgent expenses he has. 

Islam appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay university installments for this semester

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.ru:
Хайринисо 36 лет. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. Хайринисо в городе живет вместе мужем, детьми и сестренкой.  Детям 16 и 17 лет. Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. 
Хайринисо честная и шустрая женщина. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды у себя дома. Ей научила ее мама. Уже 5 лет Хайринисо продвигает свою деятельность. Она трудится и зарабатывает на жизнь. У Хайринисо есть салон красоты. В салоне работает ее сестренка. Хайринисо просит кредит, чтобы поменять дверь салон красоты. Из-за нехватки денежных средств она обратилась к Вам за кредитом.
texts.en:
