Khayriniso is 36 years old. She is married and a mother of two children. Khayriniso lives in the city with her husband, children and sister. Her children are 16 and 17 years old. Her husband currently works in the Russian Federation.

Khayriniso is an honest and smart woman. She is involved in sewing women's clothing at home. Her mother taught her this trade. Khayriniso has been running her business for 5 years now. She works and earns a living. Khayriniso has a a beauty salon, where her sister works. Khayriniso is requesting this loan to replace the door of the beauty salon. She came to You for a loan due to a shortage in money.

loans.use: to replace the door of her beauty salon

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn has a small coconut farm in Aloran, Philippines, from which she earns a good income every quarter for her family to survive. To generate additional earnings, she wants to plant bananas and grow root crops. 

Ginalyn makes it a point to do good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. She recently needed a loan to pay for the clearing and plowing of land and holing and planting of seedlings, so she borrowed from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Ginalyn wishes to have more produce and be able to supply agri-products in the market.

loans.use: to pay for the clearing and plowing of land and holing and planting of seedlings

loans.name: Evernadeth

texts.en:
Evernadeth is a mother of three children.  She wants to earn a living by helping her husband, that's why she is engaged in a fishing dealer business. 

She wants to give her family a good living, so she decided again to take a loan to buy additional fishing net for catching more fish and enableong to expand her business to earn more income.

In the future, Evernadeth wants to save money out from her business and be able to sustain the needs of her family

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net for catching more fish.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline has mastered her hog raising business in Baybay, Bonifacio, in the Philippines. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her husband in addition to income for the family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. 

When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. Just as how she takes care her hog raising business and so with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run to them for any financing needs. 

Now the loan of Php 12,000 will help her build concrete pig pens that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to build concrete pig pens

loans.name: Bienvenido

texts.en:
Bienvenido has prepared considerably for the post-harvest operations of his palay in Aloran. He wants to ensure that he will have ample time for the  threshing, drying, storage and processing of his harvest to make way for another cropping season. 

He presented his proposal to Paglaum Multi-Pupose Cooperative and took a loan.  Bienvenido hopes to see all of his family in good living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 41 years old and has six children.  She is married and all of her children are sent to school.

Mary Grace is in the agricultural business, farming bananas and rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

Mary Grace has been farming bananas and rice for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, fish containers, etc. for her fishing business.

Conchita has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Conchita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, fish containers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase taxi transmitters and install them in cars

loans.name: Dan

texts.en: Dan is a 40-year-old male, married with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a shop of general merchandise and also practices farming, growing crops such as onions, maize, rice, cabbage and others. Dan has a dream of educating his children. However, he is faced with a challenge of limited capital plus poor climatic changes. Dan wants a loan to buy sugar, salt, soap, rice, cassava and other merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soap, rice, cassava and other merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales (pollos y cerdos) desde hace 15 años, también se dedica a la venta de frutas, vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar el lugar donde mantienes a los animales que es el que muestra la fotografía construyendo unos corrales y galeras, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de madrea, clavos, laminas, malla ciclón y pago de mano de obra para poder mantener en un mejor lugar a los animales.
texts.en: Carmen is 59 years old and lives in a home of her own with her life’s partner.  She has been raising animals (pigs and chickens) for 15 years and she also sells fruit in the nearby villages.  She is able to pay some of the household expenses with her earnings and she wants to make improvements to the area where she keeps her animals, shown in the photo.  She wants to build some pens and henhouses, so she is asking for a loan to buy lumber, nails, metal, fencing, and pay for labor to have a better place for her animals.

loans.use: to build pens and henhouses.

loans.name: Prosperidad-Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD-CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nora Julia ella es casada y tiene 64 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos naturales, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de productos naturales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos naturales.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “PROSPERIDAD-CUSCO” communal bank which is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and Cusco department.

Nora Julia is 64 years old, married and has 4 children. She works in her business selling natural products. She works from 8 am until 5 pm. She has been in the business for 4 years and things are going well for her. Her dream is to expand her business of selling natural products. She is requesting a loan to buy natural products.

The other members work at businesses like selling sweets, selling clothing, a grocery store and a bookstore. The member thanks all those who form part of this dream through this loan and promises to comply with the payment of her installments in the establish time-frame.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El socio Felix continua dedicándose a la agricultura y la ganadería, él  socio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad, el socio continua  cultivando trigo, cebada, papa, tubérculos, hortalizas y otras cosas más, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio pertenece al  banco comunal “Apu Asangani”.
El socio  requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono.
texts.en: Felix continues working in agriculture and raising livestock. He is grateful for and values the loan and promises to pay the monthly installments with great responsibility. He continues to grow barley, potatoes, root crops, vegetables and others, this being the way he gets his family ahead. He belongs to the “Apu Asangani” communal bank. He needs the loan to buy seeds and manure.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Her earnings helped send her child to school and helped them meet their daily living expenses. She was also able to start selling cooked food (meals) at her store. 

She would now like to apply for a 55,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles to sell at her store. She will also use part of the loan to buy ingredients such as fresh pork, chicken, fish, veggies, and condiments to prepare meals to sell at her food stall just in front of her small grocery store. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. The income from her store is a stable source to provide for her family's basic needs and for her child's education.

Olivia dreams of having a bigger general store and canteen someday. She aims to give her child a good college education to allow her better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her store, as well as ingredients for her food stall.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Pacita is 45 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Pacita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Pacita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Pacita would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Myrsa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Myrsa works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing. Myrsa is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle to assist her motorcycle transport business.

Myrsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Jose Victor

texts.es:
José tiene una trayectoria de más de 41 años de dedicarse a la producción de leche y al ganado bovino. Y gracias a los créditos otorgados por la microfinanciera MiCrédito, ha podido invertir en su negocio con la compra de ganado, vitaminas, etc. Logrando así, convertirse en un reconocido productor de su zona por la calidad de su manufactura.     
Por ello, solicita un nuevo financiamiento que lo utilizará para la compra de terneros, esto le será de gran utilidad porque podrá continuar con la producción de leche y venta de los mismos. Además, con las ganancias planea mejorar su casa y la finca donde trabaja.
texts.en:
Jose has a path of more than 41 years of dedicating himself to milk production and cattle. Thanks to the loans offered by the microfinance institution, MiCrédito, he has been able to invest in his business by buying livestock, vitamins, etc. Succeeding in this way, he has become a renowned producer in the area because of the quality of his manufacturing.

Because of this, he requests a new loan, which he will use to buy calves. This will be very useful because he will be able to continue with producing milk and selling his products. Additionally, with the earnings, he plants to improve his house and the farm where he works.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
A loan of $1,500 is offered to Helena to improve her business. She is married and has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as fish, body loosener, shampoo, water, oils, slippers, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt and biscuits. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2014. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Helena independent, because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy fish, body loosener, shampoo, water, oils, slippers, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt and biscuits

loans.name: Pablo Alfonso

texts.es: PABLO ALFONSO: Es señor cortés, trabajador de 53 años de edad. Originario de Puerto Cabezas, casado con 4 hijos: 3 son mayores de edad y el menor de 23 años estudia su cuarto de carrera universitaria. Su esposa es ama de casa. Desde hace 25 años habita en una vivienda de tambo y madera. Con el propósito de brindarle a su familia una vivienda digna y segura, está solicitando su primer préstamo para cambiar la madera de su vivienda. Con su préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción: madera cepillada, zinc, clavos, postes de madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es establecer su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Pablo Alfonso is a courteous man and worker, who is 53 years old. He is originally from Puerto Cabezas and is married with 4 children. Three of his children are older, and his youngest child is 23 years old and is studying in university. His wife is a homemaker. For 25 years, he has lived in a house on stilts and made of wood. 

With the goal of offering his family a dignified and safe home, he is requesting his first loan to change the wood in his house. With his loan, he wants to buy construction materials, including brushed wood, zinc, nails, and wooden posts and to cover the workers’ costs. His dream is to start his own business.

loans.use: to change the wood in his house, which is built on stilts.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es: La Sra. Silveria es una mujer divorciada hace 7 años que vive y trabaja en Colomi, Cochabamba. Actualmente, para mantener a su familia trabaja sola, con la ayuda de sus 4 hijos que estudian en el nivel primario y le ayudan los fines de semana. El esposo la dejó, abandonando el hogar, sin ayudar con ningún gasto para la subsistencia de sus hijos. La clienta se dedica a la actividad de agricultura produciendo papa y haba en vaina como los principales productos de mayor demanda en el mercado. Los ingresos económicos, los cuales son destinados principalmente a cubrir los gastos de estudio de sus hijos, los obtiene a través de la venta de sus productos agrícolas (papa y haba) y el comercio de verduras y frutas. La Sra. Silveria requiere el financiamiento para comprar 1.5 cargas de camión de abono orgánico (gallinaza), 10 cargas de semilla de papa, productos agroquímicos y herramientas agrícolas para incrementar la producción y su nivel de ventas que le permitirán mejorar su nivel de vida y su situación social en beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silveria is a divorced woman who has spent 7 years living and working in Colomi, Cochabamba. At present, to take care of her family, she works by herself, with the help of her 4 children, who study in primary school and help her on the weekends. Her husband left her, abandoning their home, without helping with any of the expenses to raise their children. 

She is dedicated to agriculture, producing potatoes and broad beans in high demand in the market. Her income, which is used mainly to cover education costs for her children, is earned by selling her agricultural products (potatoes and broad beans) and by selling vegetables and fruits. 

Mrs. Silveria requests the loan to buy 1.5 truckloads of organic manure (hen droppings), 10 loads of potato seeds, agro-chemical products, and agricultural tools to increase her products and level of sales. This will allow her to improve her quality of life, as well as her social situation for the benefit of her family.

loans.use: to buy organic manure, potato seeds, agro-chemical products, and agricultura tos to increase her production for the benefit of her family.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es: Álvaro tiene la edad  de 61 años, está casado, vive con la esposa actualmente. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Álvaro is 61 years old. He is married and lives with his wife at present. With his loan, he hopes to buy fertilizers and fungicides and to pay workers for their assistance with his coffee crop. Additionally, he will buy some copperwood plants to reseed at the beginning of the rainy season, with the goal of increasing the density of plants in the area. In addition, taking advantage of the good fertility of the land and the conditions of the climate and other things favors cultivating coffee. 

With these improvements to his crop, he hopes to obtain a little more in earnings and, thus, to improve the conditions of his family’s life; to invest a little more in crops in the area; and to achieve some other goals. 

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans before in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan easily and at a very low interst rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies and copperwood trees.

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru: Зухра 26 летняя девушка из района Кубадиен. Она замужем и имеет детей. Зухра в районе живет вместе  мужем, тестю, свекровью и детьми. У нее дружная и не большая семья. Зухра в районе занимается растениеводством более 2 года. Она выращивает зелень. Зухра трудолюбивая девушка. Работать на земле тяжело, но Зухра несмотря ни на что продолжает работать в этом направлении. Она сейчас хочет обработать землю с минеральными удобрениями, чтобы готовить землю к новому посеву урожай. По этой причине Зухра обратилась за кредитом для приобретения минеральных удобрений. Она верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Zuhra is a 26-year-old young woman from the Qubadiyon district. She is married and has children. Zuhra lives in this district with her husband, father-in-law, mother-in-law and children. She has a friendly and small family. Zuhra has been involved in agriculture in the district for over 2 years. She grows greens. Zuhra is a hardworking young woman. It is difficult to work on the land, but, despite this, Zuhra continues to work in this field. She currently wants to cultivate the land with mineral fertilizers in order to prepare it for the new crop sowing. This is why Zuhra requested a loan to buy mineral fertilizers. She believes in You and Your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the course fees for his studies.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida previously accessed a 24,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of meat items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of pork, chicken and beef to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of pork, chicken and beef

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.ru: Это женщина Зайнура. Ей 29 лет. Она в районе Кубадиен живет вместе мужем, свекровью и детьми.  Ее муж в районе занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Сама Зайнура занимается растениеводством. Она выращивает зелень. Ей в работе помогает муж и свекровь. В течение 2 лет она постоянно сажает урожай. Сейчас Зайнура закончила посев и сейчас ей необходимо обработать землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить богатый и качественный урожай. Но для купли минеральных удобрений ей не хватает денег, и по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. В будущем Зайнура планирует расширить деятельность.
texts.en: This is Zaynura. She is 29 years old. She lives in the Qubadiyon region with her husband, mother-in-law and children. Her husband works as a farmer. Zainura grows farm crops. She grows  greens. Her husband and mother-in-law help her in her work. She has been planting seeds continuously for two years. At present Zaynura has finished planting and needs to treat her soil with mineral fertilizers in order to obtain high-quality, plentiful harvest. However, she lacks the funds to buy mineral fertilizers, which is why she has applied for a loan. Zaynura plans to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Tirso

texts.en:
Tirso is a hard-working entrepreneur from Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. He is 42 years old, and has two children who are currently in school. With her wife, Marina, they oversee the operation of their Jeepney unit, and his income from the business is helping supply their everyday needs and meet their expenses.

He has a one unit (14-16 person capacity) Jeepney, from which he is paid boundary* (daily quota) each day. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 7,000 in five days. 

Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater Jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain.

*In the boundary system, the driver pays the Jeepney owner a fixed amount (the “boundary”) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the “boundary,” minus what he paid for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay.

Tirso is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit. He will use the profit to improve the general living conditions of his family.

In the future, he hopes that his business will be continuously operating and growing. He dreams that his children will finish their studies and have sufficiency in everything and have good health. He meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 36-year-old married mother of four children, three in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Julieta has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Julieta requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gear for her business.

Julieta has been in this business for five years. In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her business.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 56 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in the district of Tsalenjikha. Both of them are unemployed and live in poverty. They get social assistance from the government institutions. 

Liana wants to start her own business in order to generate income. The Start Up Program, a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 500 USD. With the received credit, she will purchase fruits and vegetables to resell. She is very motivated to start and be involved in this business and to generate income to improve their living conditions. Liana awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables in order to resell and generate income

loans.name: Zhanylbubu

texts.ru: Жанылбубу, 47 лет, замужем, мать 6 детей. У нее среднее образование, занимается животноводством и полеводством, выращивая люцерну на 3,0 ГА собственной земли. Также в хозяйстве есть 9 лошадей, 25 овец. Ежемесячный доход Жанылбубу от бизнеса около 23,000 сом (KGS). Жанылбубу решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Жанылбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, что поможет ей улучшить благосостояние семьи и накопить на покупку холодильника.
texts.en:
Zhanylbubu is 47 years old, married and the mother of six children. She has secondary education and works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. She grows alfalfa on 3.0 hectares of own land. She also has nine horses and 25 sheep. Zhanylbubu's monthly income from the business is around 23,000 som (KGS). 

Zhanylbubu decided to turn to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business, which will allow her to increase her family's well-being and save money for purchasing a refrigerator.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to increase her herd

loans.name: Vilma Esperanza

texts.es:
Vilma, es una joven de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está casada y es madre de una niña de 3 años de edad, en su casa viven sus padres.

Vilma, trabaja como empleada domestica desde hace cinco años, ella se levanta muy temprano viaja una hora y media desde su casa para llegar hasta su lugar de trabajo, su madre cuida de la niña mientras ella sale a trabajar, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura. 

Vilma, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas, para trabajar en la siembra de granos básicos, ya que se acerca la temporada y tiene que preparar la tierra.

Vilma, sueña con que su esposo aumente sus cultivos de granos básicos, para obtener buenas cosechas y mejores ingresos, para darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Vilma is a young woman, who is 25 years old. She studed until the fifth grade. She is married and is the mother of a 3-year-old daughter. Her parents also live in her home.

Vilma has worked as a domestic employee for five years. She wakes up very early in the morning and travels for an hour and a half from her home to her place of work. Her mother takes care of her daughter while she goes to work. Her husband works in agriculture.

Vilma needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies for a harvest of basic grains, since the growing season is coming closer and she has to prepare the land.

Vilma dreams that her husband increases his crop of basic grains, so that he has a good harvest and better income. This will give her family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for growing basic grains.

loans.name: Marita

texts.es:
Marita, de 58 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casada y es madre de 2 hijos, los cuales aún viven con ella en su casa.

Marita, se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace muchos años, decidio iniciar con este negocio, porque lo podía hacer desde su casa, sin necesidad de andar vendiendo en la calle y le queda tiempo para hacer también los oficios del hogar, mientras su esposo se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años.

Marita, necesita el crédito para comprar medicinas y otra parte del dinero para comprar insumos agrícolas para que su esposo cultive maíz y frijol, para el consumo de su familia.

En el futuro quiere mejorar su vivienda, para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marita is 58 years old. She did not have the opportunity to study. She is married and is the mother of 2 children, who still live with her in her house.

Marita has been dedicated to selling food for many years. She decided to start this business because she could do it from her home, without the need to go selling in the street, and because she was left with time to also do the household chores while her husband was doing agriculture work, which he has been doing for 10 years.

Marita needs a loan to buy medicines and to buy agricultural supplies so that her husband can grow corn and beans for the family’s consumption.

In the future, she wants to improve her home to improve her family’s conditions of life.

loans.use: to buy medicines and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Oscar Engelberto

texts.es:
Oscar, de 56 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado y es padre de 3 hijos, todos son mayores de edad y son independientes, en su casa vive solo con su esposa y uno de sus hijos.

Oscar, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería desde hace 20 años, también trabaja de mecánico en un taller cerca de su casa, su hijo le ayuda en dichas actividades y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar.

Oscar, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes para la agricultura y para comprar repuestos de vehículos, para poder realizar su trabajo de mecánica.

Oscar, sueña con ampliar su taller y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 56 years old and has studied through the sixth grade. He is married and is the father of 3 children, all of whom are adults and are independent. In his house, he lives only with his wife and one of their children. 

Oscar has been dedicated to agriculture and livestock for 20 years. He also works as a mechanic in a workshop near his house. His son helps him with these activities, and his wife is dedicated to household tasks.

Oscar needs the loan to buy fertilizers for agriculture and to buy spare parts for cars to do his mechanic work.

Oscar dreams of growing his workhop and improving the conditions of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for agriculture and to buy spare parts for cars to do his mechanic work.

loans.name: Maria Lucinia

texts.es:
Lucinia, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casada y es madre de 2 niñas, de 5 y 6 años de edad, en su casa vive también su mamá.
 
Lucinia, tiene una pequeña panadería desde hace 5 años, trabaja en su casa y tiene dos empleadas para que le ayuden con el trabajo; la panadería es un negocio que genera buenos ingresos, es por eso que ella decidió dedicarse a eso, su esposo es quien se dedica a vender el producto, en el puesto que tienen en la ciudad.

Lucinia, necesita el crédito para ampliar más su panadería, ella quiere construir 2 cuartos más y pagar mano de obra, para que realice la construcción.

El sueño de Lucinia, es ampliar y mejorar el local de la panadería para trabajar mejor y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lucinia is 34 years old and studied through fourth grade. She is married and is the mother of 2 daughters, who are 5 and 6 years old. Her mother also lives in her home.

Lucinia has had a small bakery for 5 years. She works in her house and has two employees who help her with the work. The bakery is a business that generates a good income. Because of this, she decided to dedicate herself to it. Her husband is the one who sells the product in a stand they have in the city.

Lucinia needs the loan to grow the bakery more. She wants to built 2 more rooms and pay workers to do the construction.

Lucinia’s dream is to grow and improve her bakery so that she can work better and offer better service to her clients.

loans.use: to grow her bakery more.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is borrowing UGX 2,000,000 to buy organic fertilizer. He is a first-time borrower. He is married with seven children, five of whom are in school. 

Being in an area dominated by tea factories, he took to tea growing as an out-grower in order to supply the nearby factory. He works so hard and has been able to acquire enough to give his household a decent living and meet the family's financial needs.

He says he will use the loan money to buy fertilizer. He will sell his harvest to the tea factory. 

He is a hardworking man, and he appreciates UGAFODE and Kiva lenders for the job well done. He is assured of better returns with the loan input.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Keylo Akiles

texts.es: KEYLO AKILES: Es un joven jovial de 29 años de edad, originario de Puerto Cabezas, casado con 3 hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Desde hace 10 años habita en una  vivienda de tambo y madera. Es por eso que está solicitando su primer financiamiento para cambiar la madera, comprar materiales de construcción: madera cepillada, clavos, postes de madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener brindarle a su familia una vivienda seguro y con las condiciones adecuadas.
texts.en:
KEYLO AKILES is a cheerful young man of 29 years of age. He is originally from Puerto Cabezas. He is married with 3 teenage children that are in primary and secondary school. 

For 10 years, he has lived in a house on stilts, made of wood. That is why he is requesting his first loan to replace the wood. He also wants to buy the construction materials: milled lumber, nails, studs, and to cover labor costs. 

His dream is to give his family safe and suitable housing conditions

loans.use: to replace the wood of his house on stilts.

loans.name: Eltim

texts.en:
Eltim is a taxi driver. He is 23 years old and single and he lives with his parents. Eltim’s mother is a housewife, his father is a pensioner. They are living in Fuzuli region, but for 22 years they have been IDP (internally displaced persons) from Fuzuli city. 

It’s noted that Eltim is a taxi driver and now he needs a loan, in the amount of AZN 700 (Azerbaijan New Manat), to repair the tires of his taxi. Therefore, he has applied to Komak Credit Union. 

In the future, Eltim wants to change his car and, in his personal life, he wants to get married and have children. He says he is very thankful to the Kiva organization for its aid.

loans.use: to repair the tires on his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es: Ezequiel de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar,  el se dedica a la venta de minutas desde hace 22 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo, puertas pero con lo que obtienen de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de laminas, balcones, polines, puertas y pago de mano de obra y asi el y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Ezequiel is 54 years old and lives in his own house with his family. He has been dedicated to selling quick meals for 22 years. With what he earns from his sales, he succeeds in going forward. 

He wants to improve his home by changing the roof and doors, but with what he earns from his sales, he does not have enough money to do this. For this reason, he requests a loan to buy metal sheets, balconies, poles, and doors and to pay workers. Thus, he and his family will be able to vive more comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, balconies, poles, and doors and to pay workers.

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en:
Yahya is a 28-year-old married man from the city of Dier Al-Balah. He lives with his wife and one small son in a simple house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a very low income. Yahya would like to improve the family's living conditions and find an additional source of income.

Yahya took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy lights and headlamps to sell using a stall. This loan will help Yahya to increase his income and also his family living conditions. 

Yahya appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy lights and headlamps to sell using a stall

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es: María de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella se dedica a la agricultura principalmente cultiva maíz y frijol desde hace 20 años, comercializa sus productos cerca de su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. para continuar con sus cultivos y asi poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Maria is 53 years old and lives in her own house with her mother. She is dedicated to agriculture and mainly has grown corn and beans for 20 years. She sells her products near her home and has many clients because of her good prices. With what she earns from her sales, she succeeds in covering some household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, herbicides, etc. to continue with her crops. Thus, she will be able to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 32-year-old Lebanese married father of two children. He’s really attached to his family. Hussein and his wife work together to cover their expenses to live a respectable life. He owns a car wash. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay fees for his children's studies. One of his greatest dreams is to see them achieving higher positions. Hussein pursues his work so he can better support his family.

loans.use: to pay fees for his children's studies

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is 45 years old and has four children. She is married to Freddie, who helps to provide for the needs of the family. She operates a rug-making business, and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures. 

She mainly offers rugs, from the round palm-sized ones to the much larger doormats, as well as other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 in sales every week.

Merlyn is taking PHP 50,000 in loan assistance to buy supplies and other materials needed in her business. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and other items which are necessary to increase her inventory.

In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to the fullest extent. At the same time, she also wants to see her family in good health and in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anna Marie

texts.en:
Anna Marie is a 23 years old and single. She wanted to help her parents so she opened a sari-sari (variety) store business to earn a living. She requested a loan to buy additional grocery items to sell and increase her store inventory and have more sales.

Anna Marie wants to expand her business to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Zhyldyzkan

texts.ru: Жылдызкан, 28 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее высшее образование. В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2007 году, благодаря упорному труду Жылдызкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется корова, 10 овец, а на земельной доле мерою 1,26 Га собственной земли Жылдызкан выращивает хлопок для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жылдызкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян хлопка и скота. У Жылдызкан наработаны постоянные оптовые покупатели. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества скота, и накопить на покупку автомобиля.
texts.en:
Zhyldyzkan is 28 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has higher education. In search of additional income for her family, she is engaged in livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started a business in 2007. Thanks to Zhyldyzkan's persistent work, her farm currently has a cow and ten sheep. She grows cotton to sell on a plot of land of 1.26 hectares of own land. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Zhyldyzkan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase cotton seeds and livestock. Zhyldyzkan has returning wholesale customers. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock, and to save money for purchasing a vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase cotton seeds and additional livestock

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru: Анара, 47 лет, замужем, 4 детей. Образование - среднее. На протяжении 25 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, у нее есть 8 коров, 10 овец. Анара на сегодняшний день успешный предприниматель, она получает ежемесячную прибыль около 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анара обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для увеличения поголовья скота. На доходы от кредита она планирует и дальше развивать ее бизнес и улучшать благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Anara is 47 years old, married and has four children. She has secondary education. For a period of 25 years she has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. She has eight cows and ten sheep. Anara is a successful entrepreneur. She gets a monthly income of around 22,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Anara turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase two cows to increase her herd. She plans to use the income from the loan to further develop her business and improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase two cows in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban, de 25 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está soltero y vive junto a su madre, que se dedica a los oficios domésticos. 

Esteban, se dedica a trabajar de jornalero cuidando una finca, realiza diferentes actividades como sembrar plantas, limpiar maleza, entre otros oficios; desde pequeño realiza estas actividades, gracias a que el propietario de la finca, le dio la oportunidad y la confianza para trabajar con él.- A parte de dedicarse a esta actividad, también se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol.

El financiamiento del préstamo lo necesita para comprar 6 sacos de abono orgánico, fertilizante, semilla y para pagar mano de obra.- gracias al financiamiento podrá sembrar sus cultivos y lograr obtener una buena cosecha de granos.

Esteban, desea para el futuro remodelar su casa, porque se encuentra deteriorada y quiere repararla, también desea tener un mejor empleo, para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Esteban is 25 years old. He is a hard-working young man, who studied until fourth grade. He is single and lives with his mother, who is dedicated to household tasks.

Estevan is dedicated to working as a day laborer, taking care of a farm. He does different activities, such as sowing plants and cleaning weeds, among other tasks. He has been doing this activity since he was young, thanks to the owner of the farm, who gave Esteban the opportunity and has confidence in Esteban’s work with him. He is also dedicated to growing basic grains, such as corn and beans.

He needs the loan to buy 6 sacks of organic manure, fertilizers, and seeds and to pay workers. Thanks to the loan, he will be able to sow his crops and succeed in having a good harvest of grains.

In the future, Esteban wants to remodel his house because it is currently deteriorated and in need of repairs. He also wants to have a better job to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of organic manure, fertilizer, and seeds and to pay workers.

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.en:
Flordelina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Flordelina is 34 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Flordelina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Flordelina requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items and ingredients for her business.

Flordelina has been in this business for three years. In the future, Flordelina would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Hidoyatkhan

texts.ru: Хидоятхан, 45 лет, замужем, мать 6 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже больше 20 лет она занимается сельским хозяйство. Также по выходным топит баню, предоставляя банные услуги односельчанам. В хозяйстве Хидоятхан есть 2 коровы и 2 теленка. Благодаря упорному труду Хидоятхан, ее деятельность приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита позволят Хидоятхан построить сарай для скота, а в будущем - отремонтировать ее дом.
texts.en:
Hidoyatkhan is 45 years old, married and the mother of six children. She has vocational education. As a main income for her family, she has worked with farming for 20 years already. On the weekends she also heats a bath and provides a bathing service for her fellow villagers. 

Hidoyatkhan has two cows and two calves on her farm. Thanks to her persistent work, her business brings in around 15,000 som (KGS) per month.

With an aim to further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock to increase her herd. The income from the loan will allow Hidoyatkhan to build a cattle barn and in the future to renovate her home.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Yeremiya

texts.en:
Yeremiya comes from Kasubi, Katunguru Sub-County in Kasese District. He has a retail shop, and alongside that he deals in soft drinks sales.

He is aged 37 years. He is divorced and has five children who are his biological children, aged 12, 10, 8, 6, and 4 years old; three of them are school-going. He works for twelve hours a day and started this business in 2008 to generate income. He has rentals where he earns some money.

It’s his second loan cycle from the institution, and he is borrowing UGX 2,000,000 to complete the payment on a piece of land on which he will build a family house. This will save him the burden of renting.

His main challenge is limited working capital in the business. He sells to all categories of people in the local area. He is honest and hardworking. He thanks UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders for being there for him and other local people in his area, which has helped them develop their families and keep in service.

loans.use: to complete payment on a piece of land.

loans.name: Holiq

texts.ru: Холик мужчина в возрасте 58 лет. Он проживает вместе с женой в кишлаке Гул.  Холик  со  средним  образованием, занимается животноводством. Он  хочет купить скот. Из за нехватки своего собственного капитала обратился в Арванд за кредитом.Животноводством он занимается уже 25 лет. Для дополнительного дохода  своей семьи,  вместе с женой занимаются земледелием. Занимаясь куплей продажей скота накопив нужную сумму хочет  достигнуть своих целей,  а цель в старости  у каждого  это  прожить достойную старость со всеми удобствами  что можно создать в кишлаке. Он  хочет купить скот. Из за нехватки своего собственного капитала обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Он заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Holiq is a man of the age of 58. He lives together with his wife in the kishlak (village) of Gul. Holiq has secondary education and works with livestock breeding. He would like to purchase cattle. As he does not have sufficient money, he turned to Arvand for a loan. 

Holiq has worked with livestock breeding for 25 years already. As an additional income for his family, he works with farming together with his wife. He is engaged in animal sales so that he can save the necessary amount of money to achieve his goal. The goal for anyone is to, at old age, be able to continue to live a dignified life with all the comfort it is possible to get in the kishlak. 

Holiq would like to purchase cattle. As he does not have a sufficient amount of money himself, he turned to Arvand for a loan. He thanks you in advance for the support and faith.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Venenzio

texts.en:
This hardworking client, Venezio, comes from Kasubi village, Katunguru Sub-County in Kasese District. He is a fishmonger, aged 37 years old. He is married to one faithful wife with nine children who are his biological children. Only five are school-going.

He works for twelve hours a day and started this business in 2001. The purpose of his beginning a fishing business was to generate income. This is his second loan cycle from the institution. He has borrowed UGX 3,500,000 to buy fishing materials, including boats and nets. He is sure this will increase his productivity.

His main challenge is overfishing by the fishermen; this leads to low productivity, and this business is seasonal. His hope for the future is to buy a big chunk of land so that he can supplement the fishing with agriculture.

He is honest in the business and appreciates the support given to him by the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis, 49, is from Kireka village, Nyabubare sub county, Bushenyi District. He is a milk vendor and is married with four children, ages 24, 18, 16 and 14 years old, all in school. He works 10 hours a day and started this business in 2009 to generate family income and improve his family's wellbeing. Apart from the milk-vending business, he has a retail shop. This is his fourth loan and he is requesting UGX 2,000,000 to buy stock including corn flour, cooking fat, beverages, and toiletries to add to his retail shop business at Kireka village.  His main challenge is high debt since clients like to buy items and pay later. He is honest and he asks that UGAFODE Microfinance will always be there for him and other local people in his area to help them develop their families and keep in service. He is hard working.

loans.use: To buy retail stock items

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 60 years old, married and has six children, ages 25, 23, 20, 17, 13, and 10 years.  He comes from Nyakabare village, Bushenyi District. This is his first loan with UGAFODE. He does tea farming as his main source of income but earns a side income from raising cattle. He started tea farming in 1995 to have an income for his family. He borrowed money to buy fertilizer for his tea plantation. Most of his clients are tea traders and tea factories from in and around Bushenyi District. He hopes to own a large tea plantations in Kyamuhunga. He is affected by price fluctuations. He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000. He is hard working. He thanks lenders for the help he was given to improve his tea business and to sustain it.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has one child.

With a portion of this loan, Beatrice will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Beatrice plans to use the profits she gains this year to buy a cow.

In total Beatrice’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of six acres of land. They will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Michael's Group

texts.en:
Michael is 28 years old, married, and has four children. He is described as a very experienced farmer. As a group leader, Michael is representing his group of 11 farmers in Butere District in Kenya and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Michael's desire to earn enough to feed his family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this year’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

Michael and his group will receive a total of 10 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Keporé Group

texts.fr: Mariam, responsable du groupe est une femme battante. Cette brave dame transforme l'arachide en pâte que beaucoup de burkinabé utilise pour préparer la sauce. Elle est mariée et sans enfants. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter 1 sac et 1/2 d'arachide déjà décortiqué à 78 000 francs pour faire la pâte d'arachide pour vendre. le reste de son argent lui permettra d'acheter du bois pour griller l’arachide et des petits sceaux pour conditionner la pâte pour vendre. Après ses ventes, Mariam aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire de l'épargne mais aussi de soutenir son époux dans les dépenses de la maison.
texts.en: Mariam, the group’s leader, is a persevering woman. This hard-working person processes peanuts into a paste which many locals use for food sauces. She is married and has no children. She needs this loan in order to buy a bag and a half of shelled peanuts at 78,000 West African francs so as to make peanut paste for sale. The remainder of the funds will allow her to buy wood to roast the peanuts as well as small bowls to portion out the paste for sale. The revenue from her sales will allow Mariam to bolster her savings and also help her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 1.5 bags of peanuts in order to prepare peanut paste for sale.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 22-year-old single man from a village near Hebron city. He lives with his family in a simple humble house. He worked in a bakery for the past few years and gained very good experience.

Khalil would like to open his own business now and be independent. He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a dough machine for his new bakery. This will enable him to start his business and improve his income.

Khalil appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a dough machine for his new bakery.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo engages in a food vending business. He sells fried peanuts to the locals in his area. He is 44-year-old married man who lives in Dulag, Leyte.  A father of four children between the ages of 17 and 22 years. Aside from selling peanuts, he also runs a sari-sari (variety) store. 

He has requested a loan to buy ingredients like salt and peanuts, supplies like cellophane, and assorted stock for the store. This will enable Bernardo prepare more fried peanuts to sell and purchase additional stock for his store. In this way, he will be able to attract more buyers to the shop. Thus, his income could improve, and he could continue send his children to school.

Bernardo is determined to manage his business properly for the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like salt and peanuts, supplies like cellophane, and assorted stock for the store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur from Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is 50 years old, and has three children who are currently in school. She oversees the operation of the family's variety store and transportation business. Her income from the businesses is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

Aside from her sari-sari (variety) store, she has a one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, for which she is paid boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 every day.

Evelyn is requesting PHP 15,000 in loan assistance to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She will use the profit to improve the general living conditions of her family, since the income from their store is not enough.

In the future, she wants another jeepney unit to be used for their business operation. She hopes that her children will be able to complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking mother who goes out in the streets to sell her food snacks for some money. She is very diligent and she works hard for her income. Rosalinda has chosen to live her life single in Aloran. She applied for her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), and she appreciates the programs and services of the cooperative. 

Rosalinda is in need of additional capital to purchase more raw ingredients to increase production of the food snacks that she makes and sells. She asked financial assistance from PMPC in the amount of PHP 10,000 and is thankful for the financing of her capital needs. In addition, she wants to expand her business and to build good business management for her loyal customers. With her extra income, she deeply wishes to provide her family a decent and comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients to increase production of the food snacks that she makes and sells

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
This is Rolando. He previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in meeting personal, household and business expenses. 

He would like to apply for another 23,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

He meets up regularly with his co-fellowship members to share stories and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory.

loans.name: Mercyline's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Mercyline, who, as a group leader, is representing 14 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother of three children.  She is known in her community as a very friendly person.

Initially, Mercyline joined One Acre Fund in 2010 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Mercyline plans to send her children to school.

Among the 14 farmers in Mercyline's Group, a total of 5.75 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Erkin

texts.ru: Эркин родился  1977 года  в семье учителя. Эркин  с детства был очень трудолюбивым. Он  женат.   Его жена домохозяйка.  Эркин  занимается торговлей сухофруктов на базаре. Также  он  занимается дехканством. Он имеет в дехканском хозяйстве 2,5 гектара земли,   из них 0.5 га винограда, 2.0 га для выращивания    лука  и арбуза. Дополнительный доход  Эркина является животноводство . Он имеет три голов крупнорогатного  скот и шесть голов овцы. Эркин  обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес по земледелию. Так как сейчас сезон полевых работ. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за сотрудничество. .
texts.en:
Erkin was born in 1977 in a family of teachers. Since childhood, he has been very hardworking. He is married, and his wife is a housewife. 

Erkin works with selling dried fruits at the bazaar. He also works with dekhan farming. He has a dekhan farm of 2.5 hectares of land, of this 0.5 hectares is for grapes and 2.0 hectares for growing onions and watermelon. An additional income for Erkin is livestock breeding. He has three heads of cattle and six sheep.

Erkin turned to Arvand for a loan. He would like to expand his farming business, as it is currently the season for work in the field. He thanks Arvand in advance for the collaboration.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for the season

loans.name: Frida's Group

texts.en:
Frida is 49 years old, married, and has five children. She has been a farmer for four years and is said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Frida is the only one featured in the above picture, she is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Butere District, Kenya.

Frida started working with One Acre Fund in 2011. She decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, in that she has earned more profits from each harvest. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Frida’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will receive a five solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a 35-year-old woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with four children, ages 6-13.

For eleven years now, she has been farming rice to provide for her family. She is asking for a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizer, and to pay for hired help to start cultivating her land again.

Annabelle hopes that her crops will be profitable so she can provide food for her children, pay school fees, and reinvest in the same business in the future. Her farming business also allows her to help others by hiring them for work, so they in turn can help their families.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer, and to pay for hired help.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
Eleuterio tiene 64 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos y familiares en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, arroz, maíz, se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la ganadería y a la venta de leche fresca en el mercado de su distrito, Eleuterio con la ayuda de sus hijos también se dedican a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores como pavos, cerdos y gallinas. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una vaca para incrementar el stock de su negocio y de esta manera ofrecer su producción de leche en mayor cantidad, generándole ingresos adicionales para su familia lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eleuterio is 64 years old. He lives together with his children and family members in the Cayaltí district. The people there work farming sugar cane, rice, and corn. It is located in the Chiclayo province, Labayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Eleuterio works in the cattle industry and sells fresh milk at the market in his district. With the help of his children, Eleuterio also works raising and selling small animals such as turkeys, pigs, and hens. He has experience in this business and good references from the people in his district.

He has requested a loan to buy a cow to increase the stock of his business. In this way, he can produce milk in larger quantities, which will generate additional income for his family and allow him to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow to increase the stock of his business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is single and has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Angie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from a general store. Angie is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Angie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Jalyn

texts.en:
Jalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell in her fruit stand.

Jalyn has been in this business for four years. Jalyn earns additional income from pig fattening.

Jalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell in her fruit stand

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is applying for a loan of $1,500 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 26 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house, and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, Sprite, shampoo, soap, fish and rice. She is making good money from her sales, and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future. 

Josefina is living in town nearby the school; her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to shop, including students.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, Sprite, shampoo, soap, fish and rice

loans.name: Eliasaph

texts.en:
Eliasaph is a 58-year-old married father of two children aged two and four. These children are not yet in school. He is a tea farmer from Bununwa, Kitonjo, Kakanju Sub County in Bushenyi. He also trades in cattle as another source of income. He does not have any other children that live in his family, so he heads a nuclear family. 

Eliasaph started this tea farming business in 2002 to generate income for educating his two children. He works for eight hours a day. This is his first loan from this institution, and he is borrowing UGX 1,000,000 to buy fertilizer for his tea plantation. His clients are all factories in Bushenyi District.

He hopes to build a house. His business is mostly affected by pests and diseases. He is honest in the business.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Jesca A's Group

texts.en:
Jesca A. is 61 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by eight farmers in Butere District, Kenya.

Jesca A. has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as poor due to bad weather conditions, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.

Jesca A. also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Jesca A.'s Group will be able to receive a total of four solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Dorcas A's Group

texts.en:
Dorcas A. is 51 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for ten years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Dorcas A. is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by ten farmers in Butere District, Kenya.

Dorcas A. started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Dorcas A.’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of six acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Mary M's Group

texts.en:
Mary is married and has one child. She is a group leader representing her group of 13 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. 

With a portion of this loan, Mary  will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have an overall improved quality of life. She plans to use her profits to buy a cow.

In total Mary Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of one solar light.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season and solar lights

loans.name: Grace M's Group

texts.en:
Grace M., pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group formed by eleven farmers in Butere District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain respect from her community. She is married and has two children.

With a portion of this loan, Grace M. will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone. Grace M. plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total, Grace M.’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Joice L's Group

texts.en:
Joice L. is 56 years old and has nine children. She is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by nine farmers in Butere District, Kenya. 

Joice L. has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Joice L. also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and, therefore, save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Joice L.'s Group will be able to receive a total of five solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient, hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es: María de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 12 años, adicional también posee una pequeña tienda, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los alrededores de la zona donde reside, gracias a sus ventas es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, controles de plagas, fertilizantes, semillas, etc. y así mejorar sus ingresos económico para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is fifty-two years old, and lives in her own house with her family. For the past twelve years she has grown corn, and in addition she has a small store. When her crops are harvested they are stored in the barn shown in the photograph, to be later sold in the area around where she lives. Thanks to those sales she is able to cover some of her household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase manure, fertilizer, pest controls, seeds, etc. in order to increase her earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, pest controls, seeds etc.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is 54 years old and has six children. She has been a farmer for 15 years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Rose is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group, formed by 10 farmers in Butere District, Kenya.

Rose started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Rose’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Valor Group

texts.en:
Patulul is located near the Southwestern Coast of Guatemala, where the climate is warm and tropical. It is a bustling commercial area, and many of the women have businesses selling a variety of delicious tropical fruits and drinks like coconut juice.
